Title: [bookmarks] sort with folders first; then bookmarks
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.3a) Gecko/20021207 Phoenix/0.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.3a) Gecko/20021207 Phoenix/0.5; ; One little complaint i have about Phoenix.5 is that you cant sort the bookmarks; with folders first - like in an explorer window view. Would be nice if this; feature could be implemented :); ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.sort bookmarks; 2.; 3.; ; Actual Results:  ; folders are sorted alphabetically; mixed in with regular bookmark entries.; ; Expected Results:  ; folders should be sorted first; alphabetically - then display bookmarks sorted; alphabetically.

Title: remove Use Default (broken anyway) from Bookmarks Manager - Move; dialog has no title; increase the default size of the dialog
Description: willerg tolde me to do a new bug so here it is

Title: dragging bookmark from personal toolbar and releasing (on same bookmark or elsewhere) or clicking on bookmark menu then cancelling leaves button depressed/sunken when hovered
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20031111 Firebird/0.7+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20031111 Firebird/0.7+; ; when a bookmark is dragged from the bookmarks toolbar; and then it is released; over the place it was originally dragged from (so the cursor changes to a; cancel or no entry symbol); when the mouse is hovered over this bookmark; again; rather than being raised; the bookmark is still depressed (the mouse; however has been released).; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. click and drag a bookmark from the toolbar.; 2. while still dragging; replace the mouse over the place it was dragged from; (the same bookmark on the toolbar) so the cursor changes to no entry symbol.; 3. release the mouse button.; 4. hover the mouse over the button again.; ; Actual Results:  ; the bookmark on the toolbar is depressed when the mouse is hovered over it (but; not clicked); ; Expected Results:  ; the bookmark should appear raised.; ; using the default theme. the bug goes away if one clicks on a new tab. however; when one is viewing the same tab; the bug persists.

Title: Find As You Type pref shouldnt completely disable FAYT
Description: If I uncheck Use Find As You Type in Firebird; it also disables / and .  I; think its common to want / and  to work without wanting any alphanum key to; trigger FAYT; but I dont think anyone needs to disable the feature completely.; ; The UI pref should control accessibility.typeaheadfind.autostart; not; accessibility.typeaheadfind.

Title: iCab Profile Migrator
Firefox fails to set registry key in making itself the default browser
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7b) Gecko/20040317 Firefox/0.8.0+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7b) Gecko/20040317 Firefox/0.8.0+; ; In the latest Windows nightlies; Firefox creates a new key under; HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT named FirefoxHTML; to identify HTML files to be opened with; Firefox.; ; However; it fails to set the default value in that key-- that is; the friendly; name used for that filetype-- to anything. For some odd reason; this breaks; functionality in Thunderbird; which apparently expects there to be a name in; this key; as a result; Thunderbird display a dialogue box to download an HTML; file upon clicking any link. Im assuming there are probably other programs that; expect the key to have a name specified in its default value as well.; ; Setting the friendly name to HTML Document; as Seamonkey does in the; MozillaHTML key; fixes the conflict with Thunderbird.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Set one of the latest Firefox nightlies as the default browser.; 2. Navigate to the registry key HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\FirefoxHTML.; Actual Results:  ; The default value of the key is empty.; ; Expected Results:  ; The default value of the key is set to HTML Document or some similar description.

Title: User Agent string in the About Firefox dialog is cut off at the bottom
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7b) Gecko/20040319 Firefox/0.8.0+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7b) Gecko/20040319 Firefox/0.8.0+; ; The second line of text of the user agent string is cut off by about 1 or 2 px; at the bottom. If you select both lines of text a continue moving the mouse; downward; the text scrolls up slightly and you can see the bottom of the cut-off; parentheses.; ; Just a few builds ago; the user agent was in a scroll box. Now that box is gone; (and it looks better because of it).; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: address bar autocomplete does not fill in protocol to url
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.6) Gecko/20040227 Firefox/0.8; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.6) Gecko/20040227 Firefox/0.8; ; If I start writing url in address bar; it offers possible autocompletes. If I; chose one and I started writing with host address; it doesnt fill in protocol; until I press enter; which is problem; if I want to change some part of this; url. If I start writing with protocol; everything works ok.; Example:; url https://aa.bb.cc/xxx; I start writing aa; whole url appears in list but when I want to change xxx to; xxy; https:// disapears; so I have to fill it in again.; If I start to write https://aa; list is the same and I can edit any part of; url and protocol ramains where it should.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. url https://aa.bb.cc/xxx; 2. start writing aa; 3. choose from list one and try to edit it; ; Actual Results:  ; protocol part of url disapears; ; Expected Results:  ; Either protocol part should remain or protocol should not apear in the list. I; would prefer first possibility.

Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8a) Gecko/20040416 Firefox/0.8; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8a) Gecko/20040416 Firefox/0.8; ; Currently; the only way to close a non-bundled sidebar (e.g.; bugzilla/Blogupdates) is via the sidebar close button. We need to implement a; keyboard shortcut for it.; ; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: find-in-page accel should use search box; find-as-you-type
Description: I find myself using Firefox most of the time now; only going back to IE for a; few pages.. but I must say; that Find in Page dialog? thats the worst thing; Ive ever seen. Absolute worst thing ever.; ; -- Random influential user.; ; Suggestion:; ; 18:43 <shaver> the find-in-page accelerator should highlight the search box;;                select the find-in-page mode; and start type-ahead as you go; ; Issues:; ;  - there are other options in the current find dialog; some of which we might ;    want to preserve.  I think the only one that I care about is direction.  We;    could imitate emacs-isearchs case behaviour; too (ignore case unless a ;    capital letter is entered; and then become case-sensitive).; ;  - should the search box revert to the previous search setting when the search;    is over?  I think so; or at least the ctrl-J accel should put it back.  (I;    dont know anyone who uses the search box for find-in-page; and dont think;    I care to meet them!); ;  - whats the equivalent of dismissing the dialog in this new world?  I like;    hitting enter; but there might be other things.  Well have to give up;    the key-grab; etc.

Title: Incorrect ordering for tab and window menu items on the File menu
Description: The File menu currently looks like this:; ; New Window; New Tab; Open File...; Close Tab; Close Window; -----------; Save Page As...; Send Page...; -----------; Page Setup...; Print; -----------; Import...; Work Offline; ; Notice how the Window and Tab order isnt consistent? It should be this:; ; New Window; New Tab; Open File...; Close Window; Close Tab; -----------; Save Page As...; Send Page...; -----------; Page Setup...; Print; -----------; Import...; Work Offline; ; This is inconsistent with every other tab-capable browser Ive checked.

Title: In full screen buttons at top are not on edge of screen
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7) Gecko/20040614 Firefox/0.9; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7) Gecko/20040614 Firefox/0.9; ; When Firefox is in full screen; none of the buttons on the toolbar are clickable; at the very top of the screen. Fitts Law states that the edge of screens are; easier to click.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Set Firefox to Full Screen; 2. Put mouse cursor at very top of screen; 3. try to click any button; ; Actual Results:  ; Desired button was not clicked.; ; Expected Results:  ; Button should be clicked.

Title: Accesskeys for the submenu of View; Sidebar are active; however not underlined.
Description: Click on view; and go to Sidebar (or press Alt+V+E). Notice how the two items;; Bookmarks and History have no accesskeys underlined (as do the rest of the; menus). However; pressing B (or Alt+V+E+B) or H (or Alt+V+E+H) will activate the; respective menu item. So the accesskey is active; but not visible.

Title: redundancy in the wording in the first panel of installer
Description: In the first screen of the Windows Firefox installer says; ...Click Next to; continue the Setup program. at the end of the third paragraph. It then very; nearly repeats this exact text in the next paragraph when it says Click Next to; continue installing Mozilla Firefox 0.9.0.  ; ; This redundancy seems a bit; well; redundant.

Title: Use caching info from feed (ttl; skiphours; skipdays; updateBase; updateFrequency) for live bookmark expiration
Description: Livemarks currently dont use the existing scheduling and notification; mechanism; we should use it; and set the default schedule based on the TTL of; the feed.

Title: shortcut to jump mouse pointer to current position (focus/caret)
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8a3) Gecko/20040804 Firefox/0.9.1+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8a3) Gecko/20040804 Firefox/0.9.1+; ; I have my system set up in such a way that I use the keyboard for nearly; everything.  I use the numeric keypad to move the mouse around; and discovered; caret mode (F7) mode today.  Its great to be able to use the arrow keys to move; around the text in the page and select links and text in this way.; ; One thing I have problems with is clicking buttons.  While I can move the caret; onto the button; I cant click on it easily; and end up having to move the mouse; anyway.  If I had another shortcut (control-f7 or the like) to jump the mouse; pointer to the caret; I could then move the mouse slightly if necessary using; the keypad and then click on the button. This would help my navigation; significantly.; ; Thanks for a great product with great features.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Hit F7; 2. Move the caret around using the arrow keys; 3. Oops!  Gotta move the mouse to click on a button.; ; Actual Results:  ; Extra mouse movement required.; ; Expected Results:  ; Offer a shortcut to jump the pointer to the current caret location.

Title: ctrl+b should trigger bookmarks even from text areas
Description: Ctrl+B doesnt work reliably. It appears you have to focus the content; area first.

Title: Use Smooth Scrolling pref isnt migrated
Description: Steps to Reproduce:; ; 1. Import settings from Internet Explorer.; 2. Try to scroll.; ; Should smooth scroll; but it doesnt. IE has a Use smooth scroll preference; too in Advanced; its on by default.

Title: live bookmarks pick up favicon only after visiting an item
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20040913 Firefox/0.10; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20040913 Firefox/0.10; ; I have slashdot bookmarks as an rss feed. When I look at the headlines of the; feed they all have the generic firefox placeholder bookmark. Only after I have; visited a link of the feed is the icon changed to the sites icon.; This bug is not limited only to slashdots rss feed.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.visit http://www.slashdot.org; 2.add slashdots rss feed as a bookmark; 3.open slashdots rss feed bookmarks and look at their icons; they will all have; the generic icon.; 4. visit a link from the feed; then check the rss bookmarks again;  the slashdot; site icon will appear only next to the feed you just visited; ; Actual Results:  ;  the site icon only appears for the rss link that was visited; not any of the others; ; Expected Results:  ; The site icon should appear for all of the rss links.

Title: [Linux] ALT-digit tab-selection shortcuts conflict with accesskey assignments
Description: On Linux; the keyboard shortcut for selecting a tab based on its ordinal number; has been changed from CTRL-digit to ALT-digit; in accordance with bug #256635.; ; Unfortunately; these shortcuts conflict with web pages that use accesskey; attributes; since ALT is also the keyboard modifier for such page-specific; shortcuts. ; ; How to reproduce:; 1) Open a new Firefox window.; 2) In the first tab; open <http://www.mozilla.org/>.; 3) In a second tab; open <http://diveintomark.org/about/accessibility/>.; 4) In the same second tab; press ALT-1.; ; Expected behavior: Firefox should jump to <http://diveintomark.org/>; in the; same tab.; Actual behavior: Firefox switches to the first tab; showing www.mozilla.org.; ; See <http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/interact/forms.html#adef-accesskey> for more; information about the accesskey attribute.

Title: <tabbox> and tabs have no ID for use by overlays
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20041016 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20041016 Firefox/1.0; ; Without an excessive amount of javascript+DOM magic; overlays need elements with; IDs to bind to. However; the bookmark properties dialogs <tabbox> and; <tabpanels> elements have no ID for extensions to bind to; in order to enhance; the bookmark properties dialog.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.; 2.; 3.; ; ; ; ; Strangely enough; there are two tabs with IDs; ScheduleTab and NotifyTab;; that dont seem to actually exist in FF.

Title: Location bar autocomplete should show site root above each domains URLs
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20041001 Firefox/0.10.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20041001 Firefox/0.10.1; ; Quite oftern I go to type in a domain; and the only URLs that appear in the; history have a long path when all I really want is the domain. Or the domain; appears way down the list.; One example of how this can happen is if you get linked to articals on a site; more oftern than you visit the homepage.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Start typing the domain of a frequenty visited site to which you dont visit; the homepage/root that oftern.; Actual Results:  ; Many URLs for the domain appear; but they all have paths after the domain. E.G:; ; http://www.mozilla.org/products/firefox/; http://www.mozilla.org/developer/; ftp://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/thunderbird/release/0.9/; http://www.mozilla.org/products/thunderbird/; ; Expected Results:  ; The site root should always appear first in the list; even if it has never been; visited. E.G:; ; http://www.mozilla.org; http://www.mozilla.org/products/firefox/; http://www.mozilla.org/developer/; ftp://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/thunderbird/release/0.9/; http://www.mozilla.org/products/thunderbird/

Title: Set default pref in firefox.js for livemark refresh interval (livemark_refresh_seconds)
Description: Add the default pref so that it appears in about:config. See bug 259682.

Title: Also make previous history of originating tab available in tabs spawning from this tab
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; ; When browsing; you build up a crumb-path of pages in the previous button.; However; when you ctrl+click on a link; the new link does open in a new tab; but; the items in the previous-section of the originating page are not taken allong; with the new tab.; Personally; I feel it would be very nive to have the pages that belong to the; previous-section of the originating tab are also available in tabs that spawn; from this originating page so that - when you have closed the originating tab -; you can still navigate to the page you were looking at in the originating tab; before the page on which you ctrl+clicked to open a new tab; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; n/a; Actual Results:  ; n/a; ; Expected Results:  ; see details...; ; See details...

Title: Submitting a blank search string to the Dictionary.com search plugin doesnt navigate to the main page
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-GB; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041110 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-GB; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041110 Firefox/1.0; ; All other selections in the listing when chosen and then ENTER is pressed; they; go to the website concerned.  With Dictionary.com - nothing happens.  So I then; type in www.dictionary.com and things work.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Select Dictionary.com by using the down arrow in the Search engine selection box; 2.Press Enter; 3.Nothing happens.  Appears to need the link inserting somewhere.; ; Actual Results:  ; I remained on the URL page quote above which is; https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/enter_bug.cgi?product=Firefox&format=guided; ; Expected Results:  ; Visited website page http://www.dictionary.com; ; Cant think that anymore information is available to me.

Title: JavaScript Console Error: Opening Non-Sidebar Windows in the Sidebar (searchBox has no properties)
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; ; If a window from an extension (or from a browser window that cannot be opened; from the sidebar without a specific extension) is opened in the sidebar; an; error will show up in the JavaScript Console.  I have noticed this both in my; current profile; and in a new one.  You may need to set; javascript.options.showInConsole to true in about:config for this to show up.; ; The error is as follows:; ; Error: searchBox has no properties; Source File: chrome://browser/content/browser.js; Line: 3330; ; And the line is:; ; searchBox.focus();; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Install an extension which allows you to open up a window in the sidebar; (Download Manager Tweak; EMButtons; QuickNote; etc.).; 2. If not set up to do so by default; set up the extension to open up a window; in the sidebar.; 3. Open up the window affected by the extension; which should now open up in the; sidebar.; Actual Results:  ; The error mentioned above is generated in the JavaScript Console.; ; Expected Results:  ; The error mentioned above should not be generated at all.

Title: Inefficient code in updateAttribute function of the bookmark properties window
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; ; If statements are redundant. Patch to follow.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Take a look at the code at; http://lxr.mozilla.org/aviarybranch/source/browser/components/bookmarks/content/bookmarksProperties.js#348

Title: Inconsistent / hard to access keyboard shortcut for Save Link As... in context menus
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; ; Load any website.; Right-click on any link.; The context menu that pops up; has the following:; ; Save Lin&k As... (&k meaning the letter k is underlined; signifying a; shortcut key).; ; This is rather difficult to hit; especially if the mouse is in the right hand;; as this would require either taking right hand off the mouse to press k on; keyboard; or pressing it with the left hand; by moving it off the normal typing; position.; ; The reason bug report says inconsistent is because in majority of; applications; on the File menu; the Save As... shortcut is triggered by the; a hotkey; such as Alt-F-A in order to File->Save As.... Firefox itself uses; the same hotkey for Save As... in the File menu.; ; ; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. open www.mozilla.org; 2. right-click any link; 3. notice Save lin&k As... displayed; ; Actual Results:  ; To save the link; I had to take my right hand off the mouse and press the k key.; This was very difficult and wasted 0.5seconds of my time; ; ; Expected Results:  ; I wanted to see the context menu like this:; ; Save link &As...; which would require hitting a key in order to save as.; Since my other hand is already positioned on the left side of the keyboard;; right-clicking a link and pressing a to save it is easy.; ; I propose changing the default keyboard hotkey for Save Link As...; ; from k (currently); ; to a.; ; The menu would look like this:; Save Link &As...; where &A means underlined letter.

Title: Remove colon : from the title of the Page Info dialog (or make it unselectable)
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8a6) Gecko/20041207 Firefox/1.0+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8a6) Gecko/20041207 Firefox/1.0+; ; Sometime back; Mozilla did not allow you to select (and copy) the text contained; in the Page Info dialog (and other dialogs).  However; now that the information; is selectable; it can be useful for copying pertinent data from a page.; ; In the case of the title contained in the Page Info dialog; there is an added; colon to the title.  It would be useful; for the purposes mentioned above to; remove this colon; so a clean copy of the title can be obtained a little easier.; ; The only problem I see in this is that the colon is useful to represent; information contained bellow similar to the following:; 1) info; 2) info; So Im not sure if it would be necessary to make a slight visual adjustment to; make up for removing this.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: Image alt text should be selectable when image doesnt display
Description: When the option Load images is turned off; and the alt text is displayed in; place of all images; this alt text should behave as if it were normal text; in; particular; it should be possible to select (and copy & paste) it or parts of it.

Title: Should be able to open new tab by middle-clicking Go button
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0 StumbleUpon/1.999; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0 StumbleUpon/1.999; ; You should be able to open a new tab and going to the URL on the address bar and; pressing on the go button with the middle key on the mouse.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. type in url; 2. press middle key on go button; 3. nothing opens; ; Actual Results:  ; nothing opens; ; Expected Results:  ; opened a new webpage thats in the address bar in a new tab

Title: Menuitem description not exposed
Description: a XUL menuitem can now have a description. This was done in bug 235872.; We should expose this in the accessible description of a menu item.; ; At the moment; the only place I see this used is in the non-native print dialog.

Title: RFE: `Copy Frame Location on Frame Context Submenu
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8b) Gecko/20050125 Firefox/1.0+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8b) Gecko/20050125 Firefox/1.0+; ; Also; see the related bug 185239 to add print this frame option (which I have; voted for).  Also; note the use of the same keyboard shortcuts (F & W) on; multiple items in the frame submenu.  Should that be filed seperately?; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Secondary click on a page within a frame with your pointing device.; 2. Select the `This Frame item.; 3. The submenu will appear.; Actual Results:  ; The submenu currently looks like this:; ; T_h_is Frame->Sho_w_ Only This Frame;               Open Frame in New _W_indow;               Open Frame in New _T_ab;               ------------------------;               _R_eload Frame;               ------------------------;               Bookmark This _F_rame...;               Save _F_rame As...;               ------------------------;               _V_iew Frame Source;               V_i_ew Frame Info; ; ; Expected Results:  ; T_h_is Frame->Sho_w_ Only This Frame;               Open Frame in New _W_indow;               Open Frame in New _T_ab;               ------------------------;               _R_eload Frame;               ------------------------;               Bookmark This _F_rame...;               Save _F_rame As...;               _C_opy Frame Location;               ------------------------;               _V_iew Frame Source;               V_i_ew Frame Info; ; (I have located the item at the end of the appropriate item category where `Copy; Link Location is on the link context menu.)

Title: javascript strict warnings in nsBrowserContentHandler.js

Title: Extraneous stylesheet rules for table in about:

Title: Search boxs Add engines should support link modifiers

Title: nsBrowserContentHandler.js has wrong constant for NS_BINDING_ABORTED
Description: 62 const NS_BINDING_ABORTED = 0x80020006;; ; but NS_BINDING_ABORTED is really 0x804b0002

Title: Middle click on proxy icon in location bar should paste URL
Description: Traditional behaviour on Unix is to allow pasting a URL into the content area; to load a URL from the current X11 selection. This feature tends to confuse; new users (see the heated discussion in  bug 96972 for example) and conflicts; with autoscroll (which is also activated by middle click in the content area).; Autoscroll has been disabled by default on Unix because of this (bug 216899).; ; In Mozilla there is another way to load a URL from the X11 selection: middle; click paste on the proxy icon in the location bar. This allows quick paste of; URLs without the need for middlemouse.contentLoadURL and thus can be used even; if autoscroll is enabled. I would like to see this in Firefox as well.; ; Relevant discussion:; ; bug 85677 - middle click in content behaviour; bug 111337 - corresponding bug for Mozilla; bug 216899 - ContentLoadURL vs autoscroll; ; Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.7) Gecko/20050414 Firefox/1.0.3

Title: Warn when entering chrome:; javascript:; and data: URLs into address bar
Description: Josh Aas is concerned that once bug 304690 and bug 305374 are fixed (but before; bug 286651 is fixed); users who encounter chrome:// URLs in AIM; IRC; QuickTime;; or email will wonder why clicking the link didnt work and then paste it into; Firefoxs address bar.; ; We agreed that it made sense to block the clicks from external applications; silently; and warn users if they do paste a chrome:// URL into the address bar.

Title: null dereference crash in markPageAsTyped
Description: This is a toolkit bug; but theres no Toolkit:History.; nsGlobalHistory::MarkPageAsTyped doesnt null check aURI; so passing null (from js; in this case) results in a crash.

Title: File System Folders
Description: Reimplement live File System Folders

Title: Fill out history API
Description: Many functions are missing that allow more direct access to the history service; such as adding history items or changing some variables such as visit counts.

Title: the home button does not have a disabled style rule; even though the image exists
Description: Found while testing bug 323686.

Title: Delete invalid place: folder URIs on vacuum
Description: We create place: URIs to identify folders; but never delete them. On cleanup; we should look for place: folder URIs that reference old folders and delete them as well.

Title: mouseup on outside calendar breaks date range selection
Description: Open up places.  Start to select a range of dates.  But do so in this way:; ; 1. In the places calendar widget; select a day with no history.; 2. Mouse down on a day in the middle of the calendar.; 3. Move the mouse around to highlight a specific range of dates that includes at least one day of history.; 4. Move the mouse outside of the calendar widget and mouse up.; ; From here; the calendar does not set the range of dates to look at; because were still seeing the day of history in step 1.  Also; you can mouse around in the calendar widget and it will act like your mouse is clicked and you are dragging it arround; but your mouse is still up.

Title: pushing mutliple mouse buttons selects mutliple days in calendar widget
Description: 1. Left mouse down on a day in the calendar.; 2. While holding the left mouse button down; right mouse down.; 3. Release the left mouse button (left mouse up).; 4. Release the right mouse button (right mouse up).; ; Notice that two days are selected in the calendar.; ; You can reverse steps 3 and 4 and get the same result.; ; For a little bit of oddness; you can get three days selected if you do this same process with the middle mouse button:; ; 1. Left-mouse down.; 2. Middle-mouse down.; 3. Right-mouse down.; 4. Left-mouse up.; 5. Middle-mouse up.; 6. Right-mouse up.; ; And three days are selected.  Id bet that if I had more mouse buttons; I could get more days selected.; ; Note that if in that last scenerio; you do step 1; then 3; then 2; you get the autoscroll graphic underneath the context menu.  Maybe you want to disable the autoscroll in the calendar widget?

Visit one of the links in the bookmarks toolbar.; 3. The beautiful icon is suddenly replaced by an ugly red-orange-pink one with a terrible design.; ; Expected behaviour: Firefox should not change icons (at least) in the bookmarks toolbar.

Title: Dont track non-toplevel redirects
Description: Bug 328928 added a toplevel flag to document redirect. We can save a tiny bit of effort by not tracking redirects for these pages.

It should also be possible for localizers to set the first day of the week.; ; From http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/browser/components/places/content/places.xml#152; ; // localized stuff; FIXME: move somewhere else;         this._pref_firstDayOfWeek = 0; // 0 = Sunday; 1 = Monday;         this._pref_dayHeaders = [S; M; T; W; T; F; S];;         this._pref_shortMonthNames = [Jan; Feb; Mar; Apr; May; Jun;;                             Jul; Aug; Sep; Oct; Nov; Dec];

Title: Bookmark folders with the same name merged after import
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060309 Firefox/1.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060309 Firefox/1.5; ; If there are two or more folders with the same name (in the same place in the hierarchy) they get merged when importing to a Places-enabled build. I.e. import results in only one folder containing the items from all the old folders.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: META REFRESH updates recorded as visits in Places History; causing duplicates
Description: It seems that page updates triggered by META REFRESH are recorded as individual visits in Places History every time they occur. This causes a lot of clutter if you happen to have such a page open for a while; especially if the pages refresh frequency is high. I suppose it unnecessarily bloats the history database as well.; ; I think it would be a lot better if Places only recorded page visits performed actively by the user.; ; How to reproduce:; 1) Open the Places window and select History.; 2) Open a page that uses META REFRESH; e.g. the example URL.; 3) Leave the History open for some time; minimum 10 minutes.; ; Actual behavior: Every automatic update is recorded as an individual visit to the same page.; ; Desired behavior: There should only be recorded one visit to the page; namely the original visit. The automatic updates should not be recorded.

Title: browser.search.defaulturl not removed from locale
Description: browser.search.defaulturl was removed from prefs but not region.properties. Im assuming this was an oversight but apologies if it was deliberate.

Title: Setting browser.chrome.favicons to false still displays site icons
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060321 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060321 Firefox/1.6a1; ; browser.chrome.favicons is set to false.  Somehow; however; cached icons are still displaying next to a few bookmarks.  The problem is that I have retained the same prefs.js throughout any upgrade process; and so the aforementioned setting hs remained false the entire time.  Because of this; I dont know how cached favicons could have somehow crept into my bookmarks.html.  More likely; these favicons are not actually cached; because they do not display in the lastest official build. I do not know their source if they are not in bookmarks.html.; ; I see this in both Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060321 Firefox/1.6a1 and Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060321 Firefox/2.0a1.; ; This bug is not present in official release 1.5.0.1.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: Cursor in calendar causes wrong selection
Description: In the calendar the cursor resize is used. I think w-resize.; This causes a weird problem here: when I hover over a day on the calendar the right date is selected but when I click it selects the date to the left.; So: I click on 29 March but 28 March gets green.; I think another cursor would be better.

Description: Currently; it doesnt appear to remember these.

Title: convertSherlockFile needs to set ._type
Description: Converted files dont have the correct type property.

Title: After update warn users specifically of firewall problem
Description: See bug 308979.  Many users refuse to believe a firewall causes failure to connect after an update; and blame Firefox.  For some; no amount of persuasion suffices.; ; If the program is smart enough to detect a connection failure; the user is more likely to believe a well-placed error message than random users on a support forum.  After an update is completed the warning should state that the firewall configuration may need editing and that the user should consult the firewall help documentation (or preferably; Firefox documentation -- see bugs 308979 and 308982).

Title: Crt-select on tables; could give some summary info in the statusbar
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; ; Ctr-selecting a range of cells; and rows from a table; could give the user more information in the window.status bar.; ; It would be nice to be able to crt-select a range of rows in a table; and then have a count in the statusbar.; ; Other functions could be a Sum(). or MAX()/MIN() function on a selected column.; ; This enhancement is non intrusive; and will only show to the people allready working with the crt-select feature.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.select a bunch of table rows; with crtl-click/drag; 2.Wonder how many of them you selected; 3.hope for the statusbar to show this to you.

Title: cursor shouldnt change when the microsummary service loads content
Description: When the microsummary service loads page content via hidden iframes in the browser window; the cursor changes to a busy state for the duration of the load (and then remains stuck on busy because of bug 337038).  It shouldnt change state at all.; ; Gavin notes nsDocShell::OnStateChange and nsEventStateManager::UpdateCursor; one or both of which might need to be somehow suppressed for microsummary-originated loads in order to fix this problem:; ; http://lxr.mozilla.org/seamonkey/source/docshell/base/nsDocShell.cpp#4713; http://lxr.mozilla.org/seamonkey/source/content/events/src/nsEventStateManager.cpp#2313; ; But the fix for bug 339543 will make these loads much faster; perhaps causing noticable changes to the cursor state to become much rarer and thus less of a problem.

Title: in the microsummary tooltip; show last updated
Description: in the microsummary tooltip for a bookmark; show Updated x [minutes|hours|days] ago; sort of how on news.google.com; they have:  Auto-generated 12 minutes ago; ; suggestions:  it would be the last line of the tooltip.; ; this came up at myks talk.; ; ccing the usual suspects.

Title: allow sites to specify minimum update frequency
Description: A Yahoo! guy I talked to at OSCON last week asked if the microsummary service provided any mechanism for sites to limit how frequently the service downloaded pages to regenerate their summaries using generators.  Currently; we dont have such a mechanism.; ; He suggested that we implement one; so sites can defend themselves against the load from popular generators which try to refresh microsummaries too frequently.  That seems like a reasonable request; since a generator might well set its update interval setting to a very low number and then become popular; causing problems for sites that get hit with too much traffic.; ; Since the issue is the downloading of pages; which are virtually always HTML; perhaps we could define a meta tag (and HTTP response header equivalent) that specifies the minimum update interval.  The microsummary service would sniff that value after downloading a page and make sure the next update honors it; regardless of what the generator requests.; ; We would probably want the sites setting to also override the browser.microsummary.updateInterval preference (which can be set to as little as one minute) and perhaps also the hardcoded default setting (every half hour).; ; But if we ever enable users to set a specific; explicit update interval for individual bookmarks; then we might decide to prioritize that over the sites preferences.

Title: [Mac] Add site icons / favicons to bookmarks toolbar buttons
Description: Since a theme refresh is being explored for Firefox 2; I thought this was worth revisiting.; ; Ive created a patch to add icons to the bookmarks toolbar; and personally I think it looks much better with them. Maybe you guys will disagree. I think the icons break up what is otherwise a long bar of grey text; and make the individual button regions more defined. Theyre also practical; as they make an easier visual target of the button youre after. The only downside is they take up a little more room on the toolbar.; ; Comparison screenshots follow; then a patch.

Title: Header requests for microsummaries should be as small as possible
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-UK; rv:1.8.1) Gecko/20061010 Firefox/2.0; Build Identifier: ; ; Header requests for fetching microsummaries (which are typically tiny) should be as small as possible; to reduce the impact of requesting them. Should we be able to remove any unnecessary entries in the header; we can lower the burden of individual requests; and thus be able to request them more frequently.; ; Task: Look at the headers sent when requesting microsummaries; identify any unnecessary ones; and remove them.; ; (we may also wish to evangelise microsummaries with server/server-side software makers; to get them to reduce the amount of headers sent with the microsummary reply).; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: Sessionstore should ignore popup windows
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a2pre) Gecko/20070129 Minefield/3.0a2pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a2pre) Gecko/20070129 Minefield/3.0a2pre; ; Sessionstore should ignore page generated popup windows. It is simply annoying if you have forgotton that a popup is open and you closed your main window to find out that there is still a popup window. In this case your sessionstore will only contain this popup window but not the content of the main window. So you lose your complete session.; I think it is safe to assume that popup windows almost never contain important data so storing them is rather useless.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Visit a page where you can open a popup window e.g. http://www.mozillazine.org/forums/; 2. Open the smilie popup.; 3. Close the main window; 4. Close the popup; 5. restart firefox; Actual Results:  ; Only the smilie window is restored; ; Expected Results:  ; The last closed main window should be restored

Title: Firefox windows trunk (zip) builds take an unreasonable amount of time to start up
Description: This may be a dupe of; or related to; bug 380134. But Ill file it anyway; because its making finding recent regression ranges on the trunk impossible for me.; ; 1. Download a windows trunk zip build; eg:; http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/firefox/nightly/2007-05-12-04-trunk/firefox-3.0a5pre.en-US.win32.zip; 2. Extract the zip to desktop; 3. Navigate into the dir to find firefox.exe; right click on the file and choose Create Shortcut.; 4. Right click on the newly created shortcut and choose Properties.; 5. At the end of the Target filed; add: -profilemanager; 6. OK the shortcut properties dialog.; 7. Double-click on the recently-created shortcut to firefox.exe. The profile manager should appear.; 8. Make a new profile; and choose to start minefield.; ; Expected:; - Browser starts up; ; Actual:; - Browser eats 99% CPU time and never starts up (as far as I can see; anyway).

Title: Migrating from a bookmarks.html (or another browser) without a bookmarks toolbar folder could be problematic
Description: with bug 380999 migrations clear bookmarks before importing.  Therefore; migrating from a bookmarks.html that doesnt have a personal toolbar folder could be problematic.; ; This needs more investigation before we decide if its really a problem or not.

Title: Feed sniffing should apply to fewer mime types
Description: Right now; we sniff all loads in the content area; subframes; or <object> for possibly being feeds.; ; This seems wrong to me.  I see no reason to sniff an image/png or video/whatever or application/x-msword file to see whether it might be a feed.  What we do now is bad for the web in general; not to mention a possible performance drag.; ; Realistically; this code should only sniff types that are likely to be feeds.  A few of the relevant XML types; text/plain; the maybe text type; and text/html should cover it; I suspect.

Title: Text referencing Talkback in about:license should be removed
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9a8pre) Gecko/2007091504 Minefield/3.0a8pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9a8pre) Gecko/2007091504 Minefield/3.0a8pre; ; It is my understanding that the Talkback component has been permanently replaced by the Breakpad crash reporter. Therefore; the text on the about:license page (under Exceptions) pertaining to Talkback should be removed because it is no longer included. It reads:; The Talkback crash-reporting module (Copyright  1998-2005 SupportSoft; Inc. All Rights Reserved.); ; Reproducible: Always

Title: esc key does not cancel the bookmark this page action (starring popup)

Probably worth its own bug if it doesnt exist yet.

Title: Visit count doesnt add correctly with folder(s) in folder
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; fr-CH; rv:1.8.1.7) Gecko/20070914 Firefox/2.0.0.7; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a9pre) Gecko/2007092204 Minefield/3.0a9pre - Build ID: 2007092204; ; The visit count of a folder add the visit count of each site directly in it. It doesnt count the (aggregated) visit count of folder in it.; ; E.g; Folder 1 : VC = 10 (expected 15); --> Site 1: VC = 5; --> Site 2: VC = 5; --> Subfolder: VC = 5 (correct);     ---> Site 3: VC = 2;     ---> Site 2: VC = 3; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Add a subfolder in a folder; 2. Add a site with Visit count != 0 in this subfolder; 3. Visit count for folder wrong

Title: Clearing browsing history on shutdown causes previous session to be forgotten
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a8) Gecko/2007091216 GranParadiso/3.0a8; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a8) Gecko/2007091216 GranParadiso/3.0a8; ; When I close the browser with the option set to prompt me to clear private data on shutdown and browsing history is checked; the previous sessions tabs are not restored.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open Gran Paradiso Alpha 8 with a blank profile (I used to profile manager and not a clean install); 2. Go to Tools -> Options; 3. Change the When Gran Paradiso starts option to Show my windows and tabs from last time; 4. In the Privacy tab; check the box next to Always clear my private data when closing Gran Paradiso (leave the Ask me before clearing private data option checked); 5. Have any combination of tabs other than just about:blank open (I used about:mozilla); 6. Click the X to close Gran Paradiso; 7. When the dialog to clear private data appears; make sure that Browsing History is checked and click Clear Private Data Now; 8. Open Gran Paradiso again; Actual Results:  ; Gran Paradiso opens with only a blank tab.; ; Expected Results:  ; It should restore the tabs from the previous session according to the option set in Step 3.

Title: for pre-beta users; Tags under Most Used Tags in Places folder on toolbar only shows favicons for sites under tags

The links work but you wont know what you are selecting. See attached screenshot.; ; This was seen on Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X; en-US; rv:1.9a9pre) Gecko/2007101504 Minefield/3.0a9pre but I saw it in yesterdays build; as well.

Title: dont search by tag in the bookmarks sidebar?
Description: dont search by tag in the bookmarks sidebar?; ; in bug #393584; faaborg writes:; ; I think it is important for the user to understand why their results match the; search they entered.  So I would argue that the search field in the bookmarks; sidebar should only match against title; since that is the only information; displayed.; ; if they want to search against everything else; they can use the bookmarks; organizer; or the location bar.; ; note; with my landing for bug #395462 (see bug #395452 for the patch); we are now searching on tags.

Title: FindLastVisit returns true when it ought not to.
Description: In two places in FindLastVisit; we do NS_ENSURE_SUCCESS(rv; rv); but FindLastVisit returns a boolean.  If it fails; we should be returning false...

That; some times it isnt so good because for example if you want to have an html file with certain bookmarks to give it to a friend or even more to keep it for your self; you have to have Dreamweaver or something else installed to PC to edit the html file. As a result i think it would be very nice; when you select certain bookmarks in the Library; to add; in the drop down menu; the menu Export selected Bookmarks...  with options Backup and Export HTML (Of course this would be very nice for the History too).; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Go to Library; 2. Go to your bookmarks section; 3. Select some bookmarks; 4. Right Click; 5. There is no options for exporting the selected bookmarks

Title: TabCandy stacks appear at different sizes depending on # of tabs in set
Description: Created attachment 466301; screenshot of tabsets; ; I have two tabsets shrunk down to the same size -- the one with three tabs flipped over to stack appearance at that size; but the one with two tabs didnt.  Maybe at a certain size; regardless of how many tabs are in the set; a tabset appearance should switch to stack?

Title: Prompt to save your tabs when closing Firefox should mention tabs hidden by tab candy
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b4) Gecko/20100818 Firefox/4.0b4; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b4) Gecko/20100818 Firefox/4.0b4; ; When I close Firefox; I get the prompt: Do you want Firefox to save your tabs for the next time it starts? I glance at the tab bar; see nothing I want to save and so click quit (without saving). Oops; I forgot tab candy is hiding some of my tabs in tab groups. Ouch; my hidden tab groups are now gone.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Open multiple tabs.; 2.Organize them into groups via tab candy.; 3.Choose a group (returning to main window).; 4.Close window and get prompt.; 5.Forget there are hidden tabs and choose not to save for next session.; Actual Results:  ; Hidden tabs are gone.; ; Expected Results:  ; Remind me of the hidden tab groups; so I could make informed decision whether to save.; ; This would be partially mitigated by fixing bug 589010 (and my also moving the Group your tabs button to the left side of tabbar where Id be more likely to notice it when only a few tabs are showing). But I still think a warning should be added to this prompt; due to the potential loss of many open (but hidden) tabs. Something like:; Do you want Firefox to save your tabs for the next time it starts? (Note that you have hidden tab groups.)

Title: XML/XSL rendering after using Panorama fails
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b4) Gecko/20100818 Firefox/4.0b4 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0C); Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b4) Gecko/20100818 Firefox/4.0b4 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0C); ; I have my homepage set to a local XML file.  When I create a tab group using a couple of Internet URLs; then open a new tab and click the icon for my home page; the URL displays in the address bar but the page does not load.  A local HTML file is not a problem; only an XML file.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Set homepage to a local XML file.; 2.Navigate to an external website.; 3.Open a second tab and to go another external website.; 4.Create a tab group.; 5.Press Escape to open a new tab.; 6.Click the Home icon in the toolbar.; Actual Results:  ; The URL displays in the address bar; but the rest of the screen is blank.  Either the file type is not allowed; or it never finishes loading.  Clicking the Refresh icon has no effect.; ; Expected Results:  ; The XML file should have displayed.

Title: Switching from a New tab to a Tab Group with only 1 tab causes Tab Candy Animation Error
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b6pre) Gecko/20100901 Firefox/4.0b6pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b6pre) Gecko/20100901 Firefox/4.0b6pre; ; Switching to tab is broken when you use a new tab to switch to a tab group with only 1 tab. ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open some tabs (App Tabs will not affect the bug); 2. Group them into 2 groups ; 3. 1 group must contain only 1 tab. (It does not matter how many tabs the other group have as it will not affect the bug); 4. You group 4 tabs into the other group; 5. Open a new tab in the other group; 6. Use it to switch it to the group with only 1 tab ; 7. You will discover a error in Tab animation in Panorama.; ; note: It does not affect the bug if you get the group with 1 tab by closing the other tabs in that group. you will end up with the same bug if you follow the STR. ; ; Important: Must use New Tab to switch to group with 1 Tab. If you switch to a group with more than 1 tab; or if you dont use a new tab to switch tab; you will not get the error/bug.

Title: Position of Panorama button suggests TabCandy being a function of the tab bar
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b7pre) Gecko/20100916 Firefox/4.0b7pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b7pre) Gecko/20100916 Firefox/4.0b7pre; ; The current position of the TabCandy (or Panorama button; take your pick) suggests to the user that whatever function it performs would be dependent on the tab bars content; instead of controlling it.; ; The general interface hierarchy is; 1. Task bar (multiple windows); 2.  > Window (multiple tab bars/groups); 3.   > Tab bar/group (multiple tabs); 4.    > Tab (controls content); ; The task bar is separate; but inside the Firefox window we currently have a top to bottom (and weak LTR) order.; ; 1. Window title bar; 2.  > Tab bar; 3.   > Tab content; ; Interpreting the current position inside the tab bar as usual would suggest this:; 1. Task bar; 2.  > Windows; 3.   > Tab bar; 4.    > Tabs & Tab groups; ; or (worse); ; 1. Task bar; 2.  > Windows; 3.   > Tab bar; 4.    > Tabs; 5.      > Tab groups; ; So: logically; the tab candy buton would have to be between the title bar and the tab bar. At the very least it would have to be on the left (while this would introduce a left to right order that was not yet part of the UI before; this is relatively easy to grasp for an LTR user; for RTL users it would of course be the other way around). The details are probably OS dependent (on Win7 we have the title bar empty; so putting the Tab group title and the button slightly below the Firefox button is possible); but I think its pretty clear that the button cant stay where it is now and where it looks like an element inside the tab bar.; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: Replace typeof ... == undefined checks
Description: As per Dolskes suggestion in bug 602777: we have many instances where we check for something existing (for example in some options) using `typeof ... == undefined`.; ; This bug is for replacing these with `if (... in options)` if its a property; or `if (foo === undefined)` otherwise.

Title: Released and collapsing drag regions fade back into... somewhere

Title: Active tab highlight should change immediately after the change has been made; i.e. before zoom out animation
Description: Created attachment 501050; Screen capture; including slow-mo replay.; ; Right now if the active tab changes while we are out of Panorama and we zoom out back into Panorama; the active tab styling still is on the previously active tab during the zoom out animation.

Title: Resizes for single groups dont stick correctly; returning them to their userSize values
Description: Created attachment 503757; Screenshot; ; When a window only has a single group and this window is resized down past the usersize; you observe some odd behavior where you momentarily see the group get resized to new bounds to fit the window; but then bounce back to its original size. Something odd is going on in the resize code in this case.; ; This is one non-pushAway cause of bug 587140.; ; This bug is a followup to bug 625269. The test for 625269 includes a TODO for this bug.

Title: after closing a group in panorama; focus should go to the last used tab in the last used group
Description: 1. after closing a group or the last tab in a group in panorama - focus goes to the nearest tab in a remaining group; ; 2. after closing the last tab in a group in the browser window - focus goes to the first tab in the first group (as far as i can tell); ; expected result:; 1. focus is consistent if the group is closed either in browser or in panorama; 2. focus should always go to the last used tab in the last used group; 3. fixing (2) will also ensure that if i close group B while focused in group A; focus will not change

Title: The focused Tab is not set first in the stack
Description: Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0; ; Description:; When creating a group containing multiple tabs in Panorama and minimizing it in order to obtain a stack; the active tab is not displayed on the top of it.; ; Reproduceble always.; ; Steps to reproduce:; 1. Create 3 or more tabs; 2. Select last tab; 3. Go into Panorama and minimize the group in order to create a stack.; ; Actual result:; The first tab created in step 1 is on top of the stack.; ; Expected result:; The last selected tab (the focused one) is on top of the stack.

Title: Group name field doesnt use all horizontal space available
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0; ; If a group is wide; the group name field should adjust its width to use all space available and completely display the group name.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open the window of Panorama.; 2. Create a new group.; 3. Rename the group with a name longer than the field width; for example Heres my very long group name.; 4. Increase the width of the group with the arrow in the bottom right of the group box.; Actual Results:  ; The group name field doesnt not adjust its width to display more text; so we still see my very long group name even if theres a lot of horizontal space available.; ; Expected Results:  ; Since a lot of horizontal space is available; the group name should be entirely displayed.

Title: Add feature to sourceeditor/scratchpad: delete line(s)

Title: The Step Over; Step In and Step Out buttons should be disabled for simple statement breakpoints
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:15.0) Gecko/20120621 Firefox/15.0a2 (20120621042006); ; STR:; 1. Load in the browser a web page with at least one JS.; 2. Open the Debugger (Tools->Web developer->Debugger; or press Ctrl+Shift+S).; 3. Set a breakpoint on a simple statement in the JS (e.g. a=b+c;).; 4. Start running the JS.; ; When the script stops at a breakpoint that is only a simple statement; the Step Over; Step In and Step Out buttons should be disabled. For a simple statement; all these buttons have the same effect; which is confusing for a more naive user (someone just starting to learn how to use a debugger).

Title: HashTable bug in the overwrite update
Description: Created attachment 730466; This is a suggested fix for the buggy put function of the program.; ; The program HashTable.java is an implementation of hash table using linear open addressing and division in Java. This program has a bug; because the put function will NOT update the element associated with the given key if an entry with the same key is put. However; this hash table implementation should update the element even if the element s key already exists in the hash table.; ; The test case for this bug is to call put fucntion with a duplicated key that is required to be written on the old value.; ; Steps to reproduce:; - Call put function with an existed key value and new element; - Instead of rewiting the old value with the new one; it only store the old value into a temporary variable and returns old value.  ; ; ---------------------; Firefox x.x; xxx operating system; x86_64 hardware

Title: UX Nightly: Customizing toolbar stops other Firefox nightlies/Firefox stable from working in that profile
Description: UX Nightly will change the profile in such a way that it makes essential buttons like Back and Refresh disappear when the same profile is started in another Firefox build (such as Stable or even the regular Nightly).; ; Tested on Windows 8; 64 bit.; ; Steps to reproduce:; - Create new profile on Firefox Stable (or any other firefox build but UX nightlies); - Open Firefox in that profile; check everything is ok.; - Open UX in that profile; customize the toolbar by putting a new button and removing it again; for example.; - Open the other Firefox build again. Check that some buttons are missing.; ; Expected result:; - When opening the other Firefox build; the toolbar and buttons would be ok.; ; Obtained result:; - When opening the other Firefox build; many buttons are lost and have to be placed manually.; ; Ive contacted Gijs that told me that this was only to be expected in case I restored default settings in UX and then used the same profile in other build. Since this differs slightly from that case; its now reported just to be safe.

Title: Today History folder should be expanded by default
Description: Build: 2001052115; Mac OS 9.1; ; To reproduce:; *   Open the History window.; *   Look at the `Today folder.; ; What you should see:; *   The folder should be expanded.; ; What you actually see:; *   The folder is collapsed.

Title: Flickering icon in URL location field
Description: The link rel=icon feature is a very nice generalisation of favico; but the; resulting graphic has a tendency to flicker when moving between pages; even when; those pages are referencing the exact same graphic in the exact same location;; so that the graphic remains; overall; unchanged.; ; navigating around www.mozilla.org illustrates this well. There would ideally be; no flicker.; ; Suggest that; (only if link is followed to new page on same server?); the; decision to redraw the graphic (and update the URL?) only be made once the head; of the new page has been read to find out whether the same graphic; or no; graphic; is referenced. (Not sure introducing hysteresis on updating the URL is; necessarily a good thing; since you then cant e.g. see redirects in action and; learn urls to hand-edit.); ; Ive no idea what should happen if e.g. image type is unspecified/differs and; content negotiation comes into play.

Title: Show form action URL in status bar (like for link URLs) (e.g. when hovering a submit button)
Description: buttons in forms have defined linkages to other pages or programs (the ACTION; attribute). unlike A HREF links; on mouseover; these are not previewed in the; status bar. it sure would be convenient if they were!

Title: [cust] Creating a new toolbar with same name as standard toolbar should give an error
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.2b) Gecko/20020927 Phoenix/0.2; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.2b) Gecko/20020927 Phoenix/0.2; ; Create a new toolbar called Bookmark Toolbar. No error is reported that a; toolbar with that name already exists and a new toolbar and menu item are created.; ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; ; ; Actual Results:  ; Phoenix creates the toolbar and you end up with duplicate menu items on the; Toolbars menu.; ; Expected Results:  ; If you try and create a second user generated toolbar with the same name as a; previous user generated toolbar an error is reported and you are prompted to; change the name. This should also happen with the Status Bar; Navigation; Toolbar and Bookmarks Toolbar names.; ; ; The new toolbar facilities are excellent; it means an end to having alter; browser.xul to get an Address toolbar.

Title: Should be able to manually open a blocked pop-up
Description: I propose the popup blocking icon which appears in the lower left corner of the; browser when a website requests a popup should have more functionality than just; unblocking a site. I suggest that clicking the icon will open a menu which; will allow me to (a) manually open the popup and (b) a menu item to bring up; its current functionality to unblock a site.; ; To me; this seems more logical than just being able to unblock the site. Say I; go to a site which I suspect requires popups to function properly. I have no way; of knowing if thats true unless I unblock the site completely.

Title: turning off hide tab bar ... has no effect until new tab/window is opened.
Description: Observed in Phoenix 0.4 on both Windows XP and Linux.; ; Turning off the hide tab bar when only one tab is open option in the; preferences does not have an effect until an additional tab is opened.; ; To recreate:; ; 1.  Load Phoenix with the hide tab bar ... option enabled.; 2.  Ensure that only ONE TAB is open.; 3.  Go into preferences; turn off hide tab bar ... option.; 4.  Close preferences.; 5.  Observe that a tab for the current page did NOT appear.; 6.  Go to File -> New Tab; 7.  Observe that you now have a tab for the original page; and a new tab.; 8.  Close the new tab; observe that you now have the tab for the original page.

Title: When URL bar gets focus; language should switch to English
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.4b) Gecko/20030502; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.4b) Gecko/20030502; ; AFAIK all URLs contain only RTL latin text; now; although LTR text can be; encoded using %XX notation; its never (again AFAIK) the case that a URL starts; with %XX and it is rarely the case that people wish to enter RTL text (to be; encoded into the URL) directly in the URL bar. I therefore suggest that whenever; the URL bar gets keyboard focus; the input direction will be set to LTR if it; had been RTL. This means different things for different platforms; of course.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: expose UI for network.cookie.alwaysAcceptSessionCookies
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; WinNT4.0; en-US; rv:1.5a) Gecko/20030728 Mozilla Firebird/0.6.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; WinNT4.0; en-US; rv:1.5a) Gecko/20030728 Mozilla Firebird/0.6.1; ; In the Privacy preferences; I would like to be able to select the following:; ; - silently accept cookies for the current session only; - ask before accepting for all other cookies; ; This gives me a better balance between automatically accepting all cookies; (which allows long-term tracking by arbitrary web sites) and being prompted to; accept every single cookie (making web browsing cumbersome).; ; I suggest a preferences GUI such as the following. This would still allow all; the behaviours which are currently available; as well as supporting the; behaviour I am looking for:; ; [x] Enable Cookies; ;     For cookies that last only until the end of the session;         [x] Accept only from the originating web site;         [x] Ask permission before accepting; ;     For cookies that are saved between sessions;         [x] Accept only from the originating web site;         [x] Ask permission before accepting; ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.; 2.; 3.

Title: Move Clear button for Passwords in Privacy panel
Description: Clear should be moved into the collapsed area of the Password section in the; privacy panel so its not so easy to hit. Losing the password store could be; catastrophic. The Clear button for passwords has an associated dialog but better; button placement would be even better.

Title: Status bar icons should respond to right-click
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.5b) Gecko/20030810 Mozilla Firebird/0.6.1+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.5b) Gecko/20030810 Mozilla Firebird/0.6.1+; ; The stylesheet switcher icon in the status bar should display the menu upon; right-click.  Currently it only displays on left-click.  Windows contextual; menus should display on right-click.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Right-click stylesheet switcher icon in status bar.; ; Actual Results:  ; Nothing.; ; Expected Results:  ; Display the menu that displays when this icon is left-clicked.

Title: Status bar indicator for blocked cookies
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.5b) Gecko/20030824 Mozilla Firebird/0.6.1+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.5b) Gecko/20030824 Mozilla Firebird/0.6.1+; ; One of Firebirds best features is the integrated popup blocking that provides; an icon indicator when it has blocked a popup window; allowing the user to click; on it and selectively enable any popups for a certain page.  I submit that a; similar feature should be implemented for cookies to simplify in cookie; management.  If all cookies are set to be blocked in Options/Privacy; then an; indicator on the status bar would allow the user to see a list of blocked; cookies (both for the site currently in view and possibly a log of recently; blocked cookies; which would clear an old bug report) and then allow the user to; allow specific cookies for either the session or permanently add them to their; whitelist.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.; 2.; 3.

Title: Offline: should offer to clear session
Description: We currently do not have any UI or mechanism for clearing session cookies;; outside of restarting the browser application session. (This should work within; quicklaunch; but is limited by non-browsing windows hanging open; like chatzilla; or IM in N6/7).; ; Ive been saying for a long time that we need to make Offline-Online be more; robust; taking many useful lessons from the way the MailNews features are coded; around it.; ; Ive linked this bug up to several other related bugs.; ; For example; there should be a preference for cookies  that says:; ; When going offline -> delete session cookies [yes] [no] [ask me]; ; Also; if there were network profiles that were zone based; you could have a UI; like this:; ; <Work VPN>; ; When leaving this network:; ; [ ] release all session cookies for: (all|zone1|zone2) ; ; (where zone1 or zone2 would be defined as things like all intranet servers or; my favorite ecomerce sites.

Title: installer doesnt display images (watermark or header) on Windows95
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win95; en-US; rv:1.5) Gecko/20031016 K-Meleon/0.8; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win95; en-US; rv:1.5) Gecko/20031016 K-Meleon/0.8; ; when running the installer; the images dont display; instead it is just grey; like the rest of the window.  the screenshots i have seen of the installer have; pictures; i assume mine is supposed to have pictures too.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. download the installer; 2. run it; Actual Results:  ; the images didnt display; ; Expected Results:  ; display the images

Title: bookmarks manager should have two-pane interface for easier filing of bookmarks into folders
Description: Sufficiently large bookmark lists are hard to organize because of the scrolling; required to move each bookmark into the appropriate folder.  For a bookmark list; like mine; with a bunch of folders at the top and a bunch of uncategorized; bookmarks underneath them; organizing my list requires:; ; 1. clicking on a bookmark;; 2. drag-scrolling it up to the top of the list;; 3. dropping it into the appropriate folder;; 4. scrolling back down to the next uncategorized bookmark.; ; This chore would be much easier if there were a second pane in the manager which; displayed just the hierarchy of folders.  Then; bookmarks from the list could be; dragged over to the folder tree and into the appropriate folders without the; need for any scrolling; requiring only:; ; 1. clicking on a bookmark;; 2. dragging it over to the appropriate folder;; 3. dropping it.

Title: Option for the originating Web site only loses selection if Load Images is not selected
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20031116 Firebird/0.7+; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20031116 Firebird/0.7+; ; If option for the originating Web site only (Web Features) is selected and; Load Images is deselected then option for the originating Web site only; looses selection after Options UI is closed and opened again.; ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Select options Load Images (Web Features); for the originating Web site; only (Web Features); 2. Deselect option Load Images; 3. Close Option UI; 4. Open Option UI; ; Actual Results:  ; Option for the originating Web site only (Web Features) lost selection; ; Expected Results:  ; Option for the originating Web site only (Web Features) ought to stay selected.

Click a scrollbar arrow quickly to scroll through the list.; ; ; Actual Results:  ; The Change Action dialog appears for the currently selected item.; ; Expected Results:  ; Just scroll like any normal scrolling box.

Title: URL of current tab incorrectly changed when Alt+Enter opens new tab from location bar
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20031208 Firebird/0.7+ (Oxs G7 SSE optimized); Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.6b) Gecko/20031208 Firebird/0.7+ (Oxs G7 SSE optimized); ; After typing a URL into the location bar and pressing Alt+Enter to open that URL; in a new tab; the tab that was active when pressing Alt+Enter has its location; bar URL incorrectly set to the typed value.  Note that the new tab is opened; with the correct URL and its location bar behavior seems normal.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.  Go to some website (URL-a) in a given tab (Tab-a).; 2.  Type a new URL (URL-b) into the location bar and press Alt+Enter to open it; in a new tab.; ; Actual Results:  ; Tab-a has had its URL-a replaced with URL-b in the location bar.; Tab-b correctly has URL-b in the location bar.; ; Expected Results:  ; Tab-a should still have URL-a in the location bar.; ; Note that this behavior makes sense if Tab-a is a new; empty tab.  This is most; likely a regression due to the fix for bug 203102.; ; I realize that you can hit Esc within the location bar when Tab-a is active and; URL-a will be restored.  It is incorrect; IMO; since Im not changing the URL; that I want associated with that tab (e.g. for a bookmarklet or something); but; am creating a new tab entirely.  If I wasnt opening a new tab; I would expect; Tab-a to have whatever Ive typed in the location bar.

Title: Focus not in address bar after opening new Tab by DoubleClick
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.5) Gecko/20031007 Firebird/0.7; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.5) Gecko/20031007 Firebird/0.7; ; When opening a new Browser Tab using the keys Ctrl+T the adress bar is empty and; the cursor is there. Open new Browser Tab by Double-Click on an empty part of the Tab Bar; Actual Results:  ; New Tab opens; but no text cursor in Adress Bar; text about:blank in Adress Bar; ; Expected Results:  ; Adress bar should be empty and the text cursor should be there

Open Tools | Options; 2. Open Cookies | Exceptions and close it directly; 3. Ok button doesnt react on user event

Title: Tab URL does not persist on bad links if tabs switched
Description: 1) Open a new tab; 2) enter a bad URL (e.g. www.fdfdfdfdfdf.com) \; 3) press enter to submit; 4) Warning pops; 5) Switch to a different tab; then switch back.; ; Expected Result (and how Seamonkey works): The bad URL is still shown in URL bar ; ; Actual Result: URL bar is blank; ; This is the Firebird version of Bug 103720 (Seamonkey). It seemed like Bug; 204103 was opened to be its companion but it was closed before this was fully; addressed.

Title: Loading Firefox using Dell AccessDirect Internet button does not go to home page
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win 9x 4.90; en-US; rv:1.5) Gecko/20031007 Firebird/0.7; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Win 9x 4.90; en-US; rv:1.5) Gecko/20031007 Firebird/0.7; ; I have set a local file which is my default home page for Firebird; stored in; C:/. I have made Firebird my default browser. However; when I press the Internet; AccessDirect key on my Dell laptop (Inspiron 2500); Firebird loads but instead; of going to the designated home page; Resolving host %1 appears in the status; bar; and the browser goes to mozilla.org instead.; ; Is there a way I can get Firebird to go the correct home page (it is definitely; set correctly in the preferences)? When I run Firebird manually; it correctly; goes to my set home page.; ; The AccessDirect software is configured; I understand; to simply run the default; browser when I press the i key.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. On a Dell laptop with AccessDirect keys; press the i button to access the; Internet and start the default browser.; 2.; 3.; Actual Results:  ; See Details description above.; ; Expected Results:  ; Instead of going to the mozilla.org home page; Firebird should have loaded my; designated home page; stored locally on the C:/ drive.

Title: Profile Data Backups
Description: Some data points in user profile that store data:; passwords; bookmarks; history; cookies; formhistory; prefs; ; Currently the bookmarks file is written to a temp file and then copied to; bookmarks.html only if the write succeeded; we need to make sure the other data; files adopt the same style of writing... but in addition we should keep the last; successfully written file in a backup file; such that if the browser is ever; loaded and the main file is NOT present we load the backup. ; ; Chofmann experienced a crash in which his bookmarks file vanished. The next time; he loaded the app the default bookmarks appeared. If we had a backup file that; would have been loaded and things would have been peachy.

Title: Improve installed shortcut names
Description: IEs Quicklaunch button is called: Launch Internet Explorer Browser and this; shows in the items tooltip. Firebirds quicklaunch shortcut should be renamed; to Launch Firebird Browser. A descriptive comment should also be added to the; file. IEs is Finds and displays information and Web sites on the Internet.; which also shows in the tooltip. We need an analog. ; ; Our start menu shortcuts should be changed to reflect the function of the app;; by appending Browser. e.g. Firebird Browser
