Try to select partial text by mouse drag.; ; Actual Results:;  I can not select text by mouse drag in textbox of Tab group.;  The container of the tab group moves instead.; ; Expected Results:;  The textbox should be the same as behavior of normal textbox

Title: Close tabs with middle click in TabCandy.
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.2; WOW64; rv:2.0b4pre) Gecko/20100814 Minefield/4.0b4pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.2; WOW64; rv:2.0b4pre) Gecko/20100814 Minefield/4.0b4pre; ; Like tabs in the standard interface; close tabs in TabCandy with the mouse middle clic.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Actual Results:  ; Open tab. (middle clic == left clic); ; Expected Results:  ; Close tab.

Title: Holding Ctrl+Space moves Tab Candy group around page
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b4pre) Gecko/20100814 Minefield/4.0b4pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b4pre) Gecko/20100814 Minefield/4.0b4pre; ; (Among other strange things); ; Press and hold ctrl+space to enter tab candy. ; ; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: Allow moving tabs to groups via the context menu without activating tabcandy
Description: Right now the context menu requires the frame to be loaded even if you happen to momentarily pass over the option. This could lead to unwanted cpu/memory usage from having an unwanted active tabcandy.; ; We should be able to support moving tabs to another group without actually initializing the iframe yet still populate the menu.; ; The group data is stored in sessionstore? And I believe there was a separate bug for an api to talk to sessionstore and know more about groups?

Title: Discover-ability problems on Linux
Description: Tab Groups key command does not work in Linux - control-alt-space; right?  ; ; Using Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b5pre) Gecko/20100819 Minefield/4.0b5pre; ; Also; the icon to activate Tab Groups is hidden by default.

Title: Tab group names are too big; text needs to be cropped on end; with ellipses for long titles.
Description: Created attachment 467726; screenshot; ; Steps: ; 1. Assume you have a set of tabs opened ; 2. Go to Tab view ; 3. Make a group of tabs and give it a name; preferably a long string of chars. ; (to reproduce this easily) ; 4. Close the group ; ; ================================================================================; ; Name moves over to x button which sometimes can be difficult to access due tot this. Selection zone for text field will jump over the selection zone of x button. ; ; Note: screenshot attached

Title: List all Tabs does not show all tabs in the window
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b5pre) Gecko/20100822 Minefield/4.0b5pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b5pre) Gecko/20100822 Minefield/4.0b5pre; ; Currently; the List all Tabs button does not show tabs in other tab sets. This may cause users to forget about tabs that are not on the tab bar. The button should include all tabs in the window to indicate that there are hidden tabs and to match the naming (List all Tabs should do what it states).; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Have tabs in at least two tab sets; 2. Enter into one tab set and click on the List all Tabs button at the far right of the tab bar.; 3. Look at the list that appears.; Actual Results:  ; The list does not include tabs in other tab sets.; ; Expected Results:  ; The list should include all tabs in the window.

Title: Self provided Tab Group names should be trimmed to prevent long menu item names
Description: Created attachment 468425; Large menu-items; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b5pre) Gecko/20100823 Minefield/4.0b5pre; ; Currently in the above build; if one were to provide a group with a stupidly large amount of whitespace the menu item that gets created looks out of place; see attached screenshot [1] and should be trimmed for whitespace.; ; In essence because one is granting the user to manifest these menu items this could be a wont-fix; but I am filing this bug should this not be the case.

Title: Rendering all discarded images in tab groups crashes firefox
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b4) Gecko/20100818 Firefox/4.0b4; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b4) Gecko/20100818 Firefox/4.0b4; ; My Firefox installation generall crashes once reaching approximately 1.4GB memory usage. This crash does not go through crash reporter; it immediately triggers the there is a problem with this program dialog in windows 7.; ; I was able to solve this problem by setting; image.mem.discardable = true; image.mem.decodeondraw = true; ; As far as i understand it this discards drawn images in background tabs and thus saves memory; preventing firefox from crashing.; ; ; The problem with tabcandy is that it redraws all tabs to create the icons in the tab groups; which means that all images on all tabs get un-discarded; consuming memory and crashing firefox.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. set image.mem.discardable = true and image.mem.decodeondraw = true; 2. Open lots (100+) of image-heavy (many images or big images) tabs; 3. open tabcandy and let it render the tab group; 4. crash

Title: Firefox Panorama/Tab Candy background color not available in userChrome.css [Solution inside]
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b5pre) Gecko/20100828 Firefox/4.0b5pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b5pre) Gecko/20100828 Firefox/4.0b5pre; ; It is not possible to change the Panorama background color using CSS. The full path is; #tab-view #content #bg; It seem that this element use JavaScript to set the color. It should use CSS just like any other part of the browser. Some work around are available:; -Deleting the #bg node with the DOM editor; -Creating an extension to do so; -Forcing display: none !important; on #tab-view #content #bg and using #tab-view #content as background;; ; The real solution would be to make sure the element use standard web way of setting the color; css if possible. Doing it like it currently do brake the userChrome and theme support for it. It should be straightforward to fix.; ; screenshot of the affected element http://yfrog.com/mwblender85p; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Try to set a background color using CSS; 2. Open Panorama; 3. It failed; even if the syntax is fine; Actual Results:  ; The color is still the default one; ; Expected Results:  ; The color is the one set by the user

Title: Wrong clickable area for close tab group button
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b5pre) Gecko/20100828 Firefox/4.0b5pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b5pre) Gecko/20100828 Firefox/4.0b5pre; ; Close tab group button looks like a regular cross; but its clickable area is moved right for 6-9 px; look at the gif video.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open TabCandy window (ctrl+space); 2. Try to aim the area around the Close tab group button.; Actual Results:  ; The borders of this area a more to right; than needed.; ; Expected Results:  ; Move it a little bit to the left; to fit the borders of the buttons image.; ; GIF video.; http://img686.imageshack.us/img686/7556/98929373.gif

Title: We should store column and shouldStack attributes for groups in the session store to speed up tabview display from memory
Description: Right now when loading the tab view display; we recompute; on the fly; for each tab which is successively added to each group; (a) how many columns of tabs the group should display and (b) whether the group should just stack its thumbnails.; ; These attributes could be stored in storage and used verbatim on the first tab view draw.; ; Of course its possible for people to greatly change their tab groupings and order before they load ; making some of these attributes in storage useless. But using these storage values for starters and then running .arrange() on each group item at the end of reconstitution from memory (just one time each) could be a great improvement.

Title: Zombie tab group created when process in it dies
Description: Created attachment 471894; zombie tab that will not go away or let me close it no matter what.; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b6pre) Gecko/20100901 Firefox/4.0b6pre; ; Last week a tab had flash die in it and now that tab will not leave the groups view.  If I click on it to open it and close; it does the animation of trying to grow and open that tab but then fails and I am left looking at the tab group view still.  If I put it in another group and go into that groups tabs the zombie tab is not there; so I cant close it.  If I try to close it in the tab group view I cannot.  This zombie tab has carried forward in several updates from nightlies.; ; Attaching a screenshot of my zombie tab.

Title: Add special chars check for beforeSearchKeyHandler() in the search.js
Description: +    // Only match reasonable text-like characters for quick search.; +    var key = String.fromCharCode(event.which);; +    // TODO: Also include funky chars; +    if (!key.match(/[A-Z0-9]/) || event.altKey || event.ctrlKey || event.metaKey) ; +     return;

Title: Encapsulate code in the GroupItems.removeHiddenGroups inside groupItem
Description: >+    this.groupItems.forEach(function(groupItem) {; >+      if (groupItem.canUndo) {; >+        let toClose = groupItem._children.concat();; >+        toClose.forEach(function(child) {; >+          child.close();; >+        });; ; This should be encapsulated inside the groupItem.

Title: Tab thumbnails sometimes have gray (now black) bars at the bottom
Description: http://mozilla.seanmartell.com/tabcandy.png; ; As seen in the above screen grab; there are grey bars that appear at the bottom or sides when a thumbnail doesnt resize properly. The tabs grey background shows through.

Title: use something other than attrmodified to handle updates?
Description: Panorama currently watches attrmodified on all tabs (via AllTabs.jsm) in order to keep all of the tab thumbnails and related information up do date. Dietrich has pointed out that this may not be the most efficient solution. This bug is for looking for other options that provide the required functionality but without the performance hit.; ; In the Panorama code the area of interest is TabItems._update(); which is triggered by an event handler set up in TabItems.init().

Title: CTRL + Space opening new Group Your Tabs should be preventable
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b5) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b5) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b5; ; CTRL + Space opening new Group Your Tabs should be preventable so we can have our own application key handler. ; ; ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. add a keydown handler on CTRL+SPACE and call preventDefault when handled; 2. press CTRL + SPACE; Actual Results:  ; Group Your Tabs view is shown; ; Expected Results:  ; Group Your Tabs shouldnt be shown; ; This is related to Bug 534121 and Bug 435164 as well as CTRL+Space opens context menu on Mac. ; ; Whatever it does; it should be preventable.

Title: DOM attribute for the group node needed which references the undo button
Description: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #596450 +++; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b6pre) Gecko/20100913 Firefox/4.0b6pre; ; When you create a set of tab groups and close multiple of those; several undo buttons appear. At the moment there is no reference added to the DOM node of the tab group which undo button corresponds to it. Given that it is not possible for Mozmill to determine the correct button.; ; Similar to bug 596450 we would need a DOM or JS property as reference on all hidden tab groups to identify the undo button.

Title: Refinement for bug 595943: No need to iterate over all tabs; just the ones at the beginning
Description: >+++ b/browser/base/content/tabview/ui.js; ...; >+          // Dont return to TabView if there are any app tabs; >+          for (let a = 0; a < gBrowser.tabs.length; a++) {; >+            let theTab = gBrowser.tabs[a]; ; >+            if (theTab.pinned && gBrowser._removingTabs.indexOf(theTab) == -1) ; >+              return;; >+          }; ; I dont think you need to iterate over the whole list of tabs... AFAIK AppTabs; are always at the beginning; so you could break early.; ;         for (let a = 0; a < gBrowser.tabs.length; a++) {;           let theTab = gBrowser.tabs[a];;           if (!theTab.pinned);               break;;           if (gBrowser._removingTabs.indexOf(theTab) == -1) ;             return;;         }

Title: Aero/Win7 Window Border shading follows TabCandy/Panorama thumbnail scaling
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b7pre) Gecko/20100916 Firefox/4.0b7pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b7pre) Gecko/20100916 Firefox/4.0b7pre; ; On Win7 with D2D (havent checked yet whether this makes a difference; probably not) clicking the TabCandy button and the following animation for some reason triggers a re-shading of the window border. Look carefully at the white horizontal borders where the gradient repeats along the left and right border. Press the TabCandy button and the border moves up until it disappears.; ; Nothing major; but slightly irritating.; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: app tab ghosts in panorama
Description: I inadvertently close one of my app tabs (twitter); so I opened a new tab and loaded twitter and made it an app tab. When I went to Panorama there was a duplicate of the app tab corresponding to twitter: http://grab.by/6rd0; ; The first one; probably belonging to the one I closed; was not actionable. Normal view has only one app tab: http://grab.by/6rdc; ; Is this some caching issue?

Title: In TabCandy groups view; highlighted tabs are glowing the wrong title
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b7pre) Gecko/20100917 Firefox/4.0b7pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b7pre) Gecko/20100917 Firefox/4.0b7pre; ; The picture will show it all.  When you use the arrow keys in the tab groups view; it glows the tab thumbnail.  The title of the highlighted tab starts below the glow; but if there are two rows of tabs; the title of the tab above is (or at least can be) within the glow effect.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. open a bunch of tabs; 2. view documents with titles; 3. go to group tabs; 4. create a group and adjust size of group object so that tabs appear in two rows.; 5. use arrow keys to select a tab in the 2nd row; ; Actual Results:  ; When I did this; I see the glow effect seems to be making the title of a different tab appear that it is the one selected.; ; Expected Results:  ; Either the title of the selected tab would be within the glowing area; or neither.

Title: Use the placeholder attribute of <input> instead of hacks to set a default name for tab groups
Description: Hacks are suboptimal. HTML5 is better.; ; We should be using something like; <input placeholder=&tabview.groupItem.defaultName; />; to set the default name of tab groups.; ; See instances of defaultName in; http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/base/content/tabview/groupitems.js

Title: Show tab count after group name
Description: In the Panorama view; one can see at a glance previews of tabs within each tab group; as well as the names of each of those tab groups (if named). One should also be able to see an exact number of how many tabs are in each tab group.; ; For example:; Mozilla (23); Shopping (15); Group 3 (32); Read Later (12); ; Also; if the group name is ever used anywhere else; the tab count should probably be included there; too. (For example; List all tabs menu; session restore; window title bar; etc.)

Title: Panorama keyboard shortcut doesnt work in certain keyboard layouts on OS X
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b7pre) Gecko/20100921 Firefox/4.0b7pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b7pre) Gecko/20100921 Firefox/4.0b7pre; ; The Panorama keyboard shortcut on Mac OS X (option-space) doesnt work (pressing it doesnt activate Panorama) in some keyboard layouts; specifically (in my case) Colemak. Im using the .keylayout from <http://colemak.com/Mac>. Changing the layout back to en-US makes the shortcut work again.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Set keyboard layout in Mac OS X to Colemak official .keylayout.; 2. Attempt to activate Panorama with option-space.; Actual Results:  ; Panorama does not activate. ; ; Expected Results:  ; Panorama should activate.; ; No other keyboard shortcuts seem to be affected by this; Ive been using Colemak and Firefox/Minefield for quite a while. Ive also tried some layouts provided with the OS (such as Dvorak) and they dont seem to suffer from this problem either.

Title: Clean up reconnect code once we have instant access to sessionstore
Description: Once bug 590268 lands; we can get rid of the delayed reconnect code in Panorama; always loading our data immediately; as well know the data is going to be there right away.; ; Note that 590268 by itself will make a dramatic improvement in the panorama UX; this bug is more a code cleanup.

Title: alert box opened on CTRL + Space will break TabCandy escape handler and swithing between tabs
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b6) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b6; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b6) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b6; ; When we open an alert box on CTLR + space we cant press escape to go back anymore. And also we cant swith into other tabs than the original tab. It does the zoom effect but doesnt swith into the tab when pressed once. When you press the same tab again it works. When you try to press always a different tab it never activates the tab. ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. attach keydown event handler and open call alert() when event.keyCode == 32 && event.ctrlKey ; 2. two or more tabs + this new HTML page and press CTRL + space ; 3. this will show the new TabCandy and your alert box; 4. try to press escape to go back to the tab; 5. try to click on other tabs (dont click 2x on the same tab); ; Actual Results:  ; 4. doesnt switch you back; 5. doesnt switch you to the tab; only zoom effect is shown; ; ; Expected Results:  ; Escape should switch you back; swithing between tabs should work on the first click

Title: Why cant we hide Panorama from within the ctrl+space key handler?
Description: For some reason; we cant hide the TabView UI directly (without a setTimeout) from within the option/ctrl+space key handler (even though it works fine for the escape key handler). Were using a setTimeout to get around this; but it would be nice to know exactly what is going on.

Title: Show Panorama view on holding ctrl+tab
Description: The Tab Candy / Panorama hotkey is being set to ctrl+E in bug 592183.; ; Suggestion for (an additional) more natural shortcut:; ; HOLD ctrl+tab; ; (shift+)ctrl+tab cycles through tabs. Pressing it a bunch of times jumps through a bunch of tabs. Holding it for auto-repeat just runs through a bunch without much control. Instead; we could intercept the attempt to auto-repeat and use that as a shortcut to open Panorama. It would actually make sense as an extension of the existing shortcuts.

Title: Use globally named commands (Browser:HideTabView; etc...) for entering/exiting Panorama
Description: Please see bug 591398 for more details; especially the final comments.; ; In the patch (https://bug591398.bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=477707) we use Browser:HideTabView and Browser:ShowTabView for getting in and out of Panorama. We should be using those commands in other parts of the UI.

Title: browser_tabview_snapping.js test fails if you run it by itself
Description: The test runs fine when run with all of the other tabview tests; but when run by itself; it gives these errors:; ; TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_snapping.js | Right under: Moving up 10 should not snap; TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_snapping.js | Right under: Moving up 10 again should snap!; TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_snapping.js | Offset: Moving up 10 should not snap; TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_snapping.js | Offset: Moving up 10 again should snap!

Title: View Bar is not working when user using short cut key
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.10) Gecko/20100914 Firefox/3.6.10; Build Identifier: 3019459968; ; View Bar is not working when user using short cut key on Mozilla.; ; Reproducible: Sometimes; ; Steps to Reproduce:; Steps to reproduce; Step1 : open Mozilla Fire Fox.; Step2 : click view option in the main menu bar; it showing the list of view menus options.; Step3: use short cut key (Alt+v); view option not responding -- Issue.;  ; ; Actual Results:  ; View option not responding when we use short cut key (Alt+v); ; Expected Results:  ; it should show the list of the view options when user use short cut key (Alt+v).; ; this bug reproducible only on Mozilla not on IE.

Title: Zoom-in not working above a certain preview size
Description: Have (at least) one group in panorama with one tab in it. Size the group in a way that the tab preview is small; say 200 pixels wide: the zoom-in effect works fine.; ; Now enlarge this tab group to make the tab preview big; about 700-750 pixels wide. Now click the tab. Instead of expanding; to all sides; the tab preview actually shrinks and moves to the top left corner which is exactly the opposite of what makes sense.

Title: High cpu usage while downloading large file; even when all windows closed
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b6) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b6; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b6) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b6; ; On mac os X 10.6; FF4 beta 2 to beta 6 consumes high cpu time; Ive tried with FF in safe-mode and all windows closed. ; For the same file to download; Activity monitor says : ; ; Firefox Beta 6 : >= 22 %; Firefox 3.6.10 : ~ 13%; Safari 5.0 : ~ 6%; ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. open Activity Monitor; 2. download a large file; 3. compare with another browser; Actual Results:  ; ; Firefox Beta 6 : >= 22 %; Firefox 3.6.10 : ~ 13%; Safari 5.0 : ~ 6%; ; ; Expected Results:  ; same % as firefox 3.6

Title: focus group name field after creating new group
Description: When I create a new folder in finder or other file managers; the folder name field is immediately focused so that I can type the new folders name. ; ; I have the same expectation when creating a new group; but instead I get search.; ; Current behavior:; 1) click and drag to create new tab group; 2) type foo to name the group; hit enter; 3) get told there are no search results for foo.; ; Expected behavior:; 1) click and drag to create new tab group; 2) type foo to name the group; hit enter; 3) the group is now named foo; ; Would be nice for this to Just Work. :)

Title: [startup-notification] Two windows started when Firefox launched for the first times
Description: Created attachment 486567; Screenshot; ; Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS i86pc; en-US; rv:1.9.2.12) Gecko/20101027 Firefox/3.6.12; ; Steps to reproduce:; 1. Remove .mozilla; 2. Launch FF3.6.12 from menu (not terminal); ; Actual Result:; Two windows appear in panel: Welcome to Firefox... and Starting Firefox Web Browser; For screenshot;please refer to attachment ; ; Expected Result:; Only Welcome to Firefox... should be started

Title: Correlate stack angle randomness with large number of items in stack.
Description: Randomize the stack angles more as number of contained tabitems approaches some number at which slow machines begin to show performance problems (100?). This is a visual encoding for the user to know where heavy stacks are that may be too big.

Title: stay on app tab when switching groups
Description: If you hit the next group key while in a tab group (i.e. not in the Panorama UI); it remembers which tab you were in in each group and takes you back to it as you go from group to group. With bug 600665 this even works for app tabs. ; ; I wonder; though; if maybe we want to provide an exception: if youre on an app tab when you hit next group perhaps it should keep you on that app tab but just change the group (seeing as how app tabs are present in every group).; ; Assigning to Aza for his thoughts.

Title: Group name doesnt change in title if you stay in the same app tab
Description: STR:; 1. Make two groups; each with one tab; give each group a name. Also make an app tab. ; 2. Go into one group and select the app tab; go into the other group and select the app tab. ; 3. Use the next group key to switch between the two groups.; ; Expected: ; The group title updates in the window title.; ; Actual:; The group title stays the same. ; ; This is because the browser only updates the window title when you switch from tab to tab. In this case were changing groups but the tab remains the same. We need to call gBrowsers updateTitlebar method when switching groups.

Title: GroupItem.add should auto remove from previous group
Description: We do a pretty good job of making sure we never add a child to a group thats already got another parent; but sometimes it still happens. Might as well auto remove from the previous group when this happens.

Title: tab within stack has highlighted border
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b8pre) Gecko/20101029 Firefox/4.0b8pre; ; When I opened Panorama this evening one of the tabs in a group had a highlighted dark border. I only clicked on the Panorama icon. Its difficult to tell if the highlighted tab is the same as the one I was on before I went into Panorama; but I seem to remember it was an app tab. There was no keyboard interaction. Its the first time I see this border.; ; I didnt try to reproduce the problem.; ; http://grab.by/78cp

Title: A couple of declarations dropped (background-image-opacity in tabview.css and size; position; width; and height in tabview.html)
Description: Seen in a Mac OS X debug build though I suspect this applies at least to some extent to all platforms.; ; TEST-START | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_apptabs.js; TEST-INFO | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_apptabs.js | Console message: [JavaScript Warning: Unknown property background-image-opacity.  Declaration dropped. {file: chrome://browser/skin/tabview/tabview.css line: 335}]; TEST-INFO | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_apptabs.js | Console message: [JavaScript Warning: Error in parsing value for size.  Declaration dropped. {file: chrome://browser/content/tabview.html line: 0}]; TEST-INFO | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_apptabs.js | Console message: [JavaScript Warning: Error in parsing value for position.  Declaration dropped. {file: chrome://browser/content/tabview.html line: 0}]; TEST-INFO | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_apptabs.js | Console message: [JavaScript Warning: Error in parsing value for width.  Declaration dropped. {file: chrome://browser/content/tabview.html line: 0}]; TEST-INFO | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_apptabs.js | Console message: [JavaScript Warning: Error in parsing value for height.  Declaration dropped. {file: chrome://browser/content/tabview.html line: 0}]

Title: Get rid of Item.locked
Description: We used to use .locked for the new tab group; but thats gone and we havent found any other use for the property; so its probably time to clean it out. ; ; This would probably be a good time to get rid of GroupItems.killNewTabGroup as well... its been around long enough.

Title: Reconcile group minWidth/Height
Description: In GroupItem.setBounds; we force the minimum width of 110 and minimum height of 125; yet in GroupItem.setResizable; were using 90 and 90. We should up the numbers in setResizable; and use them from setBounds (this.resizeOptions.minWidth; etc). (This came up during bug 587248; where the discrepancy cost Ehsan a couple hours of head banging.)

Title: Remove GroupItems xDensity and yDensity properties
Description: They landed in:; ; http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/diff/254300336b6b/browser/base/content/tabcandy/app/groups.js; ; ... back in July; and I have no idea what theyre for. Ehsan has pointed out theyre entirely write-only; so we should be able to pull them right out.

Title: Dont show tab icon if there isnt one?
Description: Created attachment 488768; A tab with no icon; ; Right now we display the tab icon gray area; obscuring the thumbnail; even if theres no icon. What if we dont do this if theres no icon?; ; I think being able to see more of the tab would be much better.

Title: Display resize widget/gripper in the bottom right of the Panorama screen
Description: Created attachment 488771; The bottom right corner of the screen. You cant see it; but theres a resize widget there someplace.; ; If the window that Panorama is displayed in is resizeable; lets display a resize widget/gripper image where that widget actually is. See the (very boring) attachment of the region of the window I am describing.; ; Right now (on the Mac) I actually dont see any gripper in the bottom right of *any* window; but thats not a Panorama issue and thus should be another bug.; ; If this is also the case on other platforms (I havent checked yet); please comment and let us know.

Title: Remove Drag.isResizing
Description: The isResizing property on Drag objects is not actually being used. Remove it.

Title: Panorama search box overlaps with panorama button.
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b7) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b7; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b7) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b7; ; When I click search in panorama view the search box partially overlaps with the panorama button in the top right corner.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Start panorama; 2. Click search; Actual Results:  ; Search box partially overlaps with panorama button; ; Expected Results:  ; No overlap; preferably a search bar or persistent search box (like system preferences in OSX which works similarly but starts dimming and highlighting when something is typed in it).

Title: Tab view breaks the Aero glass effect
Description: Created attachment 491950; Screen capture of the glass effect reacting strangely; ; I just realized that we are breaking the Aero glass effect related to window size in tab view.  Easiest way to describe what is happening is to attach a video.; ; expected behavior: the effect is based only on the actual size of the window; and not the position of a tab or tab group.

Title: Empty tab group appears in panorama view with no tabs open in it
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b8pre) Gecko/20101124 Firefox/4.0b8pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b8pre) Gecko/20101124 Firefox/4.0b8pre; ; Empty tab group appears with no tabs and app tabs open; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.OPEN firefox with new profile ( 2 tabs appears bydefault; 1 - thanks notes; 2   about:home); 2.pin the first tab as app tab and go to panorama view; 3.drag and drop the normal tab out of the tab gourp(the empty tab group disappears); 4.click on the normal tab to exit panorama view; 5.close the normal tab and again add a new tab; 6.go to panorama view; 7. drag and drop the normal tab out of the tab gourp; Actual Results:  ; The normal tab which is not in any tab group and the empty tab group is still showing; ; Expected Results:  ; The normal tab which is not in any tab group should be shown and the empty tab group should disappear; ; After performing the step 7 continuing the below steps; 8.Now go to app tab and close the app tab using the keyboard shortcut CTRL + W; 9.Come again into the tabcandy view; ; Actual Result - Empty tab group with no tabs and app tabs still appear; Expected Result - Normal tab should be shown and tab group should disappear; ; After step 9.  Close the empty tab group and click on the available normal tab; ; Actual Result - Firefox exits unexpectedly; Expected Result - Firefox should exit panorama view and show the new tab

Title: Character by character selection using the mouse in the tab group name field.
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b8pre) Gecko/20101212 Firefox/4.0b8pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b8pre) Gecko/20101212 Firefox/4.0b8pre; ; After setting the name of a group you are not able to select characters or to change the cursors position using the mouse in the field. Since that is a text box the mouse should work as it normally does.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Go to group view.; 2.Name one of the groups that you have and hit enter.; 3.Click again in the text field and try to select with the mouse one or few characters.; Actual Results:  ; The text cant be selected.; ; Expected Results:  ; You should be able to select or move the cursor using the mouse.

Title: Text cursor should be active only when mouseover() the exact area of the group name field
Description: Build ID: ; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b8pre) Gecko/20101213 Firefox/4.0b8pre ; ; The text cursor triggers on hover mouse event for the whole line in which the name text field exists. It should appear only when hovering the exact area of text. ; ; For example; in the area outside the groups name field; the positioning cursor ; should appear instead of the text cursor.

Title: Group item title field should use HTML5 placeholder
Description: Right now we have some special case code in order to display the Name this tab group... text and icon on unnamed groups. I believe all of this JS is unnecessary and it would all be cleaner if we used a placeholder attribute on the title input field and then styled it with :-moz-placeholder .; ; This most likely would require a litmus test as Im not sure how an automated test for this would be written.

Title: Remove debugging rect code
Description: There are a few references to and updating of debug rectangles... often using the property $debug on Items. I dont think we need these any more and should remove all these.

Title: Currently selected tab should be indicated in Panorama
Description: Build Identifier:; Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20101221 Firefox/4.0b9pre ID:20101221030401; ; Currently selected tab should be indicated in Panorama.; ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Start Minefield with new profile; 2. Open several tabs; 3. Enter Panorama; ; Actual Results:;  There is no focus-ring/border-highlight for currently selected tab.; ; Expected Results:;  Currently selected tab should be indicated.

Title: CSS warnings: Error in parsing value for height/width. Declaration dropped.
Description: From time to time in Panorama; we get CSS warnings like this:; ; > Warning: Error in parsing value for height.  Declaration dropped.; > Source File: chrome://browser/content/tabview.html; > Line: 0; ; > Warning: Error in parsing value for width.  Declaration dropped.; > Source File: chrome://browser/content/tabview.html; > Line: 0; ; We need to clean these up. Theyre messy and unprofessional; and may actually; indicate underlying problems.; ; See also: bug 622285

Title: Groups shouldnt be allowed to have the same name
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20110103 Firefox/4.0b9pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20110103 Firefox/4.0b9pre; ; In Panorama view; user is allowed to name two or more groups with the same name. Can cause confusion when trying to move a tab from one group to another while in tab view.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. In Panorama view open at least three groups and populate them with a few tabs.; 2. Name all the groups the same.; 3. Go to tab view; right click on tab name and select Move to Group.; Actual Results:  ; All groups have the same name; ; Expected Results:  ; Groups have different names; allowing the user to differentiate between them.

Title: Consolidate code for new window tests into newWindowWithTabView
Description: Bug 610242 will land newWindowWithTabView into head.js. Other tabview tests which run open new windows should also be modified to use newWindowWithTabView.

Title: Rearranging App Tabs in tab bar is not reflected in Panorama
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20110106 Firefox/4.0b9pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20110106 Firefox/4.0b9pre; ; When rearranging app tabs in tab bar; the new ordering is not reflected in Panorama.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Open at least three tabs.; 2.Pin as App Tabs two of the tabs.; 3.Go in and out of Group View.; 4.Rearrange the order of the App Tabs.; 5.Go back to Group View and inspect the order of App Tabs. ; Actual Results:  ; The reordering of App Tabs in tab group is not reflected in Panorama.; ; Expected Results:  ; The changes should be reflected in Group View.

Title: Expanding and collapsing moves the expander; sometimes out of the group!
Description: Created attachment 503740; Video; ; Take a stacked tab. Sometimes after expanding and then collapsing that group; the expander button moves; sometimes even out of the group.; ; Follow up from bug 625443. The browser_tabview_expander test introduced there includes a todo for this bug.

Title: Entering another tab doesnt trigger collapse of an expanded tab group
Description: Created attachment 503743; Video; ; STR:; 1. Get a stacked group.; 2. Set up another tab elsewhere as the active tab.; 3. Click on that first groups expander so it fans out (expands).; 4. Through the keyboard shortcut; for example; zoom out of Panorama. You will go into the active tab.; ; Expected:; This should trigger a collapsing of that expanded tab group.; ; Reality:; It does not.; ; This is a follow up bug from bug 625443. The browser_tabview_expander test written there has a todo item for this.

Title: Groups columns value is not reset correctly after tabs are removed.
Description: Created attachment 504027; Video; ; When the second to last tab is removed from a GroupItem; the Group Item continues to be rendered as if there are two tabs and therefore must have two columns.; ; While mostly visual in nature; it seems like this may be one part of bug 622872 (blocker).

Title: Remove unused edit.png
Description: Created attachment 504133; patch

Title: Thumbnails should be ordered vertically if the group is higher than wide / Thumbnails should be as large as possible
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110114 Firefox/4.0b10pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110114 Firefox/4.0b10pre; ; At the moment TabCandy always tries to order tab thumbnails horizontally.; But if the group that contains the tabs is higher than wide it would be advantageous to order the tabs vertically; because they would be displayed bigger then and therefore easier to recognize.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Create a new tab group; 2. Resize the tab group so that its (much) higher than wide; 3. Open a few tabs in the group; ; Actual Results:  ; TabCandy orders the thumbnails horizontally and wastes space / leaves space unused.; ;  -------------- ; | ----- ----- |; ||  1  ||  2  ||; ||     ||     ||; | ----- ----- |; | -----        |; ||  3  |       |; ||     |       |; | -----        |; |              |; |              |; |              |; |              |; |              |; |              |; |              |;  -------------- ; ; ; Expected Results:  ; TabCandy should display the thumbnails as big as possible / order them vertically in this case.; ; ;  -------------- ; | -------      |; ||       |     |; ||   1   |     |; ||       |     |; | -------      |; | -------      |; ||       |     |; ||   2   |     |; ||       |     |; | -------      |; | -------      |; ||       |     |; ||   3   |     |; ||       |     |; | -------      |;  --------------

Title: Tab preview should use hover text
Description: In Panorama; page titles are truncated and URLs cannot be seen. It would be helpful if one or both of those pieces of information were available in some mouseover hover text.

Title: Text cursor instead of Move in the top of tab group
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110119 Firefox/4.0b10pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110119 Firefox/4.0b10pre; ; Mouse cursor shouldnt be in text mode in the top part of tab group; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open panorama; 2. Move mouse cursor to the level of Name this group (or how it is called in english version) input; but on the right side; Actual Results:  ; Mouse cursor is text; ; Expected Results:  ; Mouse cursor should be move

Title: Name this tab group textbox shrinks when focused
Clicking Name this tab group textbox doesnt focus it
Description: 1. Go into tab view (Cmd+Shift+E); 2. Hover over the top of the tab group to make a textbox appear.; 3. Click the part of the textbox that is after the emptytext.; ; Result: textbox is not focused; ; ---------------------------------; | / Name this tab group...      |; ---------------------------------;                              ^ ;                              | ;                              | clicking here does nothing

Title: Use Places dbs favicon service
Description: We currently load our favicons straight from the source. We should be using the Places databases favicon service:; ; https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XPCOM_Interface_Reference/nsIFaviconService#getFaviconImageForPage%28%29

Title: Remove killNewTabGroup
Description: killNewTabGroup was originally part of the implementing new tab experience bug 575851; but now it is completely inappropriate to ship this. In particular; it will automagically close any group that someone created called New Tabs after a reboot. Scary!

Title: intermittent timeout in content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_bug606657.js
Description: http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=Firefox/1295952112.1295954973.24380.gz; ; s: talos-r3-snow-009; TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | chrome://mochitests/content/browser/browser/base/content/test/tabview/browser_tabview_bug606657.js | Test timed out; ; Seen on OSX64 Debug; on a push that was Windows-only; so presumably this is an intermittent failure.

Title: browser_tabview_bug586553.js loads about:credits; which hits the network
Description: Despite seeming like something perfectly safe to load in a test; about:credits is actually just another name for http://www.mozilla.org/credits/; so browser_tabview_bug586553.js is hitting the network.

Title: Rect.contains should be inclusive
Description: I was reminded today that our Rect.contains looks like so:; ;   contains: function Rect_contains(a) {;     return (a.left > this.left &&;             a.right < this.right &&;             a.top > this.top &&;             a.bottom < this.bottom);;   };; ; ... whereas it should look like so:; ;   contains: function Rect_contains(a) {;     return (a.left >= this.left &&;             a.right <= this.right &&;             a.top >= this.top &&;             a.bottom <= this.bottom);;   };; ; (I believe this is all my fault; a misunderstanding); ; It should be an easy enough fix... just have to make sure it doesnt have any unwanted repercussions.

Title: Mochitest for bug 598375
Description: Tim had a good idea (in the thread for bug 598375) for how to test that bug:; ; > I think we could use EventUtils.synthesizeMouseExpectEvent() to fire over the; > search button and see if the right element gets the event?!; ; Now we just need to write it.

Title: 2 tabs are no longer stacked in Panorama
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110126 Firefox/4.0b11pre; ; Having just 2 tabs opened in a group; and minimizing group no longer stacks the opened tabs in a pile.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to reproduce:;  1. Start Panorama;  2. Create 2 tabs in a group;  3. Minimize group; ; Actual results:;  - the tabs inside the group are minimized but not stacked; ; Expected results:;  - minimizing group creates a stack

Title: Use public domain headers for our tests
Description: Instead of the boiler plate were using at the top of all of our tests; we should just use:; ; /* Any copyright is dedicated to the Public Domain.;    http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/ */; ; Obviously this is not a big deal; but we might as well fix our old tests at some point; and certainly all of our new tests should have this.; ; Thanks to sdwilsh for pointing this out!

Title: Undo close group buttons should not act as snapping targets
Description: Created attachment 508299; Snapping to an undo close group button; ; Undo close group buttons currently act as snapping targets; and have the wrong range (in the screenshot; vertical extent) to boot. This should be turned off.; ; This should just be a matter of calling removeTrenches on hiding the group; and setTrenches on undoing the group close.

Title: Start heartbeat immediately on init
Description: bug 588630 comment #32:; ; > While Im making recommendations; we could probably streamline the .update(); > calls TabItems.init makes for every tab; instead of calling .update() and; > having it look through _tabsWaitingForUpdate for each one; we could just push; > everybody onto the list and start the heartbeat. Thats just speculative; > optimization; though; something I noticed in the code; rather than something; > the profiling points to.

Title: Rewrite afterAllTabItemsUpdated in head.js using a tabItem observer
Description: Right now in head.jss afterAllTabItemsUpdated we call update on each of them; essentially bypassing the TabPriorityQueue. Adding the _updateTestFunc hook to  check that theyre all updated and then calling update() on them is much more graceful. Rewrite afterAllTabItemsUpdated in terms of this kind of  tabPriorityQueue-obeying logic; and making sure all the tests still pass.

Title: Inconsistent animation behavior for creating new tab in Panorama
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110210 Firefox/4.0b12pre; ; Reproducible: Always; ; STR:; 1. Enter Panorama; 2. Create new tab using plus icon from group and observe animation; 3. Enter Panorama; 4. Create new tab using CTRL+T; ; Actual results:;  - no animation when using CTRL+T; ; Expected results:;  - the same animation as before is present when using CTRL+T

Title: Add toString method to various Panorama objects
Description: When developing tests; we often see failures like Got [object Object]; expected [object Object] which is not particularly helpful. We need TabItem; GroupItem; and perhaps other objects to have custom toString methods with some minimally identifying debug information.

Title: drag/drop of Google Map elements in the left-side list of a personal map does not work
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13; ; In non-beta versions; whilst editing a personal map there is a list of map elements to the left of the actual map. Each element of this list an be drag/dropped up/down - allows me to sort them how I want.; ; This does not work in Firefox Beta 10 and 11; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. create a map; add elements (markers; driving directions etc.); 2. try to reorder the elements that make up the map; 3. does not work; Actual Results:  ; does not work; ; Expected Results:  ; drag works; ; behave as in Firefox 3.x; allow drag/drop

Title: iQ(.appTabIcon; this.$appTabTray).each() calls in groupitems.js should return early if possible
Description: There are 3 such loops; and theyre all looking for a single entry. Once theyve found that entry; they should return early. This is currently not possible; because iQ.each doesnt have a mechanism for early return. It should return early if the callback returns false which is what jQuery does:; ; http://api.jquery.com/each/; ; Note that in order to avoid JavaScript strict errors; the other code path in the loop has to return true (rather than nothing).

Title: If possible; titles should be displayed in panorama view; before page is rendered.
restore focus  after Undo Close Group of last group
Description: Panorama does not restore focus after Undo Close Group of last group; ; Steps To Reproduce:; 1.Close the last goup in Panorama; 2.Undo Close Group; 3.Press Enter; ; Expected Results:; 3.The last focused tab is opened in Tab View; ; Actual Results:; 3.The last focused tab is not opened in Tab View; the browser remains in Panorama View; ; As for a regression window; this happens as far as Fx4b7; the first time Undo Close Group was introduced.

Title: Favicon background must match group item background color
Description: Created attachment 514020; Before/after; ; In bug 618854; we changed the groupItem background color for Mac without updating the .favicon color to match.

Title: Weird transparency when dragging tabs out of groups
Description: Created attachment 514028; Weird transparency; ; When dragging a tab out of a group; while the tab is still overlapping with the group (technically; before it is removed from the group); its border is oddly transparent. The moment it moves out of the group for real; it gets a nice solid border. When dragging a tab into a group; we dont see this at all.; ; The solution: setting a .tabInGroupItem.focus background-color which matches the background color of the group item itself.

Title: Check Items.arrange() calls to make sure tab bounds are correctly calculated
Description: Follow up of https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=634672#c16.

Title: Older jetpack addons cause tabs to become totally disorganized in Panorama
Description: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #628188 +++; ; I was bitten by bug 628188 when I installed https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/memory-meter/ as well.; ; Am I correct that the only solution here is to recompile any addons that used the old SDK with a newer SDK? Do we expect many jetpack addons to do this frequently? Is it likely that they will all do so by the Firefox 4 ship date?; ; If were not confident that most addons will update themselves to a newer SDK I think we may need to figure out some workaround in the panorama code before we ship. Otherwise new Firefox 4 users will have have a really broken panorama; and thats one of our big new features.; ; What do you guys think?

Title: Tab focused on Panorama backs previous page with BackSpace key
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110222 Firefox/4.0b12pre; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110222 Firefox/4.0b12pre; ; On Firefox Panorama; if it focus the tab which is enable to move backing previous pages and I press BackSpace key; the tab move backing previous page in Panorama.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 0.The tab(A) has history to back previous page.; 1.Enter to Firefox Panorama.; 2.Focus on the tab(A).; 3.Press BackSpace key.; Actual Results:  ; The tab(A) backs previous page.

Title: When opening stack window the titles of the website are not visible
Description: Created attachment 514756; Screenshot 1; ; Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110223 Firefox/4.0b13pre; ; While in Panorama; after pressing the expand button of a stacked group; the titles of the websites are not visible - dark colored. (See Screenshot 1); ; Reproducible: always; ; Steps to reproduce:; 1. Create a few tabs; 2. Go to Panorama and create a stack; 3. Press expand button and observe the titles of the websites; ; Actual results:;  - the titles of the websites cannot be read - low visibility; ; Expected results:;  - titles have a good visibility

Title: Sometimes; no tab gets the keyboard focus when entering Panorama
Description: Occasionally; when entering Panorama; no tab has the focus. This seems to happen most often when entering Panorama for the first time. When this happens; the mouse is the only way to select a tab.

Title: Update browser_tabview_firstrun_pref.js to test the existing behavior
Description: The test/tabview/browser_tabview_firstrun_pref.js test file isnt included in the Makefile.in. If we dont run this test; it would be better to remove it.

Title: Websites title remains  active during zoom in animation from stacked pile in Panorama
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110228 Firefox/4.0b13pre; ; When accessing a website from a stack pile in Panorama; the titles of the websites remain visible during the zoom in transition.; ; Reproducible:always; ; Steps to reproduce:;  1. Create a few tabs and access panorama;  2. Minimize group in order to obtain stack;  3. Press expand button;  4. Select one of the websites and observe transition (look after the websites title); ; Actual results:;  - the title stays active during the transition; ; Expected results:;  - the title becomes inactive (is no longer visible) during the transition

Title: Allow customizing name directly in Move to Group > New Group
Description: I would be saving a step if i could specify a New group; and type in the name of that group right there.   Current steps to this are:; 1) assign a tab to a new group; 2) then watch that tab dissapear into the black hole; 3) then know to launch panorama and find my tab i moved (which can be painful if i have a large number of tab boxes; 4) and lastly enter in the custom name of that Group within panorama.; ; Entering the newly assigned tab to new group name would do this in all in 1 easy step.

Title: Panorama tabs-from-other-windows button displays
Description: When searching for a tab from another window; Panorama displays a message at the bottom with a button to switch to the tab. The button itself works but displays &nbps; as the label.; ; Steps:; 1. Open a few tabs in the main window to different pages; 2. Open a new window; 3. Open the Tab Groups view; 4. Click the search button; 5. Type the name of one of the loaded pages; ; Result:; Tabs from other windows [ ]; ; Expected:; Tabs from other windows [something_more_identifiable]

Title: Tabs from other windows text disappears with background window
Description: Created attachment 517952; Screenshot; ; When searching for tabs from other windows from within Panorama; there is text which says Tabs from other windows.  This text disappears if this window loses focus.; ; Steps:; 1. Open a few tabs in the main window to different pages; 2. Open a new window; 3. Open the Tab Groups view; 4. Click the search button; 5. Title: A ghost tab appears inside a Tab Group
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0; ; I had two tab groups open when I updated to Fx4 RC2 and restarted. After that; an empty tab appeared in one of my tab groups. Clicking on it will just return me to the current tab -- regardless of which tab group is currently active. I can even click and drag the ghost tab around inside or across tab groups. But trying to close it will have no effect; a border appears around the close button; and it stays that way. The tab cannot be closed. Heres a screenshot of what it looks like: http://i121.photobucket.com/albums/o204/ajifocus/Public/FxGhostTab.jpg; ; Reproducible: Didnt try

Title: Tab Groups migrating above the top of the window when panorama is closed
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0; ; In panorama; my top tab groups; that are flush with the top of the designated space; are migrating beyond the top of the window by something like 100-200 pixels when I have the panorama closed. This happens pretty much at random and started with one of the Betas. I tried reporting it through support but got no response. ; ; Reproducible: Sometimes; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open Firefox; 2. Create tab groups (two+) flush with the top of the window.; 3. Click off of panorama; come back later.; Actual Results:  ; Its pretty random as to when it does and doesnt happen. It happens less than half of the time; and I cant figure out what the specific trigger is. What does happen when it goes wrong is that they jump up past the top of the screen by an inch or so and stay there until I grab them and pull them back. tabs groups below them stay put.; ; Expected Results:  ; The tab groups should remain relatively where I placed them.

Title: mini-require / require.jsm in GCLI hangs firefox for recursive requires
Description: See: gclitest/recurse.testRecursive; ; The code goes into a loop which should die from exhausted stack space; but for some reason Firefox just locks up.; ; The require code should track the tree of require calls being made; and give the user a warning about which modules are part of a loop.; ; This is marked as low priority (for the require code) because there is an easy way to diagnose the problem (set debugDependencies = true) also its not too hard to work out what has gone wrong and its not a common mistake to make.; ; Discussion is needed to decide if this is a bug which needs to be raised separately in platform land. From my scans of Bugzilla there isnt an open issue related to this. On one hand I can appreciate that handling all DoS attacks is hard; and maybe impossible. On the other this is a fairly simple recursion problem; which Chrome handles OK.

Title: Experiment with a popup UI for the GCLI along the lines of launchers (Quicksilver etc)
Description: The idea isnt so much to have command selection be graphical; but to have the command-line popup in the middle of the screen on a single keypress.; ; The web console could then become visible if there was output (or not if no output)

Title: [meta] GCLI bugs marked as future
Description: This is a meta bug for GCLI issues that are more important than experiments; but not currently scheduled for completion.

Currently; when a user; highlights text; and right clicks it; you can search google for that text.  I; think that you should search using whatever searchplugin youre currently using.;  For instance; Ive got a search php.net file written; and Id love to be able; to highlight a function name from a script Im perusing on groups.google.com and; search php.net using this functionality.  Right now; I have to copy the text; into the box and search that way--not too inconvenient; but could be better.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Go to a website with text; 2. Highlight some text; 3. Right-click and choose Web Search for...; ; Actual Results:  ; Searched google.com for the text; ; Expected Results:  ; Used the searchplugin site for finding the text

Title: new toolkit independence bug
Description: Currently; toolkit.jar is built in xpfe/global and a second pass in; mozilla/toolkit overwrites and adds the new files.; We end up with unnecessary files and a duplication of the widgets in particular.; Since more and more apps are using the new toolkit; we need to stabilize a set; of files that we need and reject those we dont.

Title: Alt+Enter on a link should save
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.5b) Gecko/20030723 Mozilla Firebird/0.6; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.5b) Gecko/20030723 Mozilla Firebird/0.6; ; alt-enter is used to open addresses typed in the location bar or search results; queried from the search bar in a new tab.  However; links (selected with tab); are openned in a new tab using ctrl-enter; alt-enter does nothing.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.  Open any web page with links (anchored hrefs); 2.  Use the tab key (or cursor browsing) to highlight a link.; 3.  Press ctrl-enter to open link reference in new tab; press alt-enter to do; nothing.; Actual Results:  ; Ctrl-enter: opens link in new tab; alt-enter: does nothing; ; Expected Results:  ; ctrl-enter: do nothing?; alt-enter: open link in new tab
