Title: Form control with name=action confuses Add a keyword to this search
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20041001 Firefox/0.10.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20041001 Firefox/0.10.1; ; http://host:8080/?search=[formfield]; ; If you click on that form element in a page; and add it as a search; the; bookmark ends up:; ; http://host:8080/%5Bobject%20HTMLInputElement%5D?search=%s; ; When you use it; you get a 404 message on that page; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Create search form in index.html; 2. Go to site w/o specifying page (http://host/) .. implies index.html; 3. Right moouse click field and Add a keyword for this search; 4. URL in Bookmark will now be; http://host/%5Bobject%20HTMLInputElement%5D?search=%s ; ; Actual Results:  ; The search will attempt to load that page; with %s substitution.  The server; will respond and log a 404 message for object HTMLInputElment page not found.; ; Expected Results:  ; object HTMLInputElement should not be in the URL.  removing it from the bookmark; produces correct functionality.; ; I am using GrayModern 0.6 theme.; ; Extensions Installed:; ;  Mouse Gestures 1.0;  ieview 0.83;  freetranslate 0.02;  Scribe 0.21;  Translate Page 0.1;  Wikalong 0.12;  DictionarySearch 0.6.3;  Wayback 0.1;  McSearchPreview 1.4.1

Title: Bookmark menu context menu accesskeys dont work
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20041015 Firefox/0.10.1 (MOOX M2); Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20041015 Firefox/0.10.1 (MOOX M2); ; Right click on bookmarks and then pressing r on keyboard should bring up; properties of that bookmark. Instead; the first bookmark in that folder with r; as the title letter is instigated in the current active tab.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Go bookmarks menu.; 2. Right click on any bookmark in any sub-menu.; 3. Click r key on keyboard.; Actual Results:  ; Context menu remains on screen while the first bookmark in that folder with r; as the title letter is instigated in the current active tab; ; Expected Results:  ; Properties menu should appear with the context menu disappearing. Nothing should; happen in the current tab.; ; Default theme. Using Moox M2 Build 20041015 though. Not sure if it happens on; official builds though. No extensions.

Title: Bookmark this group of tabs is missing from the bookmarks menu
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041103 Firefox/1.0RC2; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041103 Firefox/1.0RC2; ; Firefox is missing mozillas bookmark this group of tabs function; it is not; present in the bookmarks menu; and not in the tab-bar right-click menu either.; ; This is a big miss since there is no way to bookmark a group other than creating; the group by hand and to manually drag and drop every tab to it.; ; This is a real pain; and mozilla has had this function for ages now.; ; One use for this is searching for pages on a given topic and wanting to save the; result as a group.; ; Another use for this is to save the currently open group of tabs before closing; FF; in order to restore it later on. for example to shutdown/reboot the PC; or; when installing a new FF build.; ; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. open the bookmarks menu or right-click on the tabs-bar; Actual Results:  ; Neither the bookmarks menu nor the tab-bar right-click menu has a bookmark this; group of tabs entry.

Title: Cant add a new folder on the bookmarks toolbar after having deleted a folder
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; ; If i delete a folder from the bookmarks toolbar im not able to add a new folder; untill restarting firefox.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Add a folder to the bookmarks toolbar by rightclicking it and choosing New; Folder....; 2. Delete the just created folder.; 3. Try to add another new folder the same way as point 1.; ; Actual Results:  ; I hear an alert beep and nothing happens.; ; Expected Results:  ; A dialog should have appeared to add a new folder.

Title: Command-w (Ctrl+W) does not close Element Properties window
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; ; If you get Properties using the contextual menu; on a image; command-w on the; keyboard should close the window.  It does not; however the File menu in the; menubar flashes; but nothing happens.  Closing the window with the close button; works of course.; ; Reproducible: Always; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. right-click on a image; choose Properties; 2. view properties window; 3. press command-w on the keyboard; ; Actual Results:  ; Nothing.  File menu in menubar flashes; but the window goes nowhere.; ; Expected Results:  ; The window should have closed.

Title: [Mac] both delete and del keys should delete bookmarks and history items
Description: In the Mac OS X version; in the bookmarks manager; the key to delete bookmarks; should be intuitively either delete or cmd-delete. Its currently set to cmd-d.; ; While it doesnt violate the Apple HIG; cmd-d is usually used for other things; in OS X. Delete is commonly used to delete items from lists (such as the; bookmarks manager in Safari; or mails in Mail); so it fits this use.; Furthermore; cmd-d is used to *add* a bookmark in the main browser window; so it; doesnt make sense for it to do the opposite in the bookmarks manager.; ; This is a duplicate of Mozilla Seamonkey bug 26543. I figured that Firefox would; probably require its own patch. If thats wrong; sorry for the bugspam; please; dupe it.

Title: Mac labels in wizards (Continue; Go Back; Done)
Description: With wizards; such as Bookmark import and a software update; > and < are; attached to the Next button and the Back button; respectively.; ; In the standard application of Mac; I think that such a character is not added.; ; Mac OS X 10.3.6; Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107; Firefox/1.0

Title: removing an item from sites/cookie exceptions list leaves a blank line in the tree
Description: Spin-off from bug 272678 comment 10.; ; This happens with Firefox 1.0 as well as trunk.; ; 1. Open Options->Web Features->Allowed Sites.; 2. If the exceptions dialog is empty; create a few items.; 3. Delete the last item.; ; Actual Result:; The blank line after the last item is selected.; ; Expected Result:; The last item is selected.; ; ; The js console displays this:; Error: setting a property that has only a getter; Source File: chrome://browser/content/cookieviewer/treeUtils.js; Line: 43; ; And then this error every time you mouse over the blank line:; Error: gPermissionManager._addedPermissions[aRow] has no properties; Source File: chrome://browser/content/cookieviewer/CookieExceptions.js; Line: 32; (and line 34)

Title: Firefox Installer doesnt have access-keys (mnemonics) in License Agreement screen
Description: To reproduce; run the installer and click Next to go to the License Agreement; screen. Two radio buttons will display (I accept... vs. I do NOT accept...);; neither of them with an access-key.; ; The same problem happens with the Thunderbird installer; Ill open another bug; for that.; ; Prog.

Title: Add a pref to make location bar keyboard modifiers consistent with all other shortcuts
Description: Currently; the keyboard modifiers (Ctrl/Shift/Alt) in the location bar is not; consistent with the rest of the keyboard/mouse shortcuts. This is done by; design; to be compatible with IE. The current behavior is as follows:; ; * Ctrl+Enter: add www. and .com to url; * Shift+Enter: add www. and .net to url; * Ctrl+Shift+Enter: add www. and .org to url; * Alt+Enter: open url in new tab; which can combine the above modifiers.; ; This is NOT a request to change these defaults; since they are there for a good; reason. However; for the increasing number of people using tabbed browsing; and; for the (probably) vast amount of users not using this IE feature/shortcut at; all; having a consistent UI across the browser would certainly make it easier to; use. For those users; an about:config pref should be added to make the keyboard; modifiers consistent with the rest of the UI; resulting in the following behavior:; ; * Shift+Enter: open the url in a new window.; * Ctrl+Enter: open the url in a new tab (background by default).; * Ctrl+Shift+Enter: open the url in a new tab (foreground by; default).; * Alt+Enter: save the url target.

Title: Opening any sidebar should focus the first element within the sidebar
Description: When opening a sidebar; such as history; focus should go to the first focusable; element -- in that case the search field.; ; Otherwise; a blind user will have an extremely difficult time understanding how; to navigate to the actual history.

Title: Often no visible focus when tabbing to tree
Description: To repro:; Alt+B to open bookmarks; Alt+S to focus search; Tab; ; What happens:; Focus is in the tree view which lists the bookmarks; but is not visible.; ; How to fix:; When a tree gets focused; and no item is selected yet; select the first item.; The selection highlight shows focus and makes it obvious that arrow keys will; move around.; This will also help screen readers; which are confused by focused a tree/list; with no item selected.

Title: Closing the last tab loads an untitled page (about:blank) instead; doesnt clear session history
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.5) Gecko/20041107 Firefox/1.0; ; When only one tab is open; and you have Firefox configured to show the tab bar;; even when only one tab is open; when you close the tab by either middle-clicking; it or clicking the close X button at the right of the tab bar; it closes the; tab and spawns a tab entitled (Untitled) instead of closing the tab only. In; other browsers; like Opera; it closes the tab to a blank window with no tabs.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Tools->Options->Advanced->Deselect Hide the tab bar when only one tab is open; 2. Open one tab; and only one tab.; 3. Middle click the tab.; ; Actual Results:  ; There is a tab named (Untitled).; ; Expected Results:  ; The software should have closed the tab and made a tabless browser window.; ; Firefox should be configured to show the tab bar when only one tab is open.

Title: Print preview UI not keyboard accessible
Description: The print preview screen has a row of controls at the top. They should be in the; tab order along with the print preview pane itself. More mnemonics should also; be added; but the tab key should also be operable here.; ; Note to QA/testers: once this is fixed please make sure that bug 250096 does not; come back up again.

Title: SetPageProxyState no longer needs a URI parameter
Description: The security check was removed in bug 252288s attachment 154061; so the; parameter is no longer used.; ; This removes the need to create a URI at:; http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/browser/base/content/browser.js#2720

Title: Add keyword for this Search... can fail if a form uses a fieldset (example: bugzilla advanced query; e.type is not defined)
Description: Try to define a keyword to the bugzilla advanced query page doesnt work; since; the fieldset element has no type property.; ; Patch coming up.

Title: File -> Open Location nonfunctional when the Location Toolbar is hidden
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.6) Gecko/20050225 Firefox/1.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.6) Gecko/20050225 Firefox/1.0.1; ; When the Location Toolbar is hidden (e.g. in a javascript popup) the File ->; Open Location menu item does not display the Open Web Location dialog.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Set the dom.disable_window_open_feature.menubar preference to true; 2. Open a javascript link that opens a new window with the location toolbar hidden; 3. Select the File -> Open Location menu item; ; Actual Results:  ; Nothing; ; Expected Results:  ; Display the Open Web Location dialog

Title: Open Location Dialog should behave exactly as URL bar for the current page
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.7.6) Gecko/20050223 Firefox/1.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.7.6) Gecko/20050223 Firefox/1.0.1; ; The Open Location Dialog can be opened when the Location tool is not visible.; The location field in the dialog should behave exactly as the Location tool; does. It should initially contain the URL for the current page. This feature; would facilitate getting the URL of the current page when the Location tool is; not visible; as well as navigating a site by peeling back its hierarchical URLs.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Hide the toolbar containing the Location tool.; 2. Type ctrl-L to open the Open Location Dialog; 3. The location field of the dialog does not contain the URL of the current page.; ; Actual Results:  ; The dialog contained some other URL.; ; Expected Results:  ; The dialog should contain the URL of the current page.; ; This bug is similar to 247467; which also requests that the Open File Dialog; behave as the Location tool does.

Title: Message bar buttons need accesskeys to be usable for screen reader users
Description: When an alert popups up in the browser message bar; a screen reader user will; hear the alert -- something like; To protect your computer; Firefox has prevented this site (foo.com) from; installing software on your computer ... Button Edit Options; ; At that point the screen reader user is somewhere in the middle of the page and; has heard the alert; but dont know where it is on the screen or how to navigate; there. Adding an accesskey to the Edit Options button would solve the problem.; ; I suggest two possible solutions:; 1. the browser.xml method showMessage() take another argument for the accesskey; 2. that the showMessage()s aButtonLabel parameter be able to take a label with; an & before the letter that defines the accesskey Edit &Options

Title: Spinning web page loading cursor breaks apple human interface guidelines
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X; en) AppleWebKit/412 (KHTML; like Gecko) Safari/412; Build Identifier: ; ; Whilst a page is loading under firefox on OS X; a cursor appears with a spinning disc at the bottom right ; hand corner or it; this icontradicts the apple human interface guidelines; which says that if an asyncronous  ; progress indicator is used (in this case the throbber); an animated cursor is not required.; ; furthermore; animated cursors are not supposed to be used in new deveopment.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; ; ; ; here is the apple interface guidelines i referred to...; ; ; http://developer.apple.com/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/OSXHIGuidelines/XHIGCursors/; chapter_15_section_2.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/20000957-CH236-TPXREF101

Title: Disable certain menu options (view source; find; text zoom; etc) when viewing non-text content (images; plugins)
Description: Steps to repeat:; Use firefox 1.0.4 or a current trunk nightly; and load an image; Use Ctrl+U or menu View->PageSource or prepend view-source to the URL.; ; expected result: no source seen; or RFE: source seen as hex code;   actual result: bytes displayed as characters.; ; Bug seen in Firefox 1.0.4 and Firefox trunk; not seen in Mozilla Trunk.; ; gif : https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/mozilla-banner.gif; jpeg: http://ha.ckers.org/imagecrash.jpg; png : https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=183739; ; ; view-source:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/mozilla-banner.gif; view-source:http://ha.ckers.org/imagecrash.jpg; view-source:https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=183739

Title: use small icons is ambiguous; behavior needs to be changed
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050511 Firefox/1.0.4; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050511 Firefox/1.0.4; ; The feature use small icons in toolbar customization is both ambiguous and; obsolete; and does not take into consideration smaller status-bar icon sizes and; the customization of individual toolbar sizes.; ; There exists 4 standard icon sizes used in Firefox.  48x48; 32x32; 20x20 and; 16x16.  48x48 are the default toolbar button sizes; 32x32 are the use small; icons sizes; 20x20 is found in throbber and status-bar icon sizes; and 16x16; are found in the menu-bar; url-control; search-control; tab-bar; and sometimes; in the status-bar.  Currently; there is no way to define 20x20 and 16x16 when; customizing a toolbar.; ; I propose to describe these sizes as Large; Standard; Small and Tiny; respectively.  Noting that Large is the default size and Standard is the size; used by use small icons.; ; Including 20x20 Small and 16x16 Tiny would set a standard with Theme makers; to include these sizes with their themes.  This would allow more icons to fit in; the menu-bar and status-bar; and would allow for even smaller toolbars for those; of us with huge monitors and good eye sight.  I know the difference between; 20x20 and 16x16 is insignificant; but these are still standard sizes that should; be supported less we kill 20x20 in favor of 16x16.; ; Additionally; the ability to specify individual toolbar sizes should be added as; a standard feature in Firefox.  The ability to drag toolbar icons into ANY; toolbar (including menu-bar; tab-bar and status-bar) should also be added. These; features are currently available through Toolbar Enhancements.; ; Thank you for your consideration.; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: [FIXr]leak in history autocomplete
Description: Someone apparently couldnt decide whether some out params should be addrefed or; not; so they had nsGlobalHistory::AutoCompleteSearch sometimes do it and; sometimes not and callers never release.  But that leaks....

Title: [Mac] If theres an open about window; activate it on Firefox->About Mozilla Firefox
Move dialog in bookmarks manager doesnt persist its size
Description: Bug 214754 apparently broke this; despite my saying there that it didnt.

Title: Copying a single bookmark should not append a new line to the end of the URL
Description: When you right click on a bookmark item and copy it; a new line is appended to; the end of the URL. Observed this on both Linux and Windows; and in SeaMonkey as; well.

Title: Large increase in Lk (not Rlk) on balsa on 7/25
Description: Lk on balsa went from about 340KB to 370KB.  The checkins for the relevant timer; range are; http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/bonsai/cvsquery.cgi?module=PhoenixTinderbox&date=explicit&mindate=1122312420&maxdate=1122316799; ; Given that Rlk did not change; were probably leaking non-refcounted objects. ; The leak change log at the end of; http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=Firefox/1122316800.4419.gz; indicates that almost all the new leaks are under JS_Malloc; I dont see any JS; engine changes in that time; so I can only assume that other things (which are; holding references to the JS stuff somehow) started leaking...

Title: URL bar gets confused about what URI is loaded
Description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE:; ; 1)  Load https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=213946; 2)  Click in the URL bar; add #29 to the end of the URI; and hit enter; 3)  Click on the link that says #30; ; EXPECTED RESULTS:  URL bar says; https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=213946#30; ; ACTUAL RESULTS:  URL bar says https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=213946#29; ; I get the same result in Seamonkey and Firefox; but thats probably because of; code copy/paste.  Im guessing the issue here is that our code that decides; whether the URL bar was edited looks for progress events that are not fired for; anchor scrolls or something silly like that...

Title: In live bookmarks; entries not having a <link> element should use the <link> child of root
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; fr; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050517 Firefox/1.0.4 (Debian package 1.0.4-2); Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; fr; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050517 Firefox/1.0.4 (Debian package 1.0.4-2); ; In a live bookmark folder; when an entry of the RSS has no <link> (which is; permitted by the spec); Firefox should use the (mandatory) <link> at root level.; ; This would allow for a default target in RSS; which is especially useful when; several news are related to the same page (but not all; since bookmarks wouldnt; be meaningful then). For example; when a RSS feed lists all changes to a site;; some news refer to a specific page; but several arent bound to a specific; location; and thus are to be linked with the home page.; ; Currently; entries lacking a <link> arent displayed; and if none has a <link>; the message the feed failed to load is displayed.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; Add http://www.komite.net/pl/hidden/avec.rss and; http://www.komite.net/pl/hidden/sans.rss to the live bookmarks.; The first has five entries; each with a <link>.; The second has those same five entries; but two of them lacking their <link>.; ; Go and try to open the corresponding folders.; Actual Results:  ; The second live bookmark has only three visible items; and the first has five.; ; Expected Results:  ; The second live bookmark should have had five visible items; two of them; pointing towards the default <link> in the RSS.; ; The current behaviour has been seen on Linux Mozilla 1.0.4; Windows (1.0.6); and; Linux (Deerpark alpha 2).

Title: RSS not accessible
Description: There is no way to get the RSS view of a page with the keyboard.; ; There is no indication to screen reader users that an RSS view exists for a page.

Title: [mac] The Preferences menuitem is disabled in DOMi
Description: The Preferences menuitem is disabled in Firefoxs DOMi.

Title: New Message keyboard shortcut is available on Unix and OS X
Description: The New Message keyboard shortcut is available on Unix and OS X. At present;; the keyboard shortcut is only documented on Windows.; ; Note: on OS X; the keyboard shortcut is Accel-*Shift*-M.

Title: Help Contents menuitem is labeled Firefox Help on OS X
Description: The Help Contents menuitem is labeled Firefox Help on OS X.

Title: clearObsoletePrefs is useless
Description: It tries to clear saved user prefs that have long been removed from the default; pref file; and it does this every time a new window is launched. It should just; be removed; since its no longer useful.

Title: content is rendered outside the window if width is reduced
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20051012 Firefox/1.6; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20051012 Firefox/1.6; ; If the window width is reduced at some point the visible content wont be fitted; to the window and will be rendered outside the visible window and there is no; way to display it.; Well; hard to describe.; ; Take a simple webpage like the sample html vom CSS Zengarden. Then reduce the; window width by dragging the right window border to the left. You will see the; text being reformatted while you drag the mouse. On a clean profile the; reformatting stop if the address bar is reduced almost to zero width. If you; then reduce the window width further; the window content will disappear behind; the right window border. And there is no way to get to this content because; there is no scrollbar at the bottom.; ; The width where the reformatting stops is not fixed. If you remove the search; bar of a new profile the reformatting will stop at a smaller window width. The; bad thing is that this minimum width can also be bigger. With the web developer; extension installed the reformatting stops if the blank space on the web; developer toolbar is reduced to zero. That equals more than half of my desktop; width (1280 pixels); i.e. i cant tile FF next to another window because then; some content wont be visible.; ; On webpages where there is minimum width implied in the design and where this; minium width is bigger than the width where the reformatting stops; the result; will vary. As soon as the design minimum width is met a scrollbar will be shown.; But sometimes you also cant scroll to the right side enough to see all content; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. visit page; 2. reduce window width; ; Actual Results:  ; reformatting of the page content will stop at a given window width; ; Expected Results:  ; keep reformatting until the window width is limited by the operating system; and; display scrollbar if the content doesnt fit anymore; ; Both Opera and IE do this correctly. They reformat the page until the window; cant be made smaller anymore (OS limit). If there are long words that cant be; wrapped or pictures; both browsers will display a scrollbar.; ; Here is a picture: Opera vs. FF trunk: http://free.pages.at/mugros/neth.png; (page is www.nethack.org and i am not using a clean profile; but that doesnt; really matter; and the build was a bit older); Another picture: FF1.5beta vs Opera vs IE: FF1.5beta and 1.0.5 doesnt seem to; show this behaviour.

Title: tab strip should not respond to double click in space above and below tabs
Description: There is a small area in the tab strip both above (about 5px) and below (about; 2px) tabs which responds to a double-click event by opening a new tab. This can; lead to unexpected behaviour where new (blank) tabs open and steal UI focus:; ;  - user tries to select a tab;  - user misses and clicks in area above/below tab;  - user tries a second click; opening a new tab; ; These areas shouldnt respond to the double-click accelerator for creating new tabs.

Title: do this automatically for files like this from now on often grayed out
Description: Have a look at my screenshot. I created it by downloading one of the foo files from this test page:; ; http://entropymine.com/jason/testbed/mime/; ; So what I would like to do now is save the file to disk... actually; I have little choice; have I? The problem is; I want to stop Firefox bothering me each time I download such a file. IOW; I want to set the checkbox; ; do this automatically for files like this from now on; ; Why is that grayed out? For almost every second download I do; its grayed out. This should never be grayed out; it should always be selectable.

Title: When migrating from Internet Explorer http auth passwords are not migrated
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051118 Firefox/1.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051118 Firefox/1.5; ; When testing IE migration and starting with clean slate I noticed that not all passwords were migrated. I also checked the saved passwords dialog and it had no trace of some of the passwords. The passwords that were not migrated are HTTP protocols basic authentication based passwords that I have saved in IE.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Visit some HTTP protocol password protected site in Internet Explorer.; 2. Save the password and then close and open it again to make sure its saved.; 3. Now do a clean install of Firefox 1.5rc3 and do migration from Internet Explorer.; 4. Visit the same site with Firefox. It should have the password prefilled?; ; Actual Results:  ; The password is not migrated and not filled in.; ; Expected Results:  ; The password should show up just like it does in Internet Explorer

Title: Cant use SSL after import from Internet Explorer.
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051118 Firefox/1.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051118 Firefox/1.5; ; This only happens if SSL2.0 is disabled in Internet Explorer. (SSL3.0 and TLS1.0 are enabled). After importing IE Inernet Options I cant access any of the HTTPS sites unless I go and check the SSL2.0 option in Advanced section of settings.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Disable SSL2.0 in Internet Explorer.; 2. Start with a clean slate (no profiles for Firefox); 3. Dont do the import when launching first time (branch clean profile).; 4. Now do File->Import. Select Internet Explorer. Now Internet Options should be selected (actually I had all of it selected).; 5. Now visit https://bugzilla.mozilla.org; ; Actual Results:  ; I get an alert saying that I cant access the site cause SSL is disabled.; ; Expected Results:  ; You should be able to visit that site. And the site should load.

Title: Refactor places query object
Description: Get rid of the bulky and growing query interface and simply make the query object implement a writable property bag. Different properties can have different types. ; ; Modifier prefixes can be used within the property names to specify special options; e.g.:; ; query.setProperty(foo; *)    <-- match if first class property foo is set to ;                                      anything; query.setProperty(!foo; *)   <-- match if first class property foo is not set; query.setProperty(A:foo; *)  <-- match if annotation foo is set to anything; query.setProperty(!A:foo; *) <-- match if annotation foo is not set; ; ...; ; or similar.

Title: Bookmarks Annotations
Description: Need annotations for things like:; ; - keyword; - description; - other data

Title: API Review
Description: Final review of APIs (names etc) before turning this feature on.

Title: Implement getCopyableSelection
Description: Implement getCopyableSelection on the places-tree.

Title: hideMessage should default to hiding the message for selectedBrowser
Description: Currently all callers of hideMessage pass in selectedBrowser; hideMessage would be easier to call if it just defaulted to selectedBrowser if aBrowser is null.

Title: Support multiple homepages via bookmark folder places URI
Description: since bug 317878 is fixed now; we should be able to implement this.; ; This isnt completely thought out; since its 5 AM; but heres the general idea:; ; Maintaining and editing a set of links as multiple homepages is just parallel UI that we really dont want to implement.  The current solution isnt very clear; and requires managing a single textfield in the Options panel.  ; ; What Im proposing is to make the multiple homepages option an extension of Places; so that users can select a single bookmark or a container (folder; RSS feed; etc) and use that as their homepages; and edits to the bookmark update the homepage; instead of the one-time solution we currently have.  We would also display the bookmark name; instead of the URL (reuse prettyprinting code here if possible).  We could still support arbitrary URLs/no home page; but the idea is that more advanced setups will build on Places and reduce duplicating URIs.; ; Will the DnD data include the places URI so we can drag a folder?  Other thoughts or bad assumptions Im making about the nature of Places and the special URIs?

Title: Make date printing more succinct in history view
Description: For date-based history queries that are limited to one day (like the common Todays History link or when selecting a single day on the calendar); only the time should be shown.

Title: Suggested mousing improvements for calendar widget
Description: Double clicking a day on the calendar widget should select that days entire week.; ; Triple clicking a day on the calendar widget should select the entire month.; ; Selection should only happen with the left mouse button; middle and right clicking should not affect the selection.; ; Dragging past the top/bottom of the calendar should scroll the calendar up/down.; ; Clicking the date should allow users to jump to a specific month/year.; ; Clicking the arrows should only work with the left mouse button; middle and right clicking should not activate the arrows.; ; Shift-clicking should extend the selection to the new point.; ; Ctrl-clicking should add/remove the selected day from the selection.

Title: Keyboarding/accessability improvements for calendar widget
Description: On Windows and Linux (and Mac if the keyboard access option is enabled); the calendar widget should be keyboard accessible: focusable; left/right/up/down arrows should move the cursor; shift-left/right/up/down to create a selection; going left of the edge should wrap to the previous day; right of the edge should wrap to the next day; up or down should wrap to the previous/next month; page up and page down should wrap to the previous and next month; home and end should go to today.; ; Moving (arrow keys) with the control key pressed should move the cursor without changing the selection. Moving without control pressed should move the cursor and reset the selection. Ctrl-space should add/remove the date at the cursor to/ from the selection.

Title: Bookmarks context menu needs work
Description: The context menu for bookmarks and folders in Places has way too many separators and says Get Info instead of the (on Windows at least) platform-consistent Properties.

Title: Cant drag Bookmarks Toolbar item out of Bookmarks Menu
Description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE; 1. Drag the bookmarks toolbar item into the bookmarks menu.; 2. Drag it back out.; ; ACTUAL RESULTS; Its in the bookmarks menu.; ; EXPECTED RESULTS; Should be able to undo the first move by a reverse move.

Title: Disable future dates in the calendar widget
Description: It should not be possible to select future dates in the calendar widget. This should probably be an option (by means of a property) on the widget itself though; in case this widget is used elsewhere; where future selection makes sense.

Title: Make history observervation for hidden items optional
Description: We spend potentially a lot of time sending out observer notifications for image and other stuff that is marked hidden that is normally never seen. An observer should be able to specify whether it wants noficitations of hidden items so that the common case can be faster.

Title: Expire annotations
Description: Come up with a system for annotation expiration; and implement it.

Title: [mac] installer hard to use -- Improve by including Unix symbolic link to Applications folder
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5; ; The Mac OSX installer can be dramatically improved by creating a symbolic link on the disk image to the Applications folder; creating an Arrow icon and simple instructional tex; To install Firefox/Thunderbird drag its icon to the Applications Folder.; ; Heres a review of the installer in Tidbits; a popular weekly zine; http://www.tidbits.com/tb-issues/TidBITS-809.html#lnk1; Ironically after my article about simplifying installation in TidBITS-807; the Firefox disk image provides only graphical instruction thats actively confusing. An arrow leads from the Firefox icon itself to a smaller; greyed-out version of the Firefox icon that is presumably being dragged; to judge from the non-Mac-like pointer and + badge; and then to a greyed-out icon that looks like the Applications folder. Unfortunately; its all representational - the Applications folder is just a picture; and not a symbolic link; and there are no textual instructions to clarify what to do. Ive already heard of people not realizing they had to copy the Firefox package and instead running it from the disk image. Worse; the instructions on the Firefox Web site say double click the Firefox Disk Image to open it in Finder; and then drag the Firefox application onto your hard disk. Drag the icon to your Dock if you want it to appear there. Im sure there are people who will promptly drag the Firefox icon from the disk image to the Dock; instead of copying it to the Applications folder and then dragging the copied versions icon to the Dock. Obviously; theres nothing all that hard here; but thats no reason not to make it easier yet.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Create a symbolic link to the Applications folder.  In the terminal type:; ln -s /Applications ~/Desktop ; Move this link to the disk image.; http://www.macdevcenter.com/pub/a/mac/2005/09/02/easy-access-to-application-folder-from-a-disk.html ; has a great description and screenshots

Title: Make history observation optional
Description: Currently; all results register has history observers to get updates. Many result types dont need this because they are bookmark views; and dont care about adds or deletes unless theyre bookmarked. We can save a lot of observing by optimizing this.

Title: Result nodes should handle update batches better.
Description: If a requery is necessary; it should be postponed until OnEndUpdateBatch

Title: Optimize statement compilation
Description: Some common code paths such as adding a URI use non-precompiled database statements. We should ensure that every statement used on common code paths have been precompiled.

Title: Add bookmark separators
Description: Also; be sure to fix nsBookmarksHTML.cpp to set them on import.

Title: Edit->Find in Places menuitem does not work
Description: Make Ctrl+F; / and  work for Places.

Title: Provide annotation service function for migration
Description: You should be able to tell the annotation service to move all annotations from one URL to another. There should be some kind of conflict resolution parameter. Probably; we should also have an observer notification and fire that BEFORE moving anything so other services that want to provide custom conflict resolution have a chance to run.

Title: Places smart folders highlight incorrect days in calendar widget
Description: This may need to be split out to a couple of bugs; but this might be able to be fixed in one patch.; ; 1. Click Show Places.; 2. Click Viewed today.; ; Problem: The calendar highlights what should be All pages viewed.  I expect only today to be highlighted.; ; Workaround: Click Viewed last week (which highlights last week correctly) and then click Viewed today again.; ; --; ; 1. Click Show Places (yes; load the chrome again).; 2. Click Viewed past week.; ; Problem: The calendar highlights what should be All pages viewed.  I expect today to one week ago to be to be highlighted.; ; Workaround: Click Viewed today (which highlights today correctly) and then click Viewed past week again.; ; --; ; 1. Click Show Places (yes; load the chrome again).; 2. Click All pages viewed.; ; Problem: The calendar highlights nothing.  I expect all of my past to be highlighted.; ; Workaround: None found.; ; --; ; When inside places; clicking All pages viewed makes the calendar forget the correct highlight.  For example:; ; 1. Select All pages viewed. (Get no highlight - BAD.); 2. Select Viewed past week. (Get all past history highlight - BAD.); 3. Select Viewed today. (Get today highlight - GOOD.); 4. Select All pages viewed. (Returns to step ones state - BAD.); 5. Select Viewed today. (Get all past history highlight - BAD.); 6. Select Viewed past week. (Get past weeks history highlight - GOOD.); 7. Select All pages viewed. (Returns to step ones state - BAD.)

Title: Cant select single day in calendar when in All pages viewed
Description: 1. Click Show Places.; 2. Click All pages viewed.; (there is no calendar highlight -- see bug 320825); 3. Using your mouse; try to select a single day.; ; Expected: One day highlighted.; ; Result: Two days highlighted.  The one you wanted and the one right after that.; ; Ive only been using this milestone for 1 day so Im not sure if it is just the highlight that is wrong or if it is actually looking for history on those two dates.

Title: nsNavHistoryResults containing bookmarks should be only bookmark observers
Description: Currently results register as history observers no matter what. We can greatly reduce observing by having bookmark only results only register as bookmark observers. The bookmark observer API should be extended to provide enough information to do this.

Title: Optimize bookmark UI update
Description: The bookmark menu and toolbar should not keep queries open unless the user actually has a menu open. The bookmark menu can dynamically generate a query when the menu is opened.; ; The toolbar can listen for bookmark notifications. When the parent of any changed item is the toolbar folder (not common); regenerate the contents. When a toolbar menu is opened; it can execute a query and dynamically generate the content as needed.; ; This should save a lot of observer overhead.

Title: Dont maintain visible item lists in results unless tree is present
Description: Currently; we always maintain large lists of visible elements in nsNavHistoryResults for use in the tree view. Some results (like the bookmarks menu) do not have tree views attached; and these lists are not necessary. We can save some processing and a bunch of memory by not maintaining this list if no tree is attached.

Title: context menu Bookmark this link... is broken
Description: Currently; right clicking and trying to bookmark a link just brings up a broken and heightless dialog.

Title: Dont do places update when loaded in a background tab
Description: Listeners on results attached to trees that are invisible should not do complex requeries. It is likely that doing small incremental updates are still a performance win since they are fast and will save us from requerying when the tab is focused.

Title: [FIX] Leak when using history autocomplete
Description: BUILD:  Current Firefox trunk build; ; STEPS TO REPRODUCE:; ; 1) Start up Firefox; 2) Click in URL field; 3) Hit Alt+down to open history autocomplete; ; ACTUAL RESULTS: leak morkobjects; ; EXPECTED RESULTS: no leaks; ; This is going to be a safe fix that Id suggest for 1.8.0.x branch; I think.

Title: Users expect clearing history to clear searchbar also
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5; ; The google search bar dropdown box shows searches for weeks and will not clear; even though the option is to clear all data on exit. ; ; Also; option in Advanced Privacy to clear history is not functional; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Open Firefox; 2.Check google search bar dropdown history; 3.; ; Actual Results:  ; I simply reopen Firefox and check the google search bar drop down; *all* searches; remain; they *never* clear; ; Expected Results:  ; The same searches are *always there; they *never* clear; ; How about *clear* the history as its set to do

Title: Live Bookmarks should include a direct link to the site home-page
Description: Live Bookmarks should include a direct link to the site home-page; ; Live Bookmarks are great to see whats updated on a site/service. However; I often find myself opening a live bookmark; clicking on an arbitrary feed item; and them going from that page to the site home page.; ; Of course; I could also setup a normal bookmark for the site in addition to the Live Bookmark; then I have to have two bookmarks for each site.; ; I would suggest another special menu item at the bottom (top?) of the Live Bookmark menu with a link to the site home page. See the attached super-rough mock-up: http://actsofvolition.com/images/screenshots/firefox/live-bookmarks-request.png; ; It seems that the home page is provided in all RSS/Atom feeds either as:; ; <link rel=alternate type=text/html href=http://www.domain.com/dir/ />; ; or simply:; ; <link>http://www.domain.com/dir/</link>

Title: Passwords never saved (exceptions) is too hard to find
Description: Theres no reason passwords never saved should be in a background tab of the View Saved Passwords window. This makes it hard to find. There should instead be a Exceptions button next to the Remember passwords checkbox; much like on the Cookies tab.

Title: Close button on tabs show empty tooltip
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060120 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060120 Firefox/1.6a1; ; This is a fallout form bug 308396.; ; When hovering over the close button on any tab; an empty tooltip appears. moving the mouse over the rest of the tab; and it shows the correct [title of tab] tooltip.; ; ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. hover over the close button in any tab; 2.; 3.; ; Actual Results:  ; empty tooltip; ; Expected Results:  ; either a tooltip with [close tab] or no tooltip at all.

Title: Fix places tree styles on Mac
Description: The default tree styles on Mac dont have icons for folders. Since we will be drawing icons for favicons; well need the folder icons for the places tree view items as well.

Title: Rename form history database
Description: If it is low-overhead enough to have a separate database file open; we should move form history into its own database file.

Title: Consistent foreground vs. background opening of tabs
Description: It seems that there are many cases where tabs are opened in the foreground vs. the background differently. Theres very flimsy rationale for this in a few cases but it often breaks down. There is no way to open a link in the foreground using the mouse - unless you flip a default pref. ; ; It seems to me that the select new tabs opened from links should be a global default toggle; with a modifier key to override in specific instances for deterministic selection. This would be documented in the Tabbed Browsing preferences panel. ; ; The default for most users would be to open tabs in the foreground; with a modifier key to override into the background for specific use cases. Switching the pref would invert this.

Title: Clear history button in preferences doesnt work
Description: The clear history button calls globalhistory.count which gives an error. Either hack count to make it happy or fix the dialog box.

Title: Review browser/toolkit trunk-1.8 branch diff and add ifdefs as needed
Description: The browser/ and toolkit/ directories from the 1.8 branch and trunk are going to be synced; this bug tracks reviewing diff to ensure that changes that rely on non-synced core changes are appropriately ifdeffed (#if[n]def MOZILLA_1_8_BRANCH).

Title: Closing a container result node should close its children
Delete (backspace) should not clobber autocomplete entries on Mac
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Type some stuff into the address bar.; 2. Press Down arrow key.; 3. Press Delete; expecting it to delete the last character in the completed URL; or Option+Delete; expecting it to delete the last word in the completed URL.; ; Result: Autocomplete entry is deleted.; ; The change in bug 241774 makes sense on Windows; where Delete is delete-forward; but not on Mac; where Delete is backspace.

Title: setAnnotation() rounds large integers like JS time values
Description: When I annotate a URI with a JavaScript time value (milliseconds since the epoch) using the annotation services setAnnotation() method; the value gets rounded to the nearest ten millionth.  The services setAnnotationInt64() method; on the other hand; preserves the original value.; ; For example:; ; var orig = 1139013610987; // some time this afternoon; ans.setAnnotationInt64(uri; test/numberAsInt64; orig; 0; ans.EXPIRE_SESSION);; var asInt64 = ans.getAnnotation(uri; test/numberAsInt64);; ans.setAnnotation(uri; test/numberAsVariant; orig; 0; ans.EXPIRE_SESSION);; var asVariant = ans.getAnnotation(uri; test/numberAsVariant);; // orig == 1139013610987; // asInt64 == 1139013610987; // asVariant == 113901e+12 a.k.a. 1139010000000; ; Perhaps this is actually a bug in the variant implementation.  In any case; Ill attach a testcase shortly to demonstrate the problem.

Title: Spell check this field menuitem does not get checked.
Description: The style for this element needs to declare itself as a checkable item in browser-context.inc. This only seems to affect some platforms.

Title: Redirects dont get link coloring until reload
Description: In the redirect handling code (not checked in yet) in the Places NavHistory; we dont send out observer notifications when redirects are visited. This either needs to be added to docshell or navhistory.

Title: Allow search plugins to have a search page URL for blank searches
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; ; I often use keyword searches (currently keyword bookmarks) with and without the %s parameter substitution.; ; Would be nice if future keyword searching could use a different url for non-parameter requests vs those with a parameter request.; ; For example:; bug would use url http://bugzilla.mozilla.org; bug 317107 would use url https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=%s; ; g would use url http://www.google.com; g keyword would use http://www.google.com/search?q=%s&hl=en; ; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: Give untitled pages default names like the old history service
langpack files are world writable
Description: By default; the langpack files contained in the .xpi file and the sub-jar package are mode 666 (world-readable and -writable).  644 would be much better; as other local users couldnt do evil things to the langpack files (not sure how possible it is to accomplish this; but filing under security for now -- only exploits possible are local exploits; though with an NFS install the risk is slightly higher)

Title: Make Subscriptions Work Better
Description: - add a post-date annotation for every entry in a feed folder; - set the expiry of this any any other related annotations to no more than the lifetime of the item (i.e. before the next livemark refresh) - prevents the annotation table from bloating; - implement a sortingAnnotation property on nsINavHistoryQueryOptions; and add a SORT_BY_ANNOTATION_DESCENDING/ASCENDING to the set of sortingMode options; that can sort the result set based on annotation content. ; - finish the attached prototype patch; which implements a special tree view for subscriptions so that unread items can be displayed etc.

Title: Advanced Search refinements
Description: 1. kill search bookmarks only checkbox. data is data is data. ; 2. kill maximum results field. its not like the view is paged; we have a scrollbar. ; 3. URI and host are terrible names. consolidate into a single location or URL field; 4. the data entry text boxes need to query on a timeout; not immediately; this causes performance problems. theres a special type of textbox that only acts after the user stops typing for X seconds.

Title: Searching History changes sort order
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060131 Firefox/1.5; ; Searching the History; even for a blank string ior a string found in every URL; cahnges the order in which the items are displayed.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Create a new Firefox profile; 2. Launch Firefox using that profile; 3. Visit several sites at the same domain; 4. Show Places; 5. Select History from the Places sidebar; 6. Notice sort order of items shown; 7. Type the <Return> key; performing a blank search; 8. Enter a letter from the visited domain in the Search box; 9. Type the <Return> key; searching for that letter; 10. Click Show Places again; ; Actual Results:  ; Items shown in the list reverse their sort order when a search is performed; then revert to the original order when Show Places is clicked again.; ; Expected Results:  ; Searching should not change the sort order.  When a search is performed that doesnt filter the results; the displayed list should not change at all.; ; This is the 20060131 Places build; posted as the 20060128 nightly.

Title: Places builds fail win32 MSVC 7.1 or below
Description: I have attempted to build with places enabled and every build I try fails in the same manner. ;         d:/Programs\src\trunk\mozilla\browser\components\places\src\nsNavBookmar; ks.cpp(1369) : see reference to class template instantiation nsDerivedSafe<T>; being compiled;         with;         [;             T=nsNavHistoryQueryOptions;         ]; make[7]: Leaving directory `/d/Programs/src/trunk/firefox-places/browser/components/places/src; ; I have tried building msys static; trunk msys shared and a 1.8 branch cygwin static. Using MSVC 7.1 for all builds. This has been happening since the 9th or so.

Title: Feed Document System Handling
Description: In the absence of a feed reader on the system; Firefox should steal the handler for feed documents when set as default browser; so that when user clicks on a link from another application (e.g. mail; IM etc) their non-default browser (IE7) does not start. It is certainly no more suited for dispatch of such things than Firefox; compared to a real feed reader.

Title: Speed up mork history import
Description: Currently when importing history entries; we call setPageDetails() and then addVisit() to add a visit on the last visit date.  This does more queries than we really need to since in both cases it checks whether the page already exists in history.  We could combine these into a single (non-interface) method on nsNavHistory and reduce the amount of querying.

Title: nsNavHistory::Init allows improper initialization
Description: If nsNavHistory::Init fails; it will permanently leak the nsNavHistory object through pref observers and observerservice observers: CreateLookupIndexes() should be called before attaching observers. Once we attach observers we should not throw exceptions. In addition; there are situations (such as when getService is called with an interface nsNavHistory doesnt implement) where the constructor function itself could fail. We should use a specialty singleton constructor func to ensure against error.

Title: cannot add RSS feed to bookmarks (live bookmarks not working)
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060215 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060215 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060215 Firefox/1.6a1 ID:2006021514; ; feed icon on locationbar not working.; so cannot add feed to bookmark by click feed icon.; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: Right-clicking a bookmark inside a folder on the Places bar causes focus problems
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060216 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060216 Firefox/1.6a1; ; When you open a folder on the Places bar; then right-click a bookmark inside that folder; the folder does not lose focus when you click elsewhere in the browser window. The folders icon still looks pressed-in; and trying to type into a textbox or other form control fails. Clicking the folder again; then clicking in the content area again; restores functionality.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open a folder on the Places bar.; 2. Right-click one of the bookmarks in that folder.; 3. Left-click in the content area of the browser.; ; Actual Results:  ; The folder still appears selected (although the menu is dismissed). Trying to type into a textbox fails.; ; Expected Results:  ; The folder will not appear to be selected; and the content area will have focus.

Title: Middle-clicking a Places toolbar folder does not open in tabs
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060216 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060216 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Previously; middle-clicking a bookmark folder would open all of the bookmarks inside in tabs. With the landing of Places; that functionality is gone. See bug 325781 comment 15.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Middle-click a Places toolbar folder with at least 2 bookmarks in it.; ; ; Actual Results:  ; The click is completely ignored.; ; Expected Results:  ; Each bookmark opens in its own tab.

Title: unable to add items to the bookmarks menu via overlays (bookmarksMenuPopup)
Description: In my overlay in a extension I have:; <menu id=menu_BookmarksPopup>; <menuitem label=&${project}-reload.label; tooltiptext=&${project}-reload.tooltiptext; oncommand=${project}.reloadLiveBookmarks() />; </menu>; <menu id=bookmarksMenuPopup>; <menuitem label=&${project}-reload.label; tooltiptext=&${project}-reload.tooltiptext; oncommand=${project}.reloadLiveBookmarks() />; </menu>; ; but Im seem unable to use the bookmarksMenuPopup id to add items to the bookmarks menu. Before places menu_BookmarksPopup worked just fine

Title: Submenus of bookmarks menus height is huge then it goes normal
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060216 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060216 Firefox/1.6a1; ; See capture; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. click bookmark menu; 2. open a sub folder; ; Actual Results:  ; Huge height then normal height for the submenu; ; Expected Results:  ; normal height for the submenu

Title: Drag and drop feedback for menus only working on Windows 1.8 branch
Description: Drag and drop feedback for menus should use margin styles on the menuitems to draw a line where the item will be dropped; and it should highlight folders it auto-opens.  This works correctly on the 1.8 branch in Windows; but not in the trunk; and not on Mac or Linux.

Title: Middle clicking an item in the places view should open it in a new tab
Description: As with the rest of firefoxs ui; middle clicking an item in the places view should open it in a new tab. Currently double middle-clicking does this.

Title: Margins on tabbrowser from places.css
Description: The right hand scrollbar is not flush against the edge of the window; there is a space of a few millimeters the same is true for the bottom; the space in the top is between the tab bar and the places bar. The left side does not have a space. It looks like it is appcontent that has the extra space. The tab bar is also white.

Title: 0 days of history is still a lot
Description: Steps to reproduce:; ; 1. Make a new profile and delete history.dat; bookmarks_history.sqlite and delete the contents of bookmarks.html.; 2. Run Firefox with enabled Places; go to some sites with many links and open some hundreds in tabs. Set them all to multiple homepages (that the quickest ways I know to repeat the test).; 3. Set Options > Privacy > History to 0 days and close Firefox.; 4. Then inspect the bookmarks_history.sqlite.; 5. Expected behaviour: there should be no visited urls.

Title: Bookmark backups missing
Description: When bookmarks_history.sqlite corrupts; you have nothing anymore. Only the old bookmarks.html file in your profile folder hopefully.

Title: Expose bookmark import/export in UI
Description: We should expose the ability to import and export bookmarks.html in the UI. This will allow people to at least backup or restore bookmarks in this format. For example; for bug 327894 we may want to save backups in HTML format; so the import feature will allow you to restore them later.

Title: Firefox doesnt allow you to create custom Search Plugins
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; ; Firefox doesnt allow you to create custom Search Plugins.; However an extension called Search Engine Ordering allows the user to do this.; (This extension also allows to reorder and delete search plugins; but bugs are already filed for that; so wont bring that up much).; ; Opera 9 P2; Google Toolbar 4 Beta for IE allow you to create custom plugins.; ; Merging Add a Keyword along with Creating Search Plugin would be great; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: Places bookmark toolbarbutton needs its own icon
Description: Bug 327400 gave the Star (On|Off) button an icon from Bookmarks-toolbar.png; but bug 328243 put that in the #else of an #ifdef MOZ_PLACES; so now unless you use text or icon+text; its invisible.

Title: printf in nsNavHistory.cpp
Description: Looks like the checkin for bug 319228 accidently uncommented a printf that should maybe be #ifdef DEBUG_BRETTW or some such: viewing history spews Constructed the query:... to the console.

Title: provide a notification for history expiration
Description: Currently; there is no way for an observer to watch for history expiration that happens in nsNavHistory::VacuumDB().  I think we need to provide something; to be consistent with user-initiated clearing of history.

Title: Statusbar URLs of bookmarks-menu missing in Places builds
Description: When I hover over a bookmark I see undefined in the statusbar.; Id also vote for a statusbar URL for every link in the bookmarks toolbar.

Title: Cant create bookmark by dragging link to bookmarks-menu
Description: The most usual and quickest way for me to create a new bookmark is dragging a link; favicon or tab to the bookmarks-menu. While dragging I decide where to put it; because all folders expand automatically and I can see what is inside it.; This is broken.

Title: Live Bookmark icon is not showing in the Bookmarks menu nor in Places.

Title: Static Bookmarks Menu Items
Description: Per: http://wiki.mozilla.org/Places:User_Interface#Bookmarks_Menu; ; - Bookmark this Page opens Filing Dialog; - Bookmark all Tabs opens Filing Dialog in All Tabs mode; - Search in Bookmarks shows search popup; - Organize Bookmarks shows organizer window

Title: Move Open in Tabs code out of the menu view and into the browser glue
Description: The menu.xml view currently carries this notion of an Open in Tabs menu item; which is specific to the browsers instantiation of this item. Moving it into the browser code therefore would be preferable as it would make the MVC architecture cleaner.

Title: No search results in bookmarks
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Create a new profile and put a bookmarks.html and a history.dat file in it.; 2. After starting up go to Places and select in the left hand panel: Bookmarks Menu.; 3. Then perform a search for a word you see in the bookmarks (I see pr so I search for pr).; Result: it only finds matches in the history.; ; NB: this works somewhat better in a older profile. I do see some results there but only a fraction of the results that I see in non-Places builds.

Title: Move livemark expiration annotation to folder URI
Description: Random URIs that have never been deleted will be expired; so setting annotations on them is useless since the item will get deleted the next time the user shuts down. If this annotation is associated with a folder place: URI; it will not get deleted. See also bug 327162 (delete invalid livemark annotations).

Title: The property of history is not displayed by places view.
Description: The property of a bookmark is displayed by FIXED of bug322988.; But in history; an error alert is displayed and a property screen is not displayed.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Mac OS X 10.3.9; Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060307; Firefox/1.6a1

Title: Size Add Bookmark window and Bookmark Properties window not remembered after a restart
Description: They are both called Bookmark Properties window BTW.

Title: Bookmark properties window is rather tall
Description: Bookmark properties is >3x the height of my screen and; after resizing; leaves bottom buttons and part of the folder tree box cropped. (I have a bunch of crufty old bookmark folders from; uh; the 90s or something)

Title: Search for search
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Go to Places; 2. Click on History or Bookmarks Menu.; 3. Click on the Magnifier glass and choose All Bookmarks and History.; Result: it searches for the word Search.

Title: bookmark context menu Properties mislabeled as Get Info on gtk
Description: STR: right-click on bookmarks/places toolbar item; Expected: bottom item Properties; Actual: bottom item Get Info

Title: Add support for POST keywords
Description: See bug 318817

Title: %s in quick search should disable redirect
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060308 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060308 Firefox/1.6a1; ; .; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Create a new bookmark having :; - Location: http://packages.qa.debian.org/common/index.html?src=%s; - Shortcut: dp; 2. Type dp firefox in the location bar; Actual Results:  ; It opens http://packages.qa.debian.org/%/firefox.html; ; Expected Results:  ; It should open http://packages.qa.debian.org/f/firefox.html; ; Reason for this is that http://packages.qa.debian.org/common/index.html?src=abcd is redirected to http://packages.qa.debian.org/a/abcd.html (http status 302 redirect).

Title: No open in tabs in context menu for subfolder in the case that bookmarks toolbar is overflow

Title: Editable bookmark properties are shown for live bookmarks
Description: Items in live bookmark folders shouldnt be editable

Title: Deprecated property window.title used.  Please use document.title instead. (bookmark properties)
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060310 Firefox/1.6a1 ID:2006031010; ; repro:; 1.Open bookmarks menu (any); 2.rightclick>properties; ; result:; Deprecated property window.title used.  Please use document.title instead. (bookmark properties)

Title: Open in Tabs should respect browser.tabs.loadFolderAndReplace
Description: At least pending a fix for bug 175124; Open in Tabs should pay attention to loadFolderAndReplace; and thus by default should be destroying all existing tabs before opening new ones.

Title: When deleting a subfolder on bookmarks toolbar; the contents of the folder stays on the screen
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Start Firefox with a bookmarks.html in it.; 2. Open a folder on the bookmarks toolbar; rightclick on a folder in it; choose Delete.; Result; the folder gets deleted; de menu closes; but the popup stays on the screen and you cant get rid of it by clicking in the page.

Title: Changing URL bookmark loses favicon
Description: Since Bug 329797 is fixed I can change the contents of a bookmarklet. But now it changes the icon that I always use for this bookmarklet into a neutral one; what makes it hard to recognize it quickly between other bookmarklets on my toolbar.; The only way I currently know to solve this problem is to change the URL field contents of bookmarks.html in another browser; and then import it daily into the places build; but that means that Ill also lose my history every day.

Title: Places window uses window colour for GUI
Description: The places window deliberately uses the CSS colour constant window for the main GUI area; which makes the 3-pane sunken items look really stupid (white with 3D sunken items in it). It really should be using the default skin colour here.; ; http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/browser/themes/winstripe/browser/places/places.css#2

Title: Provide a simple API for querying the contents of a bookmark folder
Description: We should expose a simple API for the common use case of querying all of a folders children.

Title: Firefox copies only addresses not titles
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Click History -> Search in History.; 2. Type a; press Back button; then click on a date in the calendar. This roundabout way is currently necessary because the Group by Page button is missing and I dont see it in the View menu either.; 3. Right-click -> Select All.; 4. Right-click -> Copy.; 5. Then paste it into a text editor.; Result: youll see only adresses; not the titles and this makes it rather worthless.; ; This also goes for bookmarks; although this is not very important because there is always a bookmarks.html in the backups which can be viewed in a browser window.

Title: See only tree structure in properties window on not bookmarked sites
Description: Steps to reproduce: ; 1. Start Firefox and on your homepage rightclick and choose Bookmark this Page.; 2. In the Properties window youll see a tree structure of bookmarks folders.; 3. Now go to another page and call Properties window again.; Result: tree structure gone.; ; Tree structure is also missing when I rightclick on bookmark and choose Properties (or is this intentional).

Title: Sort by No Grouping doesnt work
Description: Sort by No Grouping in History doesnt work.; Although you change to No Grouping; nothing is happened.; Always Group by sort is used.; ; Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060315 Firefox/1.6a1

Places need to use browser.tabs.loadBookmarksInBackground.; simple whay will be to use openUILinkIn( url; tab ) ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:

Open Places; 2. Type something in the search field; 3. Click on (+) button to show the query builder; 4. Click on a Place from the Places List to show its contents.; ; Actual Results:  ; Query builder doesnt disappear; although the search results are no longer displayed.; ; Expected Results:  ; Query builder disappears.

Create a new Bookmark item in Bookmarks Menu in Places; 2. Delete it with the Delete key; 3. Select Edit | Undo in the menu; ; Actual Results:  ; Nothing happens.; ; Expected Results:  ; The deleted item comes back.

Title: Other icons Places toolbar do not honour icons only mode and always have text
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060319 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060319 Firefox/1.6a1; ; It is not possible to drop any icons on Places toolbar without breaking layout.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Run Customize...; 2. Switch to show Icons.; 3. Take New tab button and drop on Places toolbar at the very first position.; ; Actual Results:  ; The button is shown with label.; ; Expected Results:  ; Only a small icon should be shown.; ; Places itself showns bookmars with text. I guess it also modifies Places toolbar mode to show text for all buttons.

Title: Places always opens bookmark from menu item in top-most window
Description: On a Mac; you cant just open a bookmark menu item selection in the top-most window because the top-most window may not be the key window. Places should open bookmarks from menu items in the same window that the initiating menu item belongs to.; ; To reproduce this problem; you need to get the window manager into a state where the front-most browser window is not the key/main window. I dont have a reliable way to do this; but it happens frequently. The result is that you can see a key/main window; but bookmark selections open in a window that does not have key/main chrome.

Title: Display the search scope (e.g. Current Collection Only) in the search field
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060322 Firefox/2.0a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060322 Firefox/2.0a1; ; Its not necessarily clear what is searched by default: currently viewed content or all Places. There is no way to check this other than clicking the magnifying glass.; ; Instead of just Search; the grey text in the search field should be more descriptive and tell the current search scope i.e. Search Current Collection or Search All Bookmarks and History. A nice little thing to make things more streamlined and intuitive.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: Accelerate keys conflict in bookmark organizer window.
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7.8) Gecko/20050607 Firefox/1.0.4; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS sun4u; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060322 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Accelerate keys conflict.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Launch firefox and expand Bookmarks menu.; 2. Select Organize Bookmarks menu to open the bookmark manage window.; 3. Press Alt+F to expand File menu in this popup window.; ; Actual Results:  ; New folder window will popup instead of expanding File menu. This leads to fail opening top menu File in this window.; ; Expected Results:  ; There should not be two command with same accelerate key.; ; This bug can be reproduced on Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS sun4u; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060322 Firefox/1.6a1. ; System info:; Sun Blade 100; SNV_35/Vermilion_07.

Title: Places query ignores onlyBookmarked
Description: I have a problem with the onlyBookmarked property of nsINavHistoryQuery. According to the IDL comment: Setting this is equivalent to listing all bookmark folders in the folders parameter.. Yet when I create a tree setting onlyBookmarked to true for the query I still see the History and Subscriptions folders at the top level.; ; I may be misinterpreting the property; or calling the tree incorrectly so Ill attach a testcase to show exactly what Im doing.

Title: Unable to return bookmarks to natural sort order
Description: Clicking on column headers toggles between the two different sorts; but there should be a third state for the natural bookmark sort order.

Title: Fix GROUP_BY_FOLDER in query system
Description: The current query system doesnt do anything with GROUP_BY_FOLDER. It just assumes for bookmark queries that you want folders; and for history queries you dont. The only thing this option would help is for nested tags if you want all items in the folder and its descendents to appear in a flat list. Apparently we arent supporting this; so we can remove this flag.

Title: bookmark folder icon and functionality change when drag&droping link
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060219 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060219 Firefox/1.6a1; ; when the personal toolbar folder is used as toolbar with subfolders and a link is draged & droped in one of these subfolders the icon changes from a folder to a link icon and no further links can be draged&droped on it. clicking on it still opens the folder; but you can no longer drag & drop links INTO it.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. enable bookmarks toolbar; 2. create subfolder in personal toolbar folder; 3. drag & drop a link on this folder; 4. see it change appearance and functionality; ; ; ; Expected Results:  ; should not change appearance and further drag & drops should open the folder

Title: [BeOS] Wrong drop down shown when right-clicking bookmarks in folders on Places toolbar
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (BeOS; U; BeOS BePC; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060325 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (BeOS; U; BeOS BePC; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060325 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Menu displayed is appropriate for folders; not bookmarks.  Displayed menu is ; open all in tabs; cut; copy; paste; delete; get info; ; Should be ; Open; Open in a New Window; Open in a New Tab; etc.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. create a folder on the Places Toolbar with at least one bookmark inside; 2. click the folder to open dropdown of bookmarks; 3. right-click a bookmark; ; Actual Results:  ; wrong menu is displayed.; ; Expected Results:  ; should be able to open in tab; new window; etc.

Title: Places window opens unexpectedly in the background
Description: Im afraid I cant prove it; but with a new profile and a freshly imported bookmarks.html and history.dat file Places opens sometimes in the background. About one out of three times. I see Places only in a flash and then it is hidden behind Firefoxs window.; Maybe this is related to Bug 330906.

Component returned failure code: 0x80070057 (NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE) [nsINavBookmarksService.getItemTitle]  nsresult: 0x80070057 (NS_ERROR_ILLEGAL_VALUE)  location: JS frame :: chrome://browser/content/places/bookmarkProperties.js :: BPP__populateProperties :: line 2707  data: no]; ; and empty title and location in the Add Bookmark dialog.

Title: Middle-clicking Bookmarks Toolbar / non-bookmark items in Bookmarks menu opens all bookmarks in tabs
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060326 Firefox/2.0a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060326 Firefox/2.0a1; ; Middleclick in any spare space on that toolbar (ie not on a bookmark) and it will launch bookmarks in tabs and in popup windows.; Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060326 Firefox/2.0a1 ID:2006032702 ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.View -> Toolbars ->Bookmarks Toolbar; 2.Middle click ( MOuse wheel) on any unused part of that toolbar; 3.; ; Actual Results:  ; This single Middle Click opened multiple tabs; some real and some empty and multiple popups. It seems that for every pop up it also spawns a empty tab; ; Expected Results:  ; Didnt expect any such Middler Click behaviour

Title: Open All in Tabs does not work when no browser window is open
Description: openLinksInTabs has divergent handling for:; - opening folders in tabs; - opening a multiple selection in tabs; ; ... these two should be unified. ; ; Also; the function is very long/difficult to follow. ; ; It also needs to handle opening links in tabs when there is no browser window open already.

Title: Grouping No Longer Works
Description: Grouping no longer works in Places Organizer UI need to re-hook it up.

Title: Separator line not drawn continuously
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060328 Firefox/2.0a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060328 Firefox/2.0a1; ; In Places separators have gaps near their left end.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open places; 2. Create a separator in a bookmarks folder
