I think that a good name can be; The Ocho alpha 1 (codename of the Firefox 2); ; Reproducible: Always

Title: [Mac] Download Actions description is too small
Description: The Download Actions description in the preferences window (downloads tab) is; too small comparing to the rest of the window.

Title: Tweak wheel+modifiers preferences on OS X
Description: Tweak wheel+modifiers preferences on OS X.; ; Shift+Scroll: * In 1.7 - was mapped to back/forward (using the horizontal scroll;                 prefs).;               * In 1.8 - works as horizontal-scrolling; as expected.; ; Ctrl+wheel: should be mapped to History.; Cmd+wheel: text size; Opt+wheel: scroll line by line

Title: Dragging a url to the tabstrip ignores the shift key
Description: When shift is pressed during URL d&d; were supposed to temporary reverse the; loadInBackground pref. This isnt done for the tabstrip.

Title: File->Import doesnt focus migration wizard if its already opened
Description: File->Import doesnt focus migration wizard if its already opened.

Title: Remove keyboard and mouse shortcuts for other browsers from docs
Description: The Keyboard Shortcuts document has wrong entries for MacIE.

Title: safe mode: add support for disabling all extensions
Description: Spun off so I can resolve bug 304403.; ; Need a new EM method to disable all addons of all types; excepting app disabled; and app managed addons.; Unhide checkbox; and make it trigger this method.; ; Not going to happen for 1.5

Title: Enable SVG by default in configure
Description: Now that everyone is using cairo; we can and should enable SVG/canvas by default; for Firefox on the 1.8 branch. (We should do this on the trunk too; but that; depends on the cairo upgrade on trunk which hasnt happened yet). This may; require adding --disable-svg --disable-canvas to a couple of the older branch; tinderboxen which cant build cairo (balsa and maybe crazyhorse).

Title: Safe Mode UI: Make Changes and Restart button should be disabled if no action is checked
Description: The Make Changes and Restart button in the safe mode window should be disabled; if no action is checked.

Title: If the prefwindow is modal; Use Current Pages should use the prefwindow opener as the current pages rather than the last focused browser window
Description: The Use Current Pages button in the preferences window uses the last focuseed; browser window as the Current Pages. This is OK for instant-apply mode; (default on OS X / GNOME); but sort of broken if the preference window is modal; (default on Windows).; ; Marking this as a regression since the old prefwindow did use the opener.

Title: context menu option for Safe Mode on the start menu Internet icon
Description: An option for Preferences already exists; adding another option for Safe Mode; could be useful as another location to point to for easy access. There already; is a safe mode shortcut in the Start Menu folder; but its not as obvious and; may not always be there (if the user doesnt install the shortcut icons; or; deletes them; etc).; ; See bug 311466 comment 7.

Title: Support Migration of multi-tab group set as homepage
Description: This spawned from bug 313529 Migration of home page. Currently; Migration of a multi-tab group set as homepage brings over just the first page of the group. ; ; mconnors comment 14 of bug 313529:; multiple homepages is a more advanced feature; and our current method of; storing these is pretty bogus; so I passed on implementing it.; ; So it looks like we need to improve how a multi-page homepage is stored so that we can implement Migrating such homepages from other apps.

Title: Firefox crashes on startup if bookmarkbackups/ is unreadable [@nsBookmarksService::ArchiveBookmarksFile]
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051026 Firefox/1.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051026 Firefox/1.5; ; If the bookmarkbackups/ directory in your profile is unreadable (not chmod +r); Firefox will crash on startup.; ; If it is readable; even if its not writable or executable; it wont crash.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. chmod 000 bookmarkbackups/; 2. Start Firefox; Actual Results:  ; Firefox crashes; ; Expected Results:  ; Firefox would start up normally; though it certainly wouldnt make a backup of bookmarks.html.; ; Standard Firefox nightly; empty profile.; ; It was also confirmed on a trunk CVS build by Mook in #firefox.; ; Heres what he had to say about what causes it:; ; <Mook> http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/browser/components/bookmarks/src/nsBookmarksService.cpp#4395 backupFileNames.mImpl is null; <Mook> strange; hasMoreElements is 0...; <Mook> hmm; existingBackups->mRawPtr is null; <Mook> Peng: file it as http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/browser/components/bookmarks/src/nsBookmarksService.cpp#4377 existingBackups needs a null check.; <Mook> Of course; you probably know better than I do :); <Mook> well; existingBackups is null; so http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/browser/components/bookmarks/src/nsBookmarksService.cpp#4383 crashes due to dereferencing a null nsCOMPtr.; ; Thats mostly over my head; of course. :P

Title: #urlbar style rules dont belong in toolkits autocomplete.css
Description: Bug 263750 added browser-specific style rules to toolkits autocomplete.css; because those rules are only wanted when using gnomestripe. This can be fixed by ifdefing winstripes browser.css and adding the rules there.

Title: Make use of nsIDOMPopupBlockedEvents popupWindowName for opening blocked popups
Description: This is possible now that bug 314427 is fixed.

Title: help menu item check for updates shares access key with downloading %S...
Description: in the Help menu the item check for updates uses the access key o from the word for. when downloading an update; the label changes to downloding %S...; but the access key remains the same. in english this isnt a problem since both lables have o in them; but can be a problem in other locales.

Title: Create Accessibility section in Help Documentation
Description: Description: ; ; An Accessibility Section is needed in the Firefox Documentation.  Here are some considerations for writing this section:; ; The accessibility help should be aimed at the end user as the audience.  The real issue here is that there is some accessibility features documented in some places.  They all need to be accumulated into one place.  For example; if I say toggling images should be documented; even if it is documented somewhere else; it needs to be specifically in the accessibility section.  It should be  one stop shop for all accessibility questions.  Now; since keyboard bindings are documented and the section is quite large a link to the section within the accessibility help should suffice.  Some starting points can be:; ; - Link to keyboard bindings ; - Toggle Images; javascript; audio/video playback; etc; - Changing and overriding text/background colors/fonts/sizes; - Setting FIrefox to use system fonts and colors as opposed to its own or the web pages fonts and colors.; - Section on what is possible to accomplish with changing stylesheets.; - If accessibility extensions are going to be considered; provide instructions that will help the user obtain accessibility extensions. Then Provide Keyboard binding information for the extensions; - How to use the search function; for instance document that ctrl+g performs a find again; since this is not an expected keyboard shortcut.; - Section on how to configure Firefox to handle Tabbed Browsing.; - Section on enabling caret browsing; and clipboard features.; - Section documenting the profiles functionality of firefox and how to create; change; and invoke them.  As well as how accessibility features are affected; i.e. user defined style sheets; - Blocking popups; ; Separate subsections for the following may be helpful; - FireFox features for accessibility ( overall picture; keyboard access); - Customization for accessibility (color; font; toolbars if any ); - Any new features that might help accessibility  or features that work different. ( like the find feature which works a little differently; tabbed browsing); - Any advance features

Title: Save custom encoding (last charset) in annotation service
Description: When the user manually specifies an encoding for a web page; it should be saved in the annotation service and re-used when the page is later loaded. Currently; this information appears to be stored in bookmarks; so at least those are consistent when you go back to them. This should happen for all web pages; and for the new bookmark service.

Title: Read only Nodes
Description: Some nodes in the Places list we do not want to delete; e.g. the Bookmarks Toolbar and Menu item; and the views that let you access history. There should be a way for specifying that a node cannot be removed.

Title: Support for Arbitrary Property/Annotation based Querying
Description: Queries should be able to be constructed based on the presence or value of arbitrary properties which are stored separately in the annotation table.

Title: Advanced Search Query Builder UI
Description: A dialog that allows complicated and/or tests to be constructed.

Title: Clipboard Bug of Death
Description: You should not be able to paste leaf nodes into the left side pane. Commands for paste etc should be updated properly to reflect the state of the content on the clipboard. Currently things are a bit of a mess in this regard.

Title: Drag and Drop Feedback for Personal Toolbar
Description: There needs to be drag and drop feedback for the personal toolbar. This needs to work even in Luna on XP (in Firefox 1.0 and 1.5 it only worked in the classic theme in Windows; not Luna). Rather than drawing a nasty bar like in 1.x; I suggest using an arrow like for tab D&D; or coming up with something more interesting.

Title: Add history transitions
Description: The history system is designed so that we can store the visit you came from. This isnt always possible with the current docshell architecture since you could have the same page open in more than one tab/window and we cant tell them apart.; ; However; we can get most of the way by just linking each visit to the most recent visit of the referring URL.

Title: No way to bookmark a group of tabs (all tabs)
Description: The bookmark all the tabs at once option appears to have gone away in Places.

Title: Going back/forward to places is not instantaneous
Description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE; 1. Go to http://damowmow.com/; 2. Bookmarks | Show Places; 3. Go | Back; 4. Go | Forward; ; ACTUAL RESULTS; Going back and forward from/to the Places view (3 and 4 above) is slow.; ; EXPECTED RESULTS; Going back and forward from/to the Places view should be blazingly fast.

Title: Places browser is focusable
Description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE; 1. Open Places.; 2. Click the location bar.; 3. Press Tab.; 4. Goto 3.; ; ACTUAL RESULTS; Tab order; from location bar; is:;   Location bar;   Search box;   Tab;   Outer space;   Views pane on the left;   New Folder button;   etc.; ; EXPECTED RESULTS; Outer space should not be focused between the Tab and the Views pane tab stops.

Title: Bad context menus on magical entries in the places view list box
Description: You should not be able to right-click a places view list box item and do things like Open in New Tab.

Title: places-menupopup binding should be smarter about updates
Description: Currently; the menu binding rebuilds itself each time its opened.  It would be useful to cache the content and rebuild it only when needed.  As part of this; we should make sure that we dont needlessly attach bookmark/history observers; or theyll pile up and slow down updates.

Title: Keyboard modifier (shift;ctrl;alt) and left-clicking on a link creates an event that is NOT cancelable by event handler
Description: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.6) Gecko/20040113; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051111 Firefox/1.5; ; The following link ; ; Show Bug; ; has the onclick attribute set in order to define an event handler. Here; the handler just returns false to ask the UA to cancel the default event action.[*]; ; Now press a modifier key while clicking on the link and suddenly the link can be activated: it may open in a tab or even in a new window.; ; ; ; [*] Of course; it does not make any sense to have a link that can not be activated but its just there as proof of concept.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; ; ; ; Expected Results: ; Expected: Nothing should happen.

Title: Add bookmark function to check bookmarks for redirects
Description: Bookmark and annotation consumers will want to know which pages have ever redirected to a given page. See:; ; http://wiki.mozilla.org/Browser_History:Redirects

Title: Reload/Stop commands not properly updated
Description: After the patch in 318823; the commands for stop and reload are not properly updated - they are simply enabled when the user switches away from Places; regardless of whether or not the tab they switch to can be reloaded or stopped.

Title: Add max results to query options
Rename navHistory contract ID
Description: To nav-history-service

Title: History view changes should change sorting
Description: When you toggle between group by domain and group by visit the default sorting mode should change. Domain should be displayed alphabetically (its weird to see this sorted by last visit date). Visits should be sorted by date by default.

Title: Send more information with history/bookmark notifications
Description: We should send along whatever information about the item being added/changed/removed that we have available when we notify observers; so that they can avoid doing extra queries.

Title: Allow querying for all visits of a URL (or portion?)
Add query options flag to show hidden entries
Optimize query updates for common cases
Description: The common things well see are:; - bookmark folders; - time-delimited queries; - host-based grouping; - keyword-based queries; ; In these cases; the update code should be able to respond to notifications and insert items properly without having to recompute the result set. In more complex cases; we can still just requery.

Title: Move collapse duplicates from a result to options
Queries in the bookmark toolbar/menu dont act like folders
Fix icons for generic leaf items
Description: In the places view; generic non-faviconed leaf items have no icon. ; ; Also; we need an icon for collections of history results.

Title: Interesting bookmarks copy-paste behavior
Description: Steps to reproduce:; ; 1. select a bookmark in the places view; 2. hit Ctrl+C; 3. hit Ctrl+V; ; Expected results:; ; - bookmark duplicated; ; Actual results:; ; - item adjacent to bookmark vanishes; bookmark remains. Reloading the view shows the view as it was before.

Title: Add a top level Subscriptions item
Description: ... should contain all live bookmarks. Default grouping mode: by post; sorted by post date.

Title: Dont Change the title of feed items to the title of the homepage
Description: Titles in feeds are changed to the title of the page after clicking the live bookmark. Many feeds are commentary on other pages; so having the link change would be bad; and its confusing because the menu item changes after you click it.

Title: Finish remote container API
Bookmark queries should handle absence of GROUP_BY_FOLDER
Description: Currently; we generate bookmark folders regardless or grouping. However; we should only do this when you request group by folder. Grouping by something else should result in a regular query with only URLs in it grouped as you requested.; ; We will need to change every place we create a nsNavHistoryFolderResultNode and add this detection to GetSimpleBookmarksQueryFolder.

Title: Allow bookmark folders to be sorted and update properly
Description: Currently; bookmarks updates will fail if it is sorted other than the default.

Title: nsINavHistoryService::addVisit() should increment the visit count
Description: Calling this method should logically increment the visit count; but currently does not.

Title: Bookmark management should work when parent is a query
Description: Lots of operations (move; delete) wont work when the parent of a bookmark folder is a query. This happens in the subscriptions query.

Title: Folder delete undo
Description: When deleting a folder; the UI should do a bottom-up transaction so that the children will re-appear if the delete is undone.

Title: Firefox 2 Feed Handling Functionality
Description: This bug tracks all Firefox 2 Feed Handling features and issues.

Title: Keyboard shortcuts in places pane
Description: The delete key doesnt work in the places pane. Also; Enter doesnt do anything. In the old history implementation; Enter opened the web page. Do we want to keep this?

Title: Fully support remote containers
Description: Im getting lots of questions from people about the extensibility of this system. Were almost there. I think we need to support:; ; place:container=<encoded; escaped contract-id>?param=value&param=value; ; ... so that extensions can start playing with this. ; ; Basically an extension should be able to implement a component that implements at the very least:; ; nsINavHistoryContainerResultNode (the container itself; which tells the fe about the children it has); ; nsINavHistory*ResultNode (for the individual child results; returned by the aboves |getChild| method). ; ; It seems like there ought also be a generic tree view implementation that takes a nsINavHistoryContainerResultNode and uses it to back a nsITreeView impl.

Title: Rename nsIFormHistory to avoid changing interfaces
Description: The nsIFormHistory interface was changed on the 1.8 branch (and its a significantly different interface than it was). To avoid changing interfaces we should probably just rename this interface entirely. I can do this once the places codebase stabilizes a bit.

Title: Dont unnecessarily load favicon
Description: The favicon service loads favicons way more than it should. It is currently hooked in the same way the URL bar favicon thingy is. The result is that every time you change tabs; it will reload the favicon (probably from cache); save it in the DB; and fire a bunch of observers; which will redraw trees; update the toolbar; etc.; ; We currently do it in browser.js:PageProxySetIcon. We should hook up favicon notifications further upstream.; ; Further; it would be nice to have some policy where we dont keep having to reload the favicon data if weve loaded it recently for the same page or another page with the same favicon.

Title: History not shown via Ctrl-H or Go->History
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060201 Firefox/1.5 (mahowi); Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060201 Firefox/1.5 (mahowi); ; History is neither shown by pressing Ctrl-H nor by using the menu Go->History; only by Show Places.; BTW; if I open Places; theres an error in the JS console:; ; Error: PlacesController is not defined; Source file: chrome://browser/content/places/places.js; Line: 181; ; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Press Vtrl-H or Go->History to show up history; ; Actual Results:  ; Nothing happens; ; Expected Results:  ; History should be shown

Title: editAction.xul/pref.css/options.png/check.gif/dot.gif are unused and should be removed
Description: http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla1.8/search?string=editAction.xul; http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla1.8/search?string=pref.css; http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla1.8/source/browser/themes/pinstripe/browser/pref/; http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla1.8/source/toolkit/themes/winstripe/mozapps/pref/; http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla1.8/source/toolkit/themes/pinstripe/mozapps/pref/

Title: Open context options non functional in places bar folders
Description: The open options in the context menu for bookmarks in subfolders of the places bar are always greyed out; though they work for bookmarks at the top level of the places bar.; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060203 Firefox/1.6a1 ID:2006020309

Title: API should not allow creation of holes in bookmark folders
Description: The methods on nsINavBookmarkService currently allow specifying an arbitrary index for insertion of a new item or folder.  They should restrict the index to be at most 1 greater than the current highest index; to avoid holes in the bookmark table.

Title: Discoverability of places commands
Description: The old bookmark manager has huge buttons at the top for many common operations such as new folder and delete. Even the somewhat-useless Move helps new users who wouldnt have thought of drag-and-drop discover that they can move bookmarks at all.; ; We should make sure that the commands new users are likely to use are very obvious in the places pane.

Title: Should not be able to tag a new place as a livemark
Description: Steps to reproduce:; ; 1. visit a page; 2. click the Star button twice to bring up the property editor; ; Actual results:; ; Latest Headlines (a live bookmark) is shown in the tag list; ; Expected results:; ; Live bookmarks (which are read only folders) are not shown as available tagging options. ; ; Joe - you need to call getFolderReadonly on the bookmark service before you insert a folder into your stack.

Title: Provide some visual distinction to the tag view
Description: The tag list looks static and unclickable. Yes I know this is un-styled content. You should still differentiate it somehow as a hint to the theme guys.

Title: Properties panel should have reasonable minimum width
Description: My browser window is at its default size (about 1000px wide) and when I hit star; the properties window is too narrow to fit the set of tags contained within from the default bookmarks file. There is a rendering error. Rendering errors aside; it seems unfortunate to have to scroll anything at this narrow width. Maybe force the window a little wider?

Title: Bookmarks Toolbar slow to appear at launch
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060131 Firefox/1.5; ; At times; the bookmarks in the main Bookmarks Toolbar take roughly 10 seconds to appear after the window seems to have fully loaded at launch.  Show Places apepars in the corner; but no bookmarks or bookmark folders appear; and clicking where they would appear has no effect.; ; Once the bookmarks have appeared; behavior is normal for the remainder of the session.; ; This problem is intermittent.  I have not been able to determine exactly what circumstances cause it; but it appears to be more common after importing data (in particular; Im importing Safaris default bookmarks).  One launch may show the problem when the previous and succeeding launches dont.  On average it seems to happen once every 2 to 4 launches; once its started happening at all.; ; Reproducible: Sometimes; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Optional: Create a new Firefox profile; then import data from Safari; 2. Launch Firefox; 3. Watch Bookmarks Toolbar; ; Actual Results:  ; Bookmarks dont appear until roughly 10 seconds have passed.; ; Expected Results:  ; Bookmarks should appear more or less immediately.; ; This is the 20060131 Places build; posted as the 20060128 nightly.

Title: Importing twice from Safari corrupts history
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060131 Firefox/1.5; ; Importing data twice in a row from Safari corrupts the History; giving pages titles like 1138730833000000.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Launch Firefox; 2. Choose File:Import... and proceed through the dialogs to import data from Safari; 3. Repeat step 3; 4. Click Show Places; 5. Select History from the Places sidebar; ; Actual Results:  ; Some pages retain their proper titles; but others have titles like 1138730833000000.; ; Expected Results:  ; All pages should retain their titles.; ; This is the 20060131 Places build; posted as the 20060128 nightly.

Title: Open in Tabs gone from bookmark menus
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060131 Firefox/1.5; ; The separator line and Open in Tabs no longer appear in bookmark toolbar menus.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Click on a folder in the bookmark toolbar; e.g. Latest Headlines; ; Actual Results:  ; No Open in Tabs; ; Expected Results:  ; Open in Tabs after separator line at bottom; ; This is the 20060131 Places build; posted as the 20060128 nightly.

Title: Firefox should never copy storage.sdb from another profile
Description: Firefox should only use the stuff in its own current profile. ; Was very surprised when I saw old bookmarks in my newly made profile. It costed me some time to understand that it was a copy of the storage.sdb; made from old bookmarks found in a profile in Application Data that I never use. :); Only renaming the file in Application Data forced Firefox to create the correct files.; ; Steps to reproduce:; 1. Make a folder on your desktop and start Firefox with: ; start C:\firefox\places\firefox\firefox.exe -Profile profile/; 2. Wonder where the old bookmarks came from and discover that you can only prevent it by renaming the file in Application Data.

Title: Firefox doesnt remember the title of some pages
Description: Some pages are appearing in the history as (no title). I cant see any logical reason for this. I even have two separate entries that are the same apart from the fragment and one has its title correct and the other doesnt.; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060213 Firefox/1.6a1

Title: bms.getFolderReadonly(folder.folderId) doesnt agree with folder.childrenReadOnly for Latest Headlines when iterating through bookmarks tree
Description: When navigating a query result that returns the bookmarks tree; folder.childrenReadOnly==false and _bms.getFolderReadonly(folder.folderId)==true when folder is a nsINavHistoryFolderResultNode representing the Latest Headlines livemark folder.  These two values should be in agreement.

Title: Implement bookmark separators in menus and toolbar
Description: This is implemented on the backend now. You will get result nodes of type RESULT_TYPE_SEPARATOR.; ; Currently; separators dont show up in the menus and appear as buttons with page icons in the toolbar.

Title: Store last charset as an annotation
Description: I thought this was already a bug but I couldnt find it. This applies to the bookmarks importer; and all pages when the user changes it. We should use the last charset if it is set.

Title: No keyboard-accessible way to drop down options menu in Places search box
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; ; The main web search box allows you to press F4 to drop down the list of search engines.  The search box in Places has no such hotkey; AFAICT; there is no way to open the options menu in the Places search box without using a mouse.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open Places; 2. In Places search box; press F4; ; Actual Results:  ; nothing happens; ; Expected Results:  ; drop down Places search options menu

Title: No keyboard-accessible way to sort columns in Places results list
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; ; The results list in Places is sortable.  Clicking a column header sorts by that column; clicking again reverses the sort order.  There is no way to sort the results list with the keyboard.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: No keyboard-accessible way to select displayed columns in Places results list
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; ; The Places results list has a little widget in the upper-right (immediately to the right of the column headers) that allows you to select which columns are displayed.  There is no way to access this widget with the keyboard; and this functionality is not duplicated anywhere else.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open Places; 2. Select Bookmarks Menu in left-hand pane; 3. In the results pane; click the widget to the right of the column headers.  This drops down a menu of columns to display in the results pane.

Title: Places search box does not have an accessible name
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; ; The Places search box does not expose an accessible name to assistive technologies.  By contrast; the main web search box has an accessible name of Search.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open Inspect32.exe; 2. Open Places; 3. Set focus to Places search box; ; ; Actual Results:  ; Inspect32 shows accessible name = ; ; Expected Results:  ; Inspect32 shows a useful accessible name; such as Search bookmarks and history (if that option is selected) or Search <collection name> if Current collection only is selected.

Title: initialization of places services can fail in error conditions
Description: The history observer is registered at the beginning; which will be left dangling on error. See bug 327331 for the history service version.

Title: Increasing font size in Places results in uglyness.
Description: 1. New Profile; 2. Open Places; 3. Increase font size a few times with ctrl++; ; Fonts start to overlap; and dates in the calendar disappear.

Title: bookmarks>manage bookmarks should open in new window
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060215 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060215 Firefox/1.6a1; ; mange bookmarks should poep in new window like the tools options too make it look neater or have option too open manage bookmarks in new tab; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: Toolbar customization has changed
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060215 Firefox/1.6a1 ID:2006021509; ; Right click on a toolbar > customize; ; In normal builds; the bookmarks toolbar no longer contains bookmarks; but the text Bookmarks toolbar items; so the user knows what the toolbar is; and makes grabbing the toolbar to move it easy (no bookmarks in the way to drag accidently); ; In Places builds; this text is not shown; which makes repositioning the bookmarks toolbar ackward.; ; Can the old behaviour be restored; or was this a conscious decision?

Title: No keyboard-accessible way to move a folder of bookmarks from one folder to another in Places
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; ; In Firefox 1.5s Bookmark Manager; you can select one or more bookmarks and click Move; which brings up a dialog where you can select the target folder to move the bookmarks.  Places has no such functionality.  The Cut menu item in the context menu is enabled; so I tried cutting the bookmark and pasting it in another folder; but this does nothing -- it neither removes the bookmark from the original folder nor creates the bookmark in the target folder.; ; I also expected to be able to copy (not move) a bookmark by selecting Copy from the context menu; then Paste it in another folder; but this does not do anything either.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; ; Actual Results:  ; Inspect32

Title: Items in Places results list do not have accessible names
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Note: this is not always reproducible.  Sometimes all of the items work as expected; sometimes none of them work as expected.  Once -- I am not making this up -- the first 8 items in the list showed blank accessible names; and starting at item 9 the accessible names were correct (but arrowing back up to item 8 still showed a blank accessible name).; ; ; Reproducible: Sometimes; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open Inspect32; 2. Open Places; 3. Search for something within your history/bookmarks; 4. Tab to results list; 5. Inspect32 shows items accessible name =     ; 6. Arrow up and down to see identical results for other items in results list; ; Actual Results:  ; Accessible name is blank; ; Expected Results:  ; Accessible name is combination of all columns in selected row of results pane (page title + URL + visited date + page count)

Title: Components of Places calendar widget do not expose proper accessible roles
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060214 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Basically; everything is implemented as a xul:label; and not overridden with DHTML Accessibility roles; so everything is exposed as role=text.  This includes the previous/next month buttons (should be role=pushbutton; or better yet; use actual buttons); the calendar itself (should use DHTML Accessibility to set role=wairole:spreadsheet); the day-of-week header cells (should be role=wairole:columnheader); and the calendar day cells (should be role=wairole:gridcell).; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: Too many history items on imported profile
Description: When I look into Places History; I not only see http://www.nu.nl/; but also:; http://www.nu.nl/aex/index.phtml?part=chart_aex_klein.asp; http://www.nu.nl/radio/radio.html etc.; and the latter two are too much and superflous. They make the historylist too long. Need to scroll a lot.; For me it looks a bit like the Adblock Blockable Elements window.; Previously only http://www.nu.nl/ was in my history list so I had to delete only that address if I wanted to cleanup the history. Now I need to do three clicks.

Title: Star button not on default toolbars
Description: Since the Star and Feed buttons became customizable (by bug 322989 ?); they do not appear on the default toolbar setup of a new profile (nor on existing profiles but thats less surprising) and must be added manually.; ; A related issue is that in the Customize Toolbars UI; the Star and Feed items have no icons (but they do appear when dragged to a toolbar).

Title: Certain characters (&) in bookmark toolbar names not migrated to Places
Description: If you have bookmarks in your bookmark toolbar with certain characters; ie &; these characters are stripped during migration to places.; ; Steps to reproduce:; (1) Open a non-Places build with a clean profile.; (2) Create a bookmark in your toolbar to www.aldaily.com named A & L.; (3) Open a Places enabled build.; ; Actual results:; The bookmark is now named A L.; ; Expected results:; The bookmark would remain named A & L.

Title: Places toolbar appears in windows that should have no toolbars
Description: Most pop-up windows are meant to be displayed without toolbars.  The Places toolbar; however; will always appear in these windows.; ; Steps to reproduce:; (1) Go to cnn.com for the first time.; (2) Allow popups.; (3) Refresh the page to see the popup.; ; Actual results:; The popup is displayed with the Places toolbar at the top (cut off horizontally).; ; Expected results:; The Places toolbar should be hidden as well.

Title: Places History Visit Count not Persisted
Description: I am going to become addicted to Place/History pane. However; it will make that pane much more useful to me if I can sort by Visit Count AND have it Persisted so it remembers that sort the next time I restart Firefox. Right now it forgets it.

Title: Heuristics for tab ownership need tweaking
Description: STEPS TO REPRODUCE;    1. Open several tabs; and select one in the middle to use as a test tab.;    2. Go to a page; such as GMail; that youll be working from.;       Read an e-mail that asks you a question about goats.;    3. Ctrl+T (new tab).;    4. Do a search for goat.;    5. Follow a link to learn about goats.;    6. Ctrl+W (close tab).;       CHECKPOINT A.;       Finish replying to that e-mail.;       Decide youre going to start something new.;    7. Ctrl+T (new tab).;    8. Alt+Home (home page); or go to; e.g.: http://damowmow.com/portal/;    9. Ctrl+Click a bunch of links to open tabs in background.;       Youre now going to read those tabs.;   10. Ctrl+W (close tab).;       CHECKPOINT B.; ; EXPECTED RESULTS;    At checkpoint A; you should be at your test tab.;    At checkpoint B; you should be at your first newly opened tab.; ; ACTUAL RESULTS;    At both checkpoints; you are at your test tab.

Title: Failure when deleting RSS field (folder)
Description: I subscribed to the RSS feed from www.aldaily.com; then tried to delete it.  First from the chevron (which failed; bug 327585) and now from the Places page.  The feed appeared with a twisty; so I just deleted the whole row; without expanding.  Oddly; the actual bookmark remained in its place (although the container was deleted).  Trying to delete the actual bookmark produced an actual alert prompt.  Since the text was not copyable; I took a screenshot which will be available for awhile at http://www.nd.edu/~jminta/mozilla/Screenshot-1.png

Title: Only one places tab per window
Description: It is currently possible to have more than one places tab per window. When clicking on a places entry point Firefox should attempt to activate the places tab and then if it does not exist it should create one.

Title: Cant delete history entries
Description: In the places view there is no response to pressing the delete or backspace key. When right click on a history entry Delete is greyed out.; ; When autocompleting in the location bar; selecting an entry using the up/down arrow keys and then pressing del does remove the entry; but only until you start autocompleting again.; ; This was observed with a DIY 1.8branch build (checkout Wed Feb 22 02:35:54 PST 2006).

Title: last visit pref setting should move to AddURI
Description: It doesnt make sense to do this from AddVisit since we dont know that were adding the most recent visit.

Title: Update chrome uris for new icon locations
Description: Now that the browser shim is gone and the icons have been renamed; the browser.css and nsLivemarkService.cpp files need to be updated to reflect the new chrome uris of the icons.

Title: Customize... window is missing items; disables all menus on close.
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060302 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060302 Firefox/1.6a1; ; See summary.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Right-click a toolbar; choose Customize...; 2.Close the Customize window.; 3.; ; Actual Results:  ; Many toolbar items are missing; closing the window disables all menus on the menubar.

Title: Re-enable favicon expiration checks
Description: I believe were wasting a lot of time loading favicons into the database. I think we should uncomment the code in nsFaviconService::SetAndLoadFaviconForPage so that we dont reload favicons until they expire. This way; we will not have to load the favicon (probably from the cache; but still...) and stuff it into the database.; ; I suggest we should force an upper bound of like a week for favicon expiration. That way if you get a bad favicon and the site fixes it; the favicon will eventually get fixed. This might be necessary because we dont really know from the cache whether its been force-reloaded; etc.

Title: Location bar drop down history in reverse order
Description: With the landing of places; my location bar drop down history is in the reverse order; meaning the older entires are at the top while the newer ones are at the bottom. This is reverse behavior of non-places builds.

Title: no tooltips in places toolbar
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060302 Firefox/1.6a1 ID:2006030211; ; add some bookmarks to the places toolbar and hover over them.

Title: Places Organizer
Description: Per: http://wiki.mozilla.org/Places:User_Interface#Places_Organizer; ; - Places organizer window; - Requirements too detailed to list; see link for details; ; Menus: http://wiki.mozilla.org/Places:User_Interface#Menus

Title: Bookmarks and Open in Tabs dont work in Bookmarks Menu; but do from Places Toolbar
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060304 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060304 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Simple to see. Build or get a very recent nightly build.; ; Try to use open in tabs from bookmarks menu; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.See details; 2.; 3.; ; Actual Results:  ; Nothing happens; ; Expected Results:  ; opening choosen bookmarks.; ; Related to bug 329266 ?!

Title: Crash @ [nsEventQueueImpl::NotifyObservers] when deleting a bookmark folder via menu
Description: Firefox crashed when I deleted a bookmark folder via the Bookmarkmenu with right-click; delete.; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060305 Firefox/1.6a1 ID:2006030505; ; Donno if this should have been filed under Bookmarks or Places though.; ; Stack Signature	 nsEventQueueImpl::NotifyObservers 21722115; Product ID	FirefoxTrunk; Build ID	2006030505; Trigger Time	2006-03-05 16:26:46.0; Platform	Win32; Operating System	Windows NT 5.1 build 2600; Module	xpcom_core.dll + (0002be0e); URL visited	; User Comments	; Since Last Crash	5473 sec; Total Uptime	5473 sec; Trigger Reason	Access violation; Source File; Line No.	c:/builds/tinderbox/Fx-Trunk/WINNT_5.2_Depend/mozilla/xpcom/threads/nsEventQueue.cpp; line 244; Stack Trace 	; nsEventQueueImpl::NotifyObservers  [c:/builds/tinderbox/Fx-Trunk/WINNT_5.2_Depend/mozilla/xpcom/threads/nsEventQueue.cpp; line 244]; 0x778b0c24; firefox.exe + 0x2e006f (0x006e006f); 0x8932e800

Title: Cant drag link to bookmarks-menu
Description: Since Bug 329065 is fixed; I can drag a link into the bookmarks-menu; but not onto the Bookmarks-menu.; The usual behaviour was; that a link; dragged onto the Bookmarks label; became a bookmark automatically. You could find the new bookmark on the bottom of the main menu. Now I can only drag the link inside the menu.; With the current behaviour I get a 100% CPU usage as long as my mouse stays on the Bookmarks label and I can see that the browser tries to draw the menu but it fails.

Title: Live bookmarks load way too aggressively (lock up/hang/freeze browser)
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060304 Firefox/1.6a1 ID:2006030418; ; I have a set of 20-ish live bookmarks and they take long to load and lock up the browser.; ; repro:; 1.download bookmarks_history.sqlite.zip; 2.rename your current bookmarks_history.sqlite (profile IMPORTANT); 3.copy bookmarks_history.sqlite from the zip into your profile; 4.open taskmanager; 5.start Firefox; 6.wait till the processorload hits 100% ; this will start after about 10 seconds after the Firefox window has appeared on screen; 7.try to do anything in Firefox; ; result:; - processorload 100% for 15-20seconds; - firefox is dead and responds to nothing untill the loading has finished; ; we had something similar during the run up to FF1.0 ; but Vlad somehow solved that.; ; att. coming

Title: live bookmarks keep on adding data to bookmarks_history.sqlite
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060304 Firefox/1.6a1 ID:2006030418; ; I do lots of testing and restart my browser a lot.; W/o adding a single bookmark; bookmarks_history.sqlite grew from 1.1Mb to just over 2Mb in 1 week time ; History is set to 0 days (browser.history_expire_days = 0); ; repro:; 1.Open FF and set browser.history_expire_days 0; 2.Close FF; 3.download bookmarks_history.sqlite.zip; 4.rename your current bookmarks_history.sqlite (profile IMPORTANT); 5.copy bookmarks_history.sqlite from the zip into your profile; 6.open Firefox and wait for the live bookmarks to load (done after +/- 30 secs); 7.close Firefox; 8.repeat step 6 and 7 a few times (leave 10 minutes between them); ; result:; bookmarks_history.sqlite keeps growing in size; ; expected:; no change in size; with the increase in RSS feeds on the web this is a major problem; loading the bookmarks will take longer and longer every time you start your browser

Title: No apparent way to Reload Live Bookmark (or update livemarks)
Description: Seen on Firefox trunk builds from 2006-03-07; ; -Context click on a Live Bookmark (in BTB or Places); ; Tested results:; no option to Reload Live Bookmark is present.; I also dont see any other apparent way to reload a feed; ; Expected result:; Live Bookmark context click menu should present Reload Live Bookmark just above Sort By Name

Title: After dragging bookmark to folder on bookmarks toolbar; bookmarks-menu does not close after clicking in the page
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Open bookmarks-menu.; 2. Drag a bookmark to the bookmarks toolbar.; 3. Now try to get rid of the bookmarks-menu popup.; Expected behaviour: popup should disappear after a click in the page.; NB: I dont see this behaviour when dragging within the bookmarks-menu.

Title: Automatic Places import adds titles to title-less toolbar bookmarks
Description: I had Gmail; Rocketboom; and Pandora on my bookmarks toolbar without titles (just icons) to save space.  As soon as I started a Places build; the Rocketboom bookmark had gained a title of Rocketboom and the Pandora bookmark had gained a title of I Believe  by  Dee Robert - Find Music Youll Love - Pandora.  Im guessing it got that information from History.; ; I dont know whether Places is changing existing bookmark titles or just adding titles to bookmarks without titles; but either way it shouldnt be doing that.

Title: history.dat; formhistory.dat; downloads.rdf should be deleted when the user clears private data
Description: <Jesse> does history.dat ever get deleted after switching to places?; <Ryan> I dont think so...; ; If not; it could be a privacy problem -- the sites you visited in the weeks before you upgraded to Firefox 2 will be listed on your computer forever; whether you clear history or not.

Title: No confirmation dialog after clicking Clear History
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Menu History -> Clear History.; 2. Everything in History disappears instantly; which is dangerous for I clicked it only by accident; meant to click View All History.

Title: Remove code for old tag-style folder selector in Bookmark Properties dialog (which needlessly set font size)
Description: The properties window for Places sets the font size to 9pt; which totally goes against the point of having standard GUI elements and sizes. I cant even see anything on the dialog that would benefit from a larger-that-Ive-set-my-OS-too font size.

Title: Bookmark Properties dialogs folder selection inaccessible
Description: This is the 2nd attempt; as Firefox (trunk) crashed submitting this the first time. Appologies for this being very brief.; ;  - no border grouping folders within selection widget;  - no indication individial items can be selected/toggled;  - not in tab order

Title: Cant change url (location) of bookmark
Description: STR:; 1. right-click a bookmark in the bookmarks menu; -> properties; 2. change Location field; hit Done; 3. repeat 1; ; Actual: Location reverted to original seen at step 1.; Expected: Location set at step 2 retained.; ; This is pretty impractical when youre making a parametrized keyword query; since the first step would tend to be bookmarking a dummy query; then editing the url for the %s bit.

Title: Assertion Failed copying bookmark from bookmarks toolbar
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060307 Firefox/1.6a1 ; ; Trying to copy a bookmark from the bookmarks toolbar folder pops up a dialog with this text:; ; ASSERT: null node; Stack Trace:; 0:PC_nodeIsFolder(null); 1:PC_wrapNode([xpconnect wrapped nsINavHistoryResultNode];text/x-moz-place); 2:generateChunk(text/x-moz-place); 3:(); 4:oncommand([object MouseEvent]); ; This happened a few times; then went away; now is happening again (I forget what I did in between).

Title: Refusal to delete more than a few bookmarks folders
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Make a new profile with an imported bookmarks.html file.; 2. Then on the bookmarks toolbar folder start deleting folders.; 3. After the second or third folder it stops deleting folders.; 4. Then when I go on attempting to delete some bookmarks on the bookmarks toolbar folder I get a new; never seen error: Assertion Failed.; Ill attach a screenshot of it.; I could repeat this three times.

Title: PLT regressions from places
Description: Places causes page load time to be somewhere between 4% and 9% slower in my tests. It should be as fast or faster as before places.

Title: Warning: reference to undefined property this._activeView.SAVE_SELECTION_REMOVE (delete bookmark)
Description: Warning: reference to undefined property this._activeView.SAVE_SELECTION_REMOVE; Source file: chrome://browser/content/places/controller.js; Line: 1126; ; repro:; 1.open main bookmarks menu (not places:bookmarks menu); 2.delete a bookmark

Title: Make QueryStringToQueries return empty array if there is no input
Cant copy and paste folders in Places browser
Description: Tried repeatedly to copy and paste folders from and to various locations in the same browser but never succeeded. ; This should be possible; for I can even copy and paste folders between two different browsers; e.g. 1.5.0.1 and a pre-Places trunk build.; But copying folders from and to a Places build aways fails.

Title: Add excludeReadOnlyContainers to nsNavHistoryQueryOptions
Description: In order to get back the set of Bookmark folders that you can actually store bookmarks into (and not including the folders that implement tagging); we need excludeReadOnlyContainers and excludeTags options.

Title: Add a copyAnnotations function to the annotation service
Description: In order to change a bookmark URI properly; we need to be able to move the annotations on the old URI to the new URI; and then delete the annotations from the old URI (which we already have a function for).  copyAnnotations should have a parameter which specifies whether to prefer the existing or the copied value in cases where both the source and target URIs have a particular annotation name.

Title: browser.tabs.loadBookmarksInBackground is ignored in places views (histrory sidebar; bookmarks toolbar etc.)
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060309 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060309 Firefox/1.6a1; ; In current builds (trunk or 1.8 branch) bookmarks that are middle clicked are always opened in a background tab no matter what the value of browser.tabs.loadBookmarksInBackground is set to.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Middle click on a bookmark ; 2.; 3.; ; Actual Results:  ; Bookmark is always opened in a background tab.; ; Expected Results:  ; Bookmark should follow browser.tabs.LoadBookmarksInBackground; ; works  2006-03-07-04-mozilla1.8; broken 2006-03-08-12-mozilla1.8; ; ; Bookmarks will open in foreground tabs if browser.tabs.loadInBackground is set to false.  But then middle clicking on web page links will also open new foreground tabs which is not desired (at least by me).

Title: Cant open a bookmark in the Web Panels sidebar in Places-enabled builds
Description: I have bookmarks I have configured to open in the sidebar however places appears to have killed that functionality. ; ; If this is intentional; please let me know so I can stop using Firefox and go back to Seamonkey.

Title: Add Bookmark dialog allows non-bookmark folders to be selected
Description: Currently the Add Bookmark dialog allows the selection of non-writable bookmark folders (though it doesnt actually try to add the new bookmark to them)

Title: Allow only one Places window
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060309 Firefox/1.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060309 Firefox/1.5; ; Currently you can open multiple Places windows. I dont see any reason why someone would want to open another window instead of activating the already existing one. Also; it conflicts with the fact that the window is going be stateful.; ; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: Live Bookmarks; cant edit feed properties/ rename feed.
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; ; When adding a Live Bookmark; or after adding one; it should be possible to edit how the feeds name appears in the Bookmark menu; in Places; and on toolbars.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Go to http://news.yahoo.com/; 2.Add Live Bookmark; 3.Right-click feed; choose Properties; ; Actual Results:  ; Nothing.; ; Expected Results:  ; You should be able to edit the feeds name.; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1 ID:2006011112

Title: Erratic behaviour of New Folder button in Places
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060309 Firefox/1.5; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060309 Firefox/1.5; ; Its a hard to figure out any patterns. I think the key may be whether the profile is new or imported.; ; Heres what I found out:; 1) Imported profile; If no items are selected in the left-hand tree the folder isnt created anywhere; even though the dialogue pops up. If a valid item is selected and expanded in the left-hand tree the folder is created as its child and appears in the right-hand tree.; 2) New profile; The folder gets created outside bookmarks hierarchy; as another root item in the left-hand tree. However; it doesnt appear until you close and open Places.; ; I dont even know which is intended; although I would imagine its the latter.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:

Title: Tree structure (hierarchy) not very clear in Properties window
Description: When you look at the old Add Bookmark window; the structure is very clear; there is no room for any doubt where the folder is located.; In the new Properties window; I find it difficult to discover the hierarchy; I see normal text and bold text and that seems to represent the quantity of bookmarks in it. I think this is not very important. It is equal to me whether the folder is small or large.; The old one (with folder icons) is also more decorative.

Title: Teach Open in Tabs to count to two
Description: Pre-Places; the Open in Tabs menu item only appeared in bookmark folders with two or more items. You could maybe make a twisted case for tab discoverability for having it in a folder with one item; but not for having it present and not disabled in an empty folder.

Title: Buttons missing in Places
Description: I miss the buttons Group by Site; Group by Page and New Folder.

Title: Open in tabs from a subfolder opens the tabs from the main folder instead.
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060310 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Have your bookmarks shown on the toolbar. Have the entries contain sub catalogs as well.; ; Navigate to such a sub catalog; and choose OPEN IN TABS --> result is that in some cases; it opens all the bookmarks from the MAIN catalog; instead of the sub-catalog.; ; Major functionality broken (accessing bookmarks).

Title: ctrl-h does not bring up history search
Description: trunk 2006-03-10-15Z no action on ctrl-h; trunk 2006-03-08-12Z at least aims for places.xul?history; if not with complete success (history collection not selected); ; Expected results: Open places; select history collection; focus search entry.

Title: Get always an error when I rightclick on the bookmarks toolbar and choose Delete
Description: Not that I want to delete the contents of the bookmarks toolbar folder; although Firefox seems to consider it as a folder: it shows the rightclick menu of a folder.; It should delete the contents of the folder; or show another context-menu; whatever; but it should show no error; this looks a bit messy.

Title: Provide bookmark service function for changing URL of bookmark
Description: This would handle migrating annotations; favicons; and conflict resolution. Perhaps there should be an option to just change one instance in one folder or to change all instances of this bookmark.

Title: Shorcut key for GET INFO [CTRL+I/CMD+I] does not work in places window
Description: Open the places window; and select a bookmark. Press CMD+I [on a Mac].; ; With the old Bookmarks manager; this would bring up the properties [Get Info] diaolog; but in the new Places window; nothing happens.; ; I guess this is a leftover from bug 322988?; ; Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060311 Firefox/1.6a1

Title: File > Properties should not be always enabled in Places
Description: The File > Properties menu item in Places is always enabled; even when groups (e.g. for a hostname) or nothing is selected; resulting in nothing happening when clicked. The item should only be enabled if it does something (same as New/Delete on the toolbar).

Title: Duplicate access key on main menu
Description: The check-in for bug 325605 added &History to the main menu.  The H access key conflicts with the pre-exisiting &Help menu item.  The access key for History should be changed; as &Help is standard across all apps.

Right-click; choose New Folder.; Result: the folder is created under the selected folder.; Expected behaviour: should create folder *in* the selected folder.

Title: Places Organizer asserts after moving folder
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060315 Firefox/1.5; ; The Places Organizer displays a corrupted list of bookmarks and can be made to throw an assertion after moving a folder of bookmarks into the Bookmarks Toolbar folder.; ; Seen on both Mac and Linux.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Expand Bookmarks Toolbar folder (see screenshot #2): notice two copies of Firefox and Mozilla Links; 5. Attempt to delete bottom copy of that folder (see screenshot #3); Actual Results:  ; Places list is out of order; moved folder is duplicated; and program gives an assertion. Title: browser horks when attempting to drag and drop a bookmark into the bookmarks menu
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060315 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Seems like some strange redrawing/flickering is happening.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Title: uninstaller hangs waiting for parent process to disappear
Description: I was trying to debug bug 329237 ; but I couldnt get the uninstaller to do anything on my laptop.  After some debugging; it turns out its churning in the loop at; http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/toolkit/mozapps/installer/windows/wizard/uninstall/uninstall.c#137; ; Even though the parent process has exited; OpenProcess() continues to return a valid HANDLE value.  dbradley says this might be because something is holding onto a handle from the process; but I couldnt see anything using Process Explorer.; ; Right now this is 100% reproducible for me.

Title: Switching to History (Last Visit Date) takes very long
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Click on Places icon. The window will take five seconds to appear.; 2. Then click Bookmarks menu and then switch to History again. It will take another five seconds to reappear.; The same history (By Last Visited) in pre Places builds takes only one second to appear (history.dat 3.04 MB). And the second time it appears almost immediately.

Title: sanitize new search format
Description: bug 317107 comment 34 says:; ; >> I appreciate Axels point about there being confusion and likely errors on the; >> part of localizers when creating these files. The best way to avoid that is to:; >> ; >> - use strict namespace checking in the search service and pro-actively throw; >> exceptions when there are failures; >> - use a namespace prefix on the root; e.g.; >> ; >> <moz:SearchPlugin xmlns:moz=http://www.mozilla.org/2006/browser/search/; >> xmlns=http://a9.com/-/spec/opensearchdescription/1.1/>; >>   <ShortName>Amazon.com</ShortName>; >>   ...; >>   <moz:Alias>am</moz:Alias>; >> </moz:SearchPlugin>; >> ; >> since this is what people copy from; and it makes it clear what our extensions; >> are.; >; > If you dont have any objection Id rather leave the format as is for now -; > making ours be the default namespace simplifies checking which type of plugin; > were dealing with. This can be revisited for a2.

Title: Folder title doesnt update in UI when set using nsINavBookmarkService::setFolderTitle()
Description: While adding the ability to edit folder titles in 330023; I ran into the issue that after the title is changed; any UI thats already onscreen isnt updated.  (This happens in both the Places window and the toolbar.)  However; the value is sticking; windows that are opened after that show the correct values.

Upon deleting I received a dialog box with an Assertion Failed error.  It displayed the following:; ; ASSERT: Node QI Failed; ; Stack Trace:; ; 0:QI_Node(null;nsINavHistoryFolderResultNode); ; 1:asFolder(null); ; 2:PC__removeRange([xpconnect wrapped (nsISupports; nsINavHistoryResultNode;; nsINavHistoryQueryResultNode; nsINavHistoryFolderResultNode)];); ; 3:PC__removeRowsFromBookmarks(Remove Selection); ; 4:PC_remove(Remove Selection); ; 5:oncommand([object MouseEvent]); ; After clicking OK it returns to the Places menu with the Live Bookmark still there. I have seen visual errors when browsing files in Windows Explorer but no error has occured when browsing the web with Firefox 1.5.; ; about:buildconfig; ; Build platform; target; i586-pc-msvc; ; Build tools; Compiler 	Version 	Compiler flags; $(CYGWIN_WRAPPER) cl 	12.00.8804 	-TC -nologo -W3 -Gy -Fd$(PDBFILE); $(CYGWIN_WRAPPER) cl 	12.00.8804 	-TP -nologo -W3 -Gy -Fd$(PDBFILE); ; Configure arguments; --enable-application=browser --enable-update-channel=beta --enable-optimize --disable-debug --disable-tests --enable-static --disable-shared --enable-svg --enable-canvas --enable-update-packaging

If I rename the feed; the old name persists until I close and reopen the Organise box.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Create a folder on Bookmarks Toolbar and add a feed to it; 2. Rename the feed using Properties dialogue; 3. Open Organise Bookmarks; 4. Rename the feed (again using right click properties on the feed in the Organise box); 5. Close and reopen Organise Bookmarks; ; Actual Results:  ; Step 2 - feed with name title; Step 4 - old feed name persists; Step 5 - new name appears; ; Expected Results:  ; Step 2 - feed changes to name set in Properties; Step 4 - new name appears

Title: Replace History|Clear history with Tools|Clear private data
Description: The clear history and clear private data commands overlap; we only need one of these commands. The clear private data function should be moved to the history menu where it makes more sense and we can delete the current clear history item.

Title: Location bar drop down history only loads first item
Description: In the recent Trunk builds; the history in the location bar is not fully loaded. Firefox only seems to show the very first history item and thats it; the rest of the list is simply not there. Reverting back to my 3/18 build; this problem does not exist and the proper history items are loaded in the drop down of the location bar.

Title: Provide a way to handle annotations values in a type-agnostic way in JavaScript
Description: Right now; theres no way to deal with an annotation in a type-agnostic way; and therefore theres no way for me to back up all of a URIs annotations from JavaScript (for later restoring).  I need this ability in order to write a proper undo function for nsINavBookmarksService::changeBookmarkURI().

Exit the properties dialog using Cancel; 4. Open the properties again; and close by save changes; 5. Open the properties again; it should now show abcdef as the shortcut

Title: javascript:addSidebar()/sidebar.addPanel() doesnt work anymore
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060404 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060404 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Links using addSidebar formerly added the website to your sidebar. Now they just open a small blank titleless window. Dont know what the final decision is on whether to keep the sidebar code or not; but they should either throw an error message to the user (to let them know they did actually click the link) or create the requested sidebar.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Browse to the above URL; 2.Click the Add Blogupdates to your sidebar link; ; Actual Results:  ; A blank window opens up; but all you can see is the titlebar; which has no title.; ; Expected Results:  ; The page referenced in the javascript should be added to your available sidebars; ; Im assuming this happened around the time Places landed; but not entirely sure.

Title: Lower max favicon size
Description: The Firefox 1.x bookmarks system would not store favicons for bookmarks larger than 16K (bug 252401). Some sites have unusually large favicons which dont get stored properly (bug 258867).; ; The current places system ups the maximum to 32K. However; we now store favicons for every site the user visits. Storing thismuch data is not reaonable and will cause their bookmarks_history.sqlite file to be very large and may degrade performance.; ; We should lower the maximum size for favicons to 16K or maybe even 12K for normal history items. We can keep the size for bookmarked items at 32K or even raise it if some sites have >32K favicons (probably not).

Title: Dragging to a folder item in places fails (bookmarks are lost)
Description: If I drag an item over a row in the tree for a bookmarks folder; I get errors on the console. If the folder being dragged over is open; it tries to insert at index -2 which fails. If the folder is not open; it attempts to get the number of items in the folder; which is not allowed when the folder is closed. It should use -1 as the index in each case.

Title: Form history performance
Description: Form history performance is unknown. Most people seem to think that its OK; but these are developers on fast computers. We need to check form history performance on slow computers to see if it needs some of the caching and preloading optimizations weve been doing for history.

Title: mAutoCompleteOnlyTyped not inited
Description: Valgrind says:; ; ==12185== Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s); ==12185==    at 0x1D65FB03: nsNavHistory::LoadPrefs() (nsNavHistory.cpp:1118); ==12185==    by 0x1D65D30C: nsNavHistory::Init() (nsNavHistory.cpp:333); ==12185==    by 0x1D63366A: nsNavHistoryConstructor(nsISupports*; nsID const&; void**) (nsModule.cpp:84); ==12185==    by 0x1BB31AA4: nsGenericFactory::CreateInstance(nsISupports*; nsID const&; void**) (nsGenericFactory.cpp:80); ; And indeed; the nsNavHistory constructor doesnt initialize mAutoCompleteOnlyTyped and we compare to that random value in line 1118.

Title: Dragging tab to toolbar or bookmarks-menu fails
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. Drag a tab to the toolbar or bookmarks-menu in order to make a new bookmark; 2. The indicator appears but it fails without errors in the console

Title: Show dialog when adding new Live Bookmark
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060404 Firefox/1.6a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060404 Firefox/1.6a1; ; Ability to define default Subscriptions folder (other than Bookmarks Toolbar); ; It seems that new Subscriptions are placed along the Bookmarks Toolbar and cannot be moved. Also; I couldnt find a way to place Subscriptions into another folder.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Go to a site with a live feed (e.g.; http://planet.mozilla.org/) and click on the  Add Live Bookmark icon in the URL bar. (the Feed Folder is added to the Bookmarks Toolbar); ; 2. In Places; try to define another default location for added feeds; ; 3. Try dragging the new Feed folder to another location; either from withing Firefoxs main window or within Places.; Actual Results:  ; 1. Feed is added to the Bookmarks Toolbar.; ; 2. Cant define another default location from Places or Bookmarks menu.; ; 3. Cant drag created Feed folders to anywhere else; neither via Places nor via the Bookmarks Toolbar.; ; Expected Results:  ; 1. Feed added to definable default Feed Folder (e.g.; Bookmarks / Web Content / My Feeds); ; 2. (Easily findable) UI to define default Subscriptions folder.; ; 3. Ability to D&D Subscriptions to other locations (optional; as this might break the seeming all-Scubscriptions-are-in-one-location paradigm).; ; Please fix soon; as my Bookmarks Toolbar is already full! ;-)

Title: Label can crowd out menu buttons
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060409 Firefox/2.0a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060409 Firefox/2.0a1; ; In Places; above the content window; there is a title bar with #contentTitle. When the contents of #contentTitle is too large; it pushes the Save and + buttons off the end of the title bar.; ; See this screenshot:; ; http://img400.imageshack.us/img400/1617/labeltoolong8dn.png; ; This is using normal fontsize.; ; Reproducible: Always

Title: CPU usage grows more and more with each livemark reload
Description: Inspired by Bug 333416 I tried reloading several livemarks but it takes longer for every reload until Firefox hangs for a long time.; ; Steps to reproduce:; 1. Use your own (freshly imported) set of livemarks; 2. Open Places; open Subscriptions; 3. Start reloading livemarks one by one; 4. CPU usage goes higher and takes longer with each reload; ; Ill attach a screenshot of my task manager. Every peak is a reload.; Processor is a AMD Athlon.

Title: Add index value for result nodes
Description: Result nodes should have an integer field that we can use for indices in the case of bookmark queries; and priority values in the case of history queries. This will simplify some of the bookmark handling code and allows sorting by priority in the future.

Title: Tab focus ring should encircle the tab label rather than the entire tab
Description: Currently; the tab focus ring on Mac OS X encircles the entire tab; rather than the tab label; as Safari does and we do on other platforms.  It would fit in better with other apps if the tab focus ring encircled only the tab label.

Title: Disable Insert separator context menuitem when folder is sorted
Description: When the folder is sorted and not its natural order; separators are hidden. Inserting a separator in this view works; but it is not displayed; so it looks like it is broken. Probably the menu item should be disabled in this case.

Title: Put history service DB init in a transaction
Description: The current system initializes everything and then starts the cache; which is required. But this means that every statement we run on startup reloads the data from disk (or the OS cache). If we wrap this init in a transaction; the cache will live between the statements and performance should be better.

Title: Reimplement click-and-hold access to the back and forward session history menus
Description: One side effect of turning off click-and-hold contextual menu access is the lack of support for click-and-hold access to the back and forward session history menus; which is implmented by all latest OSX browsers.; ; We shouid either implement click-and-hold access for all (toolkit/ based) toolbar menubuttons; in the binding level; or specifically for the back and forward buttons.; ; Another issue is what should we do with the current arrow button; options are:;  1. Dont expose it all on Mac; and maybe include a little arrow in the button image itself (mockup in Camino).;  2. Make it so the click-and-hold area is the button itself only; and keep the arrow button alone - opening the menu immediately onmousedown. Thats the behavior in Firefox 1.5.

Title: No default selection in Visible In in Add Bookmark on Solaris
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS sun4u; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060410 Firefox/2.0a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS sun4u; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060410 Firefox/2.0a1; ; Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS sun4u; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060410 Firefox/2.0a1; ; When bookmark something; there is no default selection in  Visible In in Add Bookmark;so it is easy to cause bookmark fail.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1.Launch firefox.; 2.load www.sun.com and select Bookmark->Bookmark This Page.; 3.Popup Add Bookmark.; ; Actual Results:  ; There is no default selection in Visible In.; ; Expected Results:  ; There is a default selection in Visible In.

Title: XRE quits too abruptly when Windows is shut down
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.0.1) Gecko/20060111 Firefox/1.5.0.1; ; If i shut down Windows while FF is running the next time i start FF the session saver of TabMixPlus says that the last session crashed. Nothing unusual can be observed if windows shuts down with FF running. It just exits.; ; The extension developer says the fault is FF not the extension. It seems that FF exits differently if closed manually then if it was closed by windows on shutdown. The extension doesnt have the ability to write to the config that FF was shut down properly like it does if FF is closed manually.; My Windows installation is set up properly so that programs can shut down and take some time to perform closing functions. But as already said; FF exits immediatly so it isnt killed hardly by Windows because it takes too long to exit.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Start FF; 2. Restart Windows; 3. Restart FF; ; Actual Results:  ; Session saver of TMP says last session crashed; like FF didnt exited properly last time.; ; Expected Results:  ; Nothing; since FF was shutdown properly.

Description: On OS X; the Seatch History key is mapped to the old open-history-sidebar command in Places builds.; ; Also; the keyboard shortcut isnt visible in the History menu; this is an all/all bug; unless theres some overlay magic somewhere - no windows box to test on at the moment ;)

Title: Selecting Bookmarks | Organize Bookmarks when the organizer is already open should not change the selected folder
Description: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9a1) Gecko/20060415 Firefox/3.0a1; ; 1. Open the Places window by the menu Bookmarks | Organize Bookmarks; 2. Select Bookmarks Menu in the left tree in Places; 3. Select the menu Bookmarks | Organize Bookmarks in the browser again; ; Actual results:; The Places window shows History; ; Expected results:; The Places window shows Bookmarks Menu; ; ; Its like this for a couple of days (non-Cairo trunk without an extension).

Title: After opening a folder with bookmarks in new tabs; menus are not always closed
Description: Steps to reproduce:; 1. On your bookmarks toolbar open a folder and middle-click on a sub-folder with about 15 bookmarks in it; 2. Release your mouse and wait; 3. It takes a long time before the menus disappear from the screen; 4. and sometimes they dont disappear at all.; Its like Firefox it so busy with opening bookmarks; that it forgets to close the menus. I dont see this behaviour in Firefox 1.5.0.2 or in a recent build without enabled places.

Title: Assertion Failed message when selecting feed or bookmark from left hand plane in places.
Description: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060415 Firefox/2.0a1; Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20060415 Firefox/2.0a1; ; Please see image included for for the exact error message.; ; Reproducible: Always; ; Steps to Reproduce:; 1. Open Places; 2. In the left hand plane; use the + sign by a feed to expand it.; 3. Click on one of the sub-items to get the error message.; ; Actual Results:  ; An error message resulted.; ; Expected Results:  ; No error should occur.

Title: Click-drag-release on bookmarks toolbar folder drags the folder
Description: Firefox 2006-04-16 trunk on Mac.; ; Steps to reproduce:; 1. Mouse down on a folder on the bookmarks toolbar.; 2. Move the cursor down; as if you were intending to mouse up on an item in the menu.; ; Result: The folder is dragged.; ; See also bug 235244; where some people suggest that these steps should result in a drag while holding Cmd (Mac) or Alt/Shift (Windows/Linux) but not otherwise.  IIRC; before Places landed; Firefox on Windows let you drag with either Alt or Shift (Alt because it was standard on Windows; Shift because Alt+click has special meanings to some Linux window managers).; ; Worked correctly in 2006-04-10 trunk (6 days ago).  So this is a recent regression; maybe from bug 332873.

Title: No search results in Places Popup
